loans.name: Sam-Onn

texts.en:
Miss. Sam-onn S., 22, is single and lives with her sisters and brothers and widower father along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Her father has diabetes.

Sam-onn has been a garment factory worker for two years. She is applying for $400 as her first loan to purchase a sewing machine for her sister, who is a tailor.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine for her sister

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien  T. N. is 53 years old. She  has two children who attend university and high school and it is difficult for her to have enough money to pay for their education fees. Therefore, she makes protection gloves to earn her daily income. She has been a SEDA client since 2006 and has repaid her loan(s) very well. She would now like a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy raw material.

loans.use: to buy raw material

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used shoes

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
El cliente Oscar Danilo M. M.. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón Frente Al Centro De Salud del departamento león, tiene 5 hijo a su cargo trabaja actual mente en la alcaldía santa Rosa del peñón desempeña el cargo como Técnico de Catastro.  
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación el cual la quiere mejorar la y el destino del crédito es para la mejora de su vivienda.  
El destino del crédito es para la compra cemento para la construcción de una sala para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en: Oscar lives in the Santa Rosa Del Peñón municipality in the department of León. He takes care of five children and works for the mayor's office as a land registry technician. He is interested in improving his home by purchasing cement for the construction of a room. This will allow him to maintain good living conditions and the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement for a room in his home

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en:
Anunciacion M. is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Anunciacion is a widow and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling blankets, pots, pillow cases and similar products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Anunciacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Anunciacion is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Takku Liggey Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGGEY a été crée le 27/08/2010 jour du 1er financement, il est composé de femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village. Le Groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DAGATH

Madame THIANE G., debout tout à fait à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 48 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait du petit commerce. En fait elle est détentrice d'une boutique où elle vend divers produits alimentaires (riz, huile, biscuits, sucre etc.)

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises afin d'accroitre ses bénéfices

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille tout en faisant l'expansion de son activité commerciale
texts.en:
The solidarity group TAKKU LIGGEY was established on October 27, 2010, the day of the first loan.  The group is composed of women who are all from the same village.  The group is part of the Banc Villageois de DAGATH.

Ms. THIANE G. (at the far right in the photo) is the group's leader.  She is 48 years old, married, and the mother of four children to support.  

She has a small business.  In fact, she owns a shop where she sells a variety of foods (rice, oil, bookies, sugar, etc.)  

Her new loan will enable her to bolster her shop with merchandise in order to increase her profits.  

Her goal is to provide for her family while expanding her business.

loans.use: Developing and advancing her business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan S. N., 37, is a villager in Lekh Pram village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow rice and herbs to sell to support her family. This is the season to grow herbs, but she hasn't had enough money to support it. So to improve production, Mrs. Chan S. N. is asking for a loan to help grow herbs this year. She is a widow with three children, all of whom are students, and they are helping their mother’s business.

loans.use: To grow herbs

loans.name: Abatiganda Group

texts.fr: Médiatrice K. est agricultrice du riz, et elle est un membre du groupe Abatiganda.  Elle a 27 ans, elle est mariée, et elle a un enfant qui a 2 ans.  Elle va utiliser son prêt pour acheter les fertilisantes urées et NPK, et aussi pour la main d’œuvre.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est l’amélioration de l’activité actuelle de l’agriculture du riz.  Elle voudrait accroitre l’activité actuelle, et acheter une maison.
texts.en: Médiatrice K. is a rice farmer and she is a member of the Abatiganda group. She is 27 years old, married and has one child who is two years old. She is going to use her loan to buy urea fertilizers and NPK, as well to cover labor costs. Her strategy for building up her business is to improve her present rice farming activity. She would like to grow her present activity and also buy a house.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and labor costs

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with one child who graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her younger siblings.

She has operated a poultry business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she sells fresh water, which contributes to her other source of income. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a water freezer. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water freezer

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo R. is from the village of Barangay Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 58 years old. Gerardo is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Gerardo plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. Gerardo has been engaged in his business for more than 25 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gerardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield. Gerardo is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP to be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the third loan Gerardo has taken out from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by the business to improve his family's living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 39 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Ibtesam

texts.en:
Ibtesam is a 44-year-old wife and mother of two daughters and two sons. She is married to Maher who is retired now from the Palestinian National Authority.

Ibtesam added a new room to their house. When building the room was over, she needed to do the painting and installing tiles. The cost of the final touches was covered by a loan taken from FATEN.

Ibtesam's husband appears in the picture here instead of her since she is a conservative woman, as are most Gaza citizens, and not comfortable with her picture published online.

loans.use: To complete the final touches of a new room added to the house

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, clothing, rent bill and school fees.

She has operated an M-pesa shop(mobile banking transfer shop) for the past two years.  Her customers are neighbours and passersby. Elizabeth faces a major challenge of competition from other mobile money transfer operators. She hopes to establish her own retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to pay school fees for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her family living standards.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita M. is a 42-year-old married woman who supports her family by fishing. She lives in Daan Bantayan, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fishing business, Rosita is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000. 

Rosita is borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment.  This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. 

Rosita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing for her stall.

loans.name: Efia Constance Antwi

texts.en:
Efia Constance Antwi M. is a single mother from Abrafo village, near Abura. She supports her family and has one child. She sells palm oil. The process involves purchasing palm fruit, boiling it and then extracting the oil to sell. She has been in this business for two years. Efia Constance was educated up to a junior high school level. 
Her dream is to provide her child with a good education. In order to do so, she needs to grow her business. Currently, most of her earnings go towards household expenses. She plans to use the loan to purchase more palm fruit. She will reinvest the profits into her business and start saving up for her child’s education.

loans.use: She plans to use the loan to purchase more palm fruit.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en: Isaack is 28 years old, married and has two children. He has made a living by farming his own plot of land for the last 10 years and earns a monthly income of KES. 4,000. He has a good credit history with KADET and has repaid two previous loans on time. He is applying for this third loan to buy farm supplies and plans to use the additional income he earns to educate his children and expand his farm so that he can provide his family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farm.

loans.name: G.s. Fraternidad Group

texts.es: Sebastiana Del Carmen es casada, su esposo es comerciante, viven 5 personas en su hogar. Ella se dedica al comercio de venta de frutas y verduras como papaya, melones, sandias, mandos, naranjas, repollo, aguacate, bananos y nisperos en el mercado aduce que le ha ido bien en su negocio y ha podido incrementar sus ventas producto, uno de sus hijos le ayuda en este negocio, por lo cual también aporta al ingreso familiar. José Antonio es soltero, tiene 3 hijos que estudian en primaria, se dedica al comercio de venta de frutas y verduras. Su vida ha mejorado ya que he logrado con mis ganancias mejorar mi casa y construir un nuevo cuarto. Maribel Del Socorro es madre divorciada, tiene un hijo y vive con ella. Se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras. El problema principal ha sido la falta de capital ya que le salieron otras cosechas y no las pudo comprar. Pretende continuar invirtiéndole a su negocio.
texts.en:
Sebastiana del Carmen is married. Her husband is a merchant. Five people live in their house. She sells fruits and vegetables such as papayas, melons, watermelons, mangos, oranges, cabbages, avocados, bananas, and medlars in the market. She says that her business has gone well, and she has been able to increase the sales of her products. One of her sons helps her in this business, and so he also contributes to the family income. 

José Antonio is single. He has three children who are in primary school. He also sells fruits and vegetables. His life has improved since he managed to use his earnings to improve his house and construct a new room.

Maribel del Socorro is a divorced mother. She has one son who lives with her. She sells fruits and vegetables. Her principal problem has been the lack of capital, since there have been times when other crops were available and she was not able to buy them. She wants to continue to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy papayas, melons, watermelons, oranges, cabbages, avocados, bananas, and medlars to sell in the market.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab E. is a 57-year-old farmer from village Etseri, West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Tamara, 85-year-old mother and 26-year-old son. Zurab heads a poultry farm. He started it five years ago. He raises on his farm up to 1,000 chickens and sells them to the wholesalers. Also seasonally, he sells grapes harvested in his family’s vineyard (500 wine trees). Tamara is actively involved in family farming activities. Their average monthly income is 800 Laris. Their son has his own small business and earns on average 400 Laris per month. 

The requested loan will be used to purchase of maize for feeding the chickens. The loan will help him to purchase a big amount of the corn at a wholesale price, which will reduce his expenses for feeding the chickens, resulting in increased profit. 

With the increase in profit, Zurab and Tamara will renovate their house and purchase some household items, which will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase maize for his chickens

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old, married to Edward and has two children. She has practised farming in Njabini town for the past 10 years.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting during this season.

In the future, Mary hopes to buy more land and to practise large scale farming and, also, to open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Claude

texts.en: Claude is 29 years old and has three children between two and seven. His wife is a business woman. Claude has sold spare bicycle parts for 10 years. This business enables him to feed his family. He is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts and make more profits.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian, 39 years old, is a married and has three children. The oldest child is 19 years old. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

Lilian is also a farmer working in Surallah, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for five years. She earns 5,000 PHP per month doing farming. Lilian also provides manicure services to the people in her community and she is an Avon dealer.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. In the future, she hopes for her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nerith

texts.es: Nerith, de 51 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Jeremías de 53 años y sus 2 queridas hijas Adriana de 20 y Anaé de 18 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En el cementerio Jardín del Buen Descanso (Cementerio principal de la ciudad de Pucallpa), se encuentra Nerith, ella tiene un puesto donde vende flores, es así que en pequeñas cajitas acomoda sus rosas, claveles, violetas, entre otras flores bonitas y que tiene un costo muy accesible para sus clientes. Lleva ya 10 años en este negocio y le esta yendo muy bien, aunque todavía no se siente realizada como comerciante, por lo que espera del futuro poder tener  una tienda dedicada solo a la venta de flores, de esta manera podrá pagar los estudios de su queridas hijas. Es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que cumplir con sus cuotas y espera poder hacerlo, además que no desea traerle problemas a su banco comunal, donde ha sido bien recibida. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más flores para surtir mejor su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Nerith, 51, is a very kind, hard working woman living in her own house with her husband, Jeremías, 53, and their two beloved daughters: Adriana, 20, and Anaé, 18, that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.

Nerith has a flower stand at the Jardín del Buen Descanso (the main cemetery in the city of Pucallpa).  She arranges her roses, carnations and violets, among other pretty flowers that are at affordable prices for her customers, in little boxes.  She’s been in business for 10 years and is doing very well although she still doesn’t feel fulfilled as a merchant because she hopes in future to have a store dedicated exclusively to the sale of flowers in order to be able to pay her beloved daughters’ schooling.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She is aware that she must pay her installments and expects to be able to do so because she does not want to cause any problems for her communal bank where she’s been so well received.  She will use the requested 500 new soles to buy more flowers to better stock her business and increase sales.

loans.use: to buy more flowers.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. 
Elvina has a retail shop that sells canned goods and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy detergents, beverages & snacks.
Elvina is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elvina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, beverages and snacks for sale

loans.name: Mahliyo

texts.ru: Махлиё жительница города Худжанд. Ей 31 год. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она вместе с детьми и мужем занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычка.
texts.en: Mahliyo lives in the town of Khujand. She is 31 years old. Married, with four children. Together with her husband and children, she does animal farming. She raises cattle for resale. She has been in this line of work for over 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy  a byoung bull.

loans.use: to buy a bull

loans.name: Iza

texts.en:
Iza is from the village of Kvishilori, Imereti Region, West Georgia. She is 37 years old and lives with her 19-year-old daughter, her 18-year-old son and her 73-year-old mother-in-law. Both children are students of a high school. 

Iza is leading the agricultural activities of the family. They have three cows from which Iza produces 60 kg of cheese per month and sells it on the local market. Also, the family has one pig and nine piglets. Piglets are sold locally and seasonally. Also, Iza is busy with wine-making. She makes wine by the grapes harvested from 800 family-owned vine-trees. The total average monthly income of the family, including the pension of Iza’s mother-in-law, is 680 Laris. 

Iza requests credit for paying the study fees for her children at the high school. It is very important for her to allow her children to get a quality education for ensuring their sustainable future.

loans.use: to pay high-school study fees for her children.

loans.name: Mappi Aracely

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Portoviejo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mappi, tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos mayores de edad y la menor de 14 años, todos estudian los mayores un seminario de computación y la menor en colegio, todos sus hijos viven aun con ella. Su esposo es taxista y labora con su taxi propio.

Nuestra amiga es estilista y aunque en su casa tiene un pequeño salón de belleza en el cual ofrece sus servicios de arreglo y belleza aunque la mayor parte de sus trabajos los realiza a domicilio,  ella hace cortes de cabello, tinturados, manicure, pedicura, entre otras cosas, lleva diez años que se dedica a esto y es un trabajo que le encanta realizar.
 
Este crédito es para comprar tintes y esmaltes para su salón de belleza y dos llantas para el taxi de su esposo. Este es el quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que salen los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un restaurante ya que también le encanta cocinar.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the real tamarinds, the members of the communal bank "Nueva Portoviejo" (New Portoviejo) have a meeting every two weeks.

This is where we meet Señora Mappi.  She is 49 years old, married and with her husband has three children.  Two are grown and the youngest is 14 years old.  All of her children are in school.  The two oldest study in a computing seminar, and the youngest is in high school.  All of them still live with her.  Her husband in a taxi driver who works with his own taxi.

Our friend is a stylist and although she has a small beauty parlor in her home, where she offers her styling and beauty services, the majority of her work is done at her customers'  homes.  Señora Mappi offers hair cuts, tinting, manicures and pedicures, among other services.  She has made her living in this way for ten years, and it's a job she loves to do.
 
This loan is for the purchase of dyes and nail polish for her beauty parlor and two tires for her husbands' taxi.  This is Señora Mappi's fifth cycle in the communal bank, and she likes it because of how quickly she gets her loans.

Señora Mappi's dream is to have a restaurant, since she also loves to cook.

loans.use: to purchase dyes, nail polishes and two tires.

loans.name: Rosa Areli

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su esposo y un hijo, ella aprendió  negocio de la medicina por su esposo, quien le enseño los precios, hoy en día trabaja de forma ambulante, no tiene horario fijo, y a través de sus ventas ha logrado mantenerse y apoyar a su hogar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicina, antibióticos, analgésicos, vitaminas y más,  toda esta mercadería es necesaria para ofrecer a los clientes, dando un buen servicio y teniendo para cada enfermedad un medicamento.
El objetivo de ella es tener un local bien establecido, incrementando sus ganancias y apoyando a su familia
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her husband and one child. She learned the medicine business from her husband, who taught her. She currently sells in street markets and has no fixed schedule. Through her sales she has been able to maintain herself and help support the household. 
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of medicine, antibiotics, painkillers, vitamins and more. She needs all of this merchandise to offer to her customers, providing a good service and having a medicine for every illness.
Her goal is to have a well-established store, increase her income and support her family.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, painkillers and vitamins for sale.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 46 años, se destaca por ser una mujer alegre y muy dinámica, convive con su pareja, con quien tiene tres hijos de 28, 9 y 3 años. Juntos habitan casa de su madre en compañía de ella. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de comida y de pasamanería, ambos negocios lo realiza en el mercado “La hoyada”. Es así que su labor inicia desde muy temprano, que junto a su pareja se dirigen a su espacio donde expende la comida; por las mañanas, desayunos y por las tardes, almuerzos. Y en otro stand, vende productos de pasemanería. Tiene 10 años haciendo las misma actividad, y cada día mejora, por ello espera arreglar el piso de puesto de comida y dar mayor comodidad a sus consumidores. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, siempre le gustó desde muy niña, además gracias a ellos tiene buenos ingresos económicos. Este será el décimo crédito con MFP, y asegura que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos, materia prima para la preparación de alimentos, asimismo comprará pasamanería para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Inés, age 46, is a happy and very dynamic woman. She lives with her partner, with whom she has three children ages 28, 9 and 3. They live together in her mother's home with her mother. Ines sells food and braided items. She runs both businesses in the "La Hoyada" market. She starts work very early in the morning; she and her partner go to their canteen, where they sell breakfasts in the mornings and lunches in the afternoons. At the other stall, she sells braided products. She has been doing this for ten years, and every day is better. So, she hopes to fix up her canteen and provide her customers with greater comfort. She has always enjoyed cooking, even as a young child. Thanks to her cooking, she  makes a good income. This will be her tenth loan with MFP, and she promises to be punctual with the payments of her quotas. With the requested loan, she will purchase products, basic ingredients for making her food, and braided items to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients and corded products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a furniture-making machine.

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 42 and has two children.  

She and her husband have been earning a living by operating a store from the door of their house for the past two years. They sell a variety of soft drinks and fruit juice.

Le would like to borrow money to expand her current business by purchasing a greater quantity and variety of soft drinks to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing soft drinks and fruit juices to sell.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 60 years old. She is married to Daniel. Together they have three children, ages 10, 19 and 20. She sells GNLD products and has been in this business for the past five years. She gets a monthly income of KES 20,000 from the business.

This is her first loan with KADET. She will use the loan amount to buy GNLD drugs for resale. She will use the anticipated profit to meet her family's needs and reinvest in the business. Her dream is to establish herself in the business and fully meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es: Alexander, de 30 años es un hombre soltero y trabajador. Vive en compañía de su mamá a la que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Tambo. Todas las mañanas se levante muy temprano, pues tiene que trabajar con su auto trasportando a la gente a diferentes lugares de la ciudad. Lo que más le gusta a él es tener su propio trabajo, velando por su progreso y desarrollo. Además lo ayuda a solventar los gastos del hogar, pues aunque sea soltero, ayuda a sus padres y hermanos. Por esa razón trabaja sin descanso, incluso durante toda la noche, en especial los fines de semana, donde tiene mayores ganancias. Ahora el desea mejorar la calidad de su auto, pues ello le ayudará a no gastar en repuestos y demás problemas que aquejan al funcionamiento de su carro. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “rompiendo fronteras” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde esta contenta, porque tendrá apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Alexander de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero en cambiar a gas su auto que funcionaba a petróleo y de esa manera minimizar gastos.
texts.en:
Alexander, 30, is a single, hardworking man.  He lives with his mother who he cares for in his own house located in Tambo District.  He rises very early every morning because he works transporting people to various parts of the city.  What he likes best is having his own business, seeing to its progress and development.  Besides, it helps him cover household expenses because even though he’s single, he helps his parents and siblings.  Because of this he works tirelessly sometimes through the night and especially on weekends when profits are greater.  Now, he wants to improve his car’s quality and save on replacement parts costs and other problems that his car’s having.  

He belongs to the “Rompiendo Fronteras” communal bank and this is the second MFP loan.  He is happy because he’ll have financial support and will feel surer of advancing with his work.  He promises to make his installment payments.  He enjoys being part of his association because all the members are responsible, very mutually supportive people.  If Alexander were to receive your support he will use the money to convert his car from gasoline burning to natural gas burning to reduce costs.

loans.use: to convert her car's engine from gasoline to natural gas.

loans.name: Ruth Estela

texts.es: La señora Ruth es cliente antigua de emprender, se dedica a la confección  de vestidos de novia junto a su esposo el Sr. Zenón, la Sra.  Ruth y su esposo tienen dos hijos, un varón y una niña ambos en edad escolar. Ruth y su familia viven en la zona de Kupini que esta ubicado a veinticinco minutos del centro de la ciudad. Ellos se dedican a la confección de vestidos desde hace mas de quince años y actualmente tiene dos tiendas donde costuran y venden los vestidos de novias, estas tiendas están ubicadas en la zona gran poder. Uno de sus mayores anhelos es apoyar sus hijos para que lleguen a ser profesionales y también poder ampliar su negocio. En esta oportunidad ellos solicitan el préstamo de dinero para la compra de telas para realizar los vestidos de novias, ya que estas fechas tienen gran demanda de vestidos por la cantidad de matrimonios que se celebran en estas fiestas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Ruth is a longstanding Emprender client; she manufactures bridal gowns with her husband, Zenón.  Ruth and her husband have two children, a boy and a girl, who are both school aged.  Ruth and her family live in the Kupini zone located twenty-five minutes from downtown.  They have been making wedding gowns for over fifteen years and currently have two stores where they make and sell the wedding gowns.  The stores are located in the Gran Poder zone.  One of her greatest wishes is to support her children until they are able to become professionals and also to be able to expand the business.  

On this occasion they are asking for the loan of money to buy fabric to make wedding gowns because demand is very high because of the large number of weddings that take place during the end of year festivities.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make bridal gowns.

loans.name: Etibarkhan

texts.ru: Этибархан 53 года,  растит одного сына. В поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2006 году Этибархан начала свой бизнес в торговле орехами и сухофруктами, использовав в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS).  Взяв в аренду торговое место на рынке, Этибархан приложила все усилия для развития бизнеса и добилась успехов – она является одним из ведущих поставщиков и продавцов сухофруктов на местном базаре. На сегодняшний день, ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, поэтому Этибархан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS). Закуп товаров позволит ей расширить ассортимент, увеличить количество клиентов и повысить продажи.  В будущем, Этибархан планирует дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Etibarkhan is fifty-three and is raising one son.  In search of a source of income for the family, she started a business  in 2006 selling nuts and dried fruit with starting capital of 10,000KGS. After leasing space at the market, she put all her energy into developing the business and achieved success.  She became one of the leading suppliers and vendors of dried fruit at the market.  At present Etibarkhan doesn't have a wide enough assortment of items, so she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 110,000KGS.  Buying inventory will allow her to widen her selection, enhance the quality of her clientele and boost sales.  In the future she plans to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase a wider variety of goods.

loans.name: Ukuri Group

texts.fr:
Isaac  fait partie du groupe Ukuri. Il a 37 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 3 à 14 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Isaac est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionne du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Isaac voudrait agrandir la surface de culture en achetant d’autres champs. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Isaac is a memeber of the Ukuri group. Il is 37 years old and is married with five children ranging in age from 3 to 14, four of whom are in school. He has had six years of primary schooling.

Isaac grows rice. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizer.

His strategy for improving the size of this business is to grow exceptional rice. In the coming years, Isaac would like to increase his cultivation area by buying other fields. With his profits, he would like to ensure that his children receive an education.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Danilo Xavier

texts.es:
Danilo es una persona tranquila, trabajadora y con ganas de seguir adelante, es soltero vive solo en la ciudad de Ibarra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Danilo trabaja con un ayudante en una carpintería, es su segundo crédito con Fodemi, el mismo que va a utilizar en la compra de maquinaria nueva para lacar sus productos, inversión que beneficiará a la calidad de su producción lo que producirá un incremento en los pedidos, ventas e ingresos económicos y así permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y podrá ayudar a otras personas brindando trabajo.

El sueño de Danilo es tener una familia y tener su propio taller ya que actualmente está arrendando y no tiene buenas utilidades.
texts.en:
Danilo is a quiet, hardworking person eager to get ahead. He is single and lives alone in the city of Ibarra in the Imbabura Province.
 
Danilo works with an assistant in a carpentry workshop. This is his 2nd loan with Fodemi which he will use to buy a new machine to varnish his products, an investment that will benefit the quality of his products. This in turn will increase the number of orders, sales and income and allow him to improve his quality of life and offer others the possibility of employment.

Danilo's dream is to have a family and own his own workshop as he is currently renting and he doesn't make good profits.

loans.use: to buy a new varnishing machine as his current machine is in bad condition.

loans.name: Juana Luz

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer valiente y luchadora, tiene 52 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 3 hijos, los 2 primeros son mayores y están casados por lo que ya no viven con ella, pero si vive con ella la menor de todos que tiene 12 años de edad y cursa el primer año de educación secundaria, es la adoración de Juana por ser la menor y porque ella es quien la acompaña siempre por ello la quiere mucho y es por eso que lucha incansablemente  por salir adelante.

Juana se dedica  a la venta de cerveza y bebidas gaseosas , viene trabajando en este negocio aproximadamente hace 2 años, ella se esfuerza tanto para que su negocio le vaya bien,  que lo fines de semana trabaja hasta las 5 de la mañana ya que a esta hora puede vender mucho mas y tiene más pedidos de sus productos, ella se animo a tener esta clase de negocios ya que veía que se podría tener muy buenos ingresos que la ayudaran con lo que necesitaba para su hogar.

Juana está muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado por los prestatarios Kiva ya que con esta ayuda ella podrá construir un baño para su negocio para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, asimismo podrá ayudarla también para comprar más mercadería para su negocio ya que no solo quiere vender cervezas y gaseosas sino que también desea comprar dulces para vender, con ello podrá ver crecer aun mas su negocio para bien de su familia lo que lo ayudará a cumplir su más anhelado  sueño: “Tener una Bodega para no tener que atender a los clientes hasta muy altas horas de la noche”.
texts.en:
Juana, 52, is a courageous and hard-working woman.  She is a widow with 3 children, 2 of whom are married and live apart.  Her youngest child, a 12-year old girl, just started middle school.  She is the light of Juana's life because she is the youngest and she goes everywhere with her mother.  Juana loves her daughter dearly and works hard to give her the best life possible.  

Juana makes a living selling beer and soft drinks.  She started the business 2 years ago and her efforts have paid off because the business is successful.  She works until 5:00 in the morning on weekends because that's when there's the most demand.  She decided to start the business because she saw that she could make a good income from it and she knew that that it would allow her to better provide for her daughter.  

Juana is very grateful for the support that she's received from Kiva lenders because she can now build a washroom for her business and make the space more comfortable for her customers.  She will use the rest of the loan to buy merchandise that she will resell.  She wants to sell snacks in addition to the beer and soft drinks that she sells now.  Adding more products to sell will help her meet her goal of "having a shop so that I no longer have to wait on customers at all hours of the night".

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a washroom for her business and to stock the business with merchandise that she will resell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora María es de la ciudad de Concepción, viven en la casa de su tia con su mama hace más de 6 años, cuidan la casa de su tía, ya que esta esta trabajando en Argentina.
La señora María tiene su  negocio de ventas de mercería hace más de 2 años,  su mama tiene una verdulería, tiene su puesto en el mercado municipal. Comenta que gracias a su mercería donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser zapatillas, ropas, artículos para regalos y demás, ha podido ayudar en los gastos del día a día y salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatillas, prendas, artículos para regalos y demás productos, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. María is from the town of Concepción. She and her mother have lived in her aunt’s house for more than six months. They look after the house while her aunt is away working in Argentina.

María has had a stall for over two years in the local market; her  mother runs a fruit and vegetable stall. María is grateful to have her stall where she sells products such as shoes, clothing, and gift ware, as she has been able to cover daily expenses as well as make progress in life. She is seeking a loan to buy shoes, clothing, giftware and other products so that she’ll have a greater variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, giftware etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 56 years old and married to a businessman. They have 4 children, whose ages range from 21 years to 36 years. She describes herself as an industrious woman. She operates a pig farm where she sells pigs and pork. She has been involved in this business for 14 years. Her business is located in a viable and busy area. Her customers are schools. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ten piglets. Sarah's business goal is to run a pork butcher shop within 5 years. Sarah hopes that, in the future, she will be the area's leading supplier of meat.

loans.use: to purchase ten piglets.

loans.name: Mariama's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été crée le 29 décembre 2009. Il est composé de membres habitant la même commune et entretenant de bons rapports entre elles. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce. 

Assise à droite de la photo et levant la main, Astou l'emprunteur en vedette est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'un garçon. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va se ravitailler en denrées alimentaires à Kaolack et revendre à Gossas où elle tient un étalage devant sa maison. 
Elle achète le kg de piment à 2400 f, le kg de poivre à 4300f , le paquet de bouillon jumbo à 2000f, le seau de bouillon "tem tem" à 3000 frs. 

Avec les bénéfices tirés de son activité,  elle améliore les conditions de vie de sa progéniture , accroît le niveau de ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This Banc Villageois was created on December 29, 2009. Its members live in the same commune and get along nicely. Their main business activity is small trade. 

The featured borrower for this group is Astou, sitting on the right in the photo and raising her hand. She is a 60-year-old married mother of one boy.  

She will use this loan to stock up on foodstuffs in Kaolack for resale in Gossas where she has a stall in front of her house. She will buy one kg of hot peppers for 2,400F, one kg of ground pepper for 4,300F, one large package of bouillon for 2,000F, and a bucket of "tem tem" bouillon for 3,000F.  

With the profits earned through her activity, she plans to improve her child’s living conditions and to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs (hot peppers, salt, pepper, garlic, bouillon, etc.) at the Kaolack market for resale in Gossas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his pay phone business

loans.name: Tchomagnan

texts.en:
Tchomagnan A. was born in 1972 in Afagna-Gléta. After attending school, he moved to Dévémé, where he lives now, to be with his father. Married with three children, he makes ends meet by raising pigs. He has a good reputation, is very successful and changes the types of pigs he raises every two years.

He is requesting a $850 loan to purchase a more productive pig species, increase the size of his pens and stock up on feed. This will increase his earnings and give him real control over his life.

Translated from French by Robert Pokorney, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur A. Tchomagnan est né 1972 à Afagna-Gléta. Après son cours moyen, il rejoint son père à Dévémé où il vit actuellement. Marié et père de trois (03) enfants, Monsieur A. arrive à subvenir à ses besoins à partir de son petit élevage de porcins. Cette activité fait de lui, l’ami des consommateurs de cette viande. Chaque 2 ans, il change les espèces de ces porcs. Aujourd’hui, il possède une grande expérience qui lui confère une tranquillité et une réussite parfaite.

Monsieur A. Tchomagnan sollicite un crédit de $850 pour s’acheter une nouvelle espèce de porcins plus productive, étendre son enclos d’élevage et s’approvisionner en provenderie. La réalisation de ce projet pourra l’amener à augmenter ses revenus et se prendre en charge véritablement.

loans.use: Increase size of pig pen, buy a new species of pig, and stock up on feed

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine A. is 42. She is married and has 4 children. She lives with her family in Yopougon, a township in the north of Abidjan.

Madeleine has sold cosmetic products since 2003 after she lost her position as secretary clerk in a government agency. Madeleine enjoyed her first loan from AE&I in February 2004 ($450), which helped her to build a container as a shop. Madeleine A. now wants to expand her activities in head dressing and would like to acquire a ladies hairdressing-table and helmet. With the revenue generated from her activities, Madeleine has strongly participated in the education of her children.

loans.use: Madeleine Ayeli will use the loan to buy a ladies hairdressing-table and helmet.

loans.name: Angélica Maria

texts.es:
"I have over 19 years experience in the business of hardware stores. My husband and I work together, and this business has been our family's main source of income. We have three children and have given each of them an education. Two of them are enrolling in a university, and it is a huge expense. We are requesting a loan of $1200 dollars so that we can buy more merchandise and have a greater inventory, so that we can increase our income.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Tengo ya mas de 19 años con el negocio de ferretería en el trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Este negocio a sido el sustento de muestra familia ya que tenemos 3 hijos los cuales les hemos dado los estudios necesarios. Dos de ellos entran a la universidad y ya es un gasto muy grande estamos solicitando un préstamo de $ 1,200.00 dlls. Para comprar mas mercancía y así tener mas inventario y mas ingresos.

loans.use: Supply more hardware merchandise

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Mrs. Julie O. is 60 years, she is from Benin City, married and has eight (8) children,. She sells provisions and drinks in her store, she hope to get the loan of US$ 475 to improve her business by buying more drinks and provisions for resale. She has been working with LAPO since 2003 and has been in business for the past 12 years.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Soussou

texts.fr:
Mr. Soussou B. was born on June 13, 1980 in Tsékpo, Togo. Single and without children, Mr. B. is a very dynamic and hard-working young man. After secondary school, he decided to learn to be a carpenter because he has a creative urge and no money to further pursue his studies. He has some plans that he would like to find financing for: he needs wood to build furniture for sale and also tools. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of US$ 600.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Soussou B. est né le 13 juin 1980 à Tsékpo. Célibataire sans enfant, monsieur Soussou B. est un jeune très dynamique et dévoué. Après ses études secondaires il a préféré faire la menuiserie parce qu’il a un esprit créative mais faute de financement, il a des projets qu’il voudrait réaliser : acheter du bois pour faire des meubles et revendre et aussi acheter des outils de travail. Pour cela il sollicite auprès de vous un montant de $600.

loans.use:
purchase of wood and tools for his work

achat de bois et des outils de travail

loans.name: Gulgaz

texts.en: Gulgaz (her sister is pictured) was born in 1968, and lives in the Salyan region, in the Yenikand village. She is a mother of 3 children. 8 years ago she started a farming business to support her family. Now Gulgaz needs a loan of $475 to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Señor Juan José Néftali P. lives in the municipality of Colón, where he started working as a boy in the trade of shoe making with his father, since his father had a shoe shop through which he supported the entire family. Now Nefta, as his friends and clients call him, continues with the shoe shop, and at 67-years-old, he has aspirations of making it grow since he is one of the most sought-after shoe makers in the region because of the experience, reliability, and quality with which he attends to his clients. He tells us that it has been a difficult road that he has had to travel to take good care of his family, and the road of fighting and selflessness hasn't ended for him. He still hasn't completely fulfilled his dream of making his shop bigger and more productive so his children and grandchildren can inherit it. The fundamental purpose for requesting the loan is to buy more materials like leather, glue, heels, lining, etc. He hopes these will make his shop more competitive so he can make his dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Juan José Néftali P. , vive en el municipio de Colón, desde que era un niño inicio a trabajar en el oficio de la zapatería junto a su padre, ya que este tenia un taller de zapatería del cual mantenía a toda la familia, hoy en día don Néfta como le dicen sus amigos y clientes continua con el negocio de zapatería, a sus 67 años tiene aspiraciones de hacer crecer el negocio ya que es uno de los zapateros más solicitados en la zona por su basta experiencia, seriedad y calidad con la que atiende a sus clientes , el expresa que ha sido un camino muy arduo, el que ha tenido que recorrer para sacar adelante a su familia , pero el camino de lucha y abnegación no termina para él , ya que todavía no ha logrado por completo el sueño que quiere hacer realidad y es el de hacer un taller más grande y más productivo, que sirva de legado para sus hijos y nietos , el propósito fundamental de solicitar el préstamo es para comprar más insumos como cuero, pegamento, tacones, forros, etc., que le lleven a ser más competitivo el taller e iniciar con ello, el hacer realidad su sueño.

loans.use: Purchase of materials like leather, glue, heels, lining, etc.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Para Triunfar Group

texts.en:
This committee of seventeen women in the San Pedro neighborhood has been one of the first that have formed. They are entitled, "Women United to Triumph,” and have helped start other similar support groups in the neighborhood. Their goal is to triumph over poverty and help others overcome economic hardships as well. The businesses of these women include convenience stores, tailor shops, hair salons, clothing, cosmetics, and other various merchandise sales.

The loan will be used in the purchase of goods to grow their businesses. Material, thread, buttons, elastic, flour, breads, canned goods, drinks, clothing items, hair and cosmetic products are needed for the women’s businesses. Together they work to uplift one another and increase their profits.

loans.use: To buy clothing, hair and cosmetic products, laundry detergent, body soap, flour, breads, canned goods, and sewing goods.

loans.name: Delsy

texts.es:
Rosario is a young, talented, hard-working woman. She has taken the inciative to acquire her own income and become indepent, despite the big family she comes from, and the financial burden placed on her parents with raising a big family. With her sisters' help, she moved to the city of Hauncayo where she started selling fast food to support herself while studying a few years at a prestigious occupational centre in the city. Her patience and diligence in keeping her sandwich-making counter clean has driven her to ask for a loan to acquire more ingredients in order to increase sales and consolidate her small business.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

Rosario, es una joven talentosa y muy trabajadora, ella toma la iniciativa de emprender su propia fuente de ingreso que le permite sostenerse a raíz de la problemática que sufría su hogar por el numeroso número de sus miembros.Con la ayuda de sus hermanas se trasladó de su pueblito hasta la ciudad de Huancayo y aquí ha decidido poner un lugar de venta de comida rápida para sostenerse los estudios que ha emprendido hace un par de años en un prestigioso centro ocupacional de esta ciudad.La acogida que ha tenido gracias a su limpieza y paciencia para la preparación de estos bocadillos la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de insumos a fin de incrementar sus ventas y consolidar su pequeña empresa.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients to prepare salchipapas (french fries and sausage).

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor Núñez Molas is from the city of Santaní. He owns his own home, acquired through working and saving money. Víctor is married to his wife, Mabel, who is 23 years old. Together they are parents of a child who is just one year old.

Víctor is a confectioner dedicated to the production of sweet and salty candies. He works mornings in a bakery in the city and in the afternoons he makes sweet and salty candies at home. Victor is very well-liked in his area, and has very good sales as his products are in demand. Every day he produces large quantities of candies and sweet breads, which he sells out completely throughout the day. Already 4 years ago he was able to establish a mini bakery in his house, but he wishes in the future to be able to build a retail store in his home to be able to offer his products in addition to other products for sale.

He is now asking for a credit to be able to buy ingredients to prepare his candies, including flour, leavening, flavorings, vanilla, allowed colorantes, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer.

EL Señor Víctor Núñez Molas es de la ciudad de Santaní tiene una casa propia que pudo adquirirla gracias a su trabajo y ahorro. Víctor es casado, su esposa se llama Mabel y tiene 23 años, ambos son padres de un pequeño de tan solo un año.

Víctor es confitero, el se dedica a la producción de confites dulces y salados y trabaja por las mañanas en una panadería de la ciudad y por las tardes se dedica a hacer confites dulces y salados en su casa. Es un hombre muy querido en la zona, tiene muy buenas ventas ya que son muy demandados sus productos, todos los días produce grandes cantidades de confites y panes dulces y son vendidos en su totalidad en el día. Hace ya 4 años que pudo montar una mini panadería en su casa, pero desea en el futuro desea poder montar un salón comercial en su casa para poder ofrecer sus productos además de otros productos de despensa.

El esta solicitando hoy día un crédito para poder comprar insumos para preparar sus confites como harina, levadura, aromatizantes, vainilla, colorantes permitidos, huevos, leche, azúcar, etc.

loans.use: Expansion of Home

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya, age 49, is a widow who cares for her three children, ages 11, 3 and 4. She makes a living by selling food at her small cafe. She works there from 7am to 4pm daily. From this business, which started 4 years ago, she is able to make a monthly profit of about $280.

Hidaya hopes for a loan to purchase more food items for her cafe. She is a member of the Tuwemato loan group. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her small cafe

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou K. was born May 11, 1972 in Kpélé-Elé, in the Kloto prefecture. He is a married father of four children. Since 1995, he has been selling yams, goats and charcoal in the Attikoumé neighborhood, one of the busiest areas in Lomé. He buys goats from breeders in far-away villages and then sells them to restaurants. After quickly repaying his first WAGES loan, he is requesting a second loan to purchase 17 bags of charcoal and 260 units of yams.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur K. Kokou est née le 11 mai 1972 à Kpélé-Elé dans la préfecture d Kloto. Il est marié et père de quatre (4) enfants. Depuis 1995, il fait des activités de vente d’ignames, de chèvres et de charbon dans le quartier d’Attikoumé, une des quartiers les plus animées de Lomé. Il achète les chèvres auprès de éleveurs des villages reculés et les revend aux restaurateurs. Après un prompt remboursement de son premier crédit qu’il a obtenu auprès de WAGES, il sollicite un second crédit pour acheter 17 sacs d charbons et 260 tubercules d’ignames

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and yams

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
More than 10 years ago, Ms. Francisca S. started her general store, which she has been developing little by little. It is now the most frequented general store in the area. With the profits from this business, she has been able to build her small home while at the same time support her children’s education. Because of her customers’ demands and suggestions, she sees a need to expand and develop her general store, thus completely satisfying her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace más de 10 años doña Francisca viene dedicándose al negocio de venta de abarrotes, bodega que poco a poco fue implementando y que ahora se convirtió en la más concurrida de su localidad. Con los beneficios que obtuvo con este negocio pudo hacer construir su pequeña vivienda y al mismo tiempo apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Por las innumerables solicitudes y sugerencias de sus clientes se ve en la necesidad de ampliar e implementar su bodega para así satisfacer completamente a sus clientes.

loans.use: Expansion of general store

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is the wife of M. A. and has lived in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. She is the mother of three daughters, and they are all in kindergarten. Her husband is a mason and has been in this profession for the last 5 years. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy masonry tools (beams, rope) for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members: Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled motor vehicle); Iqbal baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine; and Nazia baji wants a loan to buy thread for her carpet weaving business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Good Heart Kombra Group

texts.en:
This group is called Good Heart Kombra. This is the 3rd loan they are receiving a loan from Kiva through SMT. Previous loans have helped them a lot in improving the status of their businesses and thus their livelihoods.

Having repaid their previous loans successfully, they are now requesting a loan of Le 2,400,000.0 to further expand their businesses. Members of this group are: Kadiatu K., Gbassay S., and Kadiatu J.. Kadiatu is the leader of this group. She is 38, a widow with 4 children. Kadiatu has been selling palm-oil for the past 15 years.

loans.use: Buy more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Elisea

texts.es:
Elisea tiene 50 años. Ella se dedica desde hace algunos años a vender desayunos, para lo cual visita muy temprano por las mañanas a sus vecinas que le compran lo que ella prepara.

Elisea tiene 3 hijos, uno de los cuales aún asiste al colegio, además ya esta por terminar la secundaria. Elisea comenta que su hijo desea estudiar en la universidad,  cosa que a ella le enorgullece, pero le preocupa por los fuertes gastos que eso implica.

El crédito que anteriormente recibió Elisea, le servio para poner un negocio ambulante de venta de ropa, sin embargo ella quisiera poner una jugueria en su casa, para lo cual necesita un pequeño capital para empezar con su proyecto.
texts.en:
Elisea is 50 years old. Since a few years, she prepares breakfast which she then sells to her neighbors during her daily early morning visits. Elisea has three sons; one of them still goes to school and will soon finish junior high school. Elisa says her son would like to go to the University and she is very proud of it; however, she is worried about the expenses this would represent. Elisea had already taken a credit once and she used it to start a little business selling clothes as a street vendor. Now, she would like to sell juices at her house, so she requests a small amount of capital in order to start her project.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Empezar un negocio de venta de jugos y pasteles.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=40845&_tpos=4&_tpg=1

Gertrudis es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Sembrar en quechua. Gertrudis es casada, tiene 39 años y 5 hijos que están estudiando en la ciudad de Ayacucho, Gertrudis es natural del distrito de Pampa Cangallo que se ubica a 3 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Gertrudis tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza algunos días de la semana, Además Gertrudis compra queso en su distrito, que luego lo lleva a la ciudad de Ayacucho, sus ventas lo realiza en los mercados al por mayor, Gertrudis viaja los días lunes y regresa su distrito los días miércoles.

Gertrudis necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite. Los sueños de Gertrudis son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, construir su casa de material noble y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
First Loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=40845&_tpos=4&_tpg=1

Gertrudis is a member of the communal bank Tarpuy. Tarpuy means to sow in quechua. Gertrudis is 39 years old and is married. She has five children who are in school in the city of Ayacucho. Gertrudis is from the district of Pampa Cangallo which is located three hours from the city of Ayacucho. Gertrudis has a store in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables and fruit which she operates some days of the week. In addition, Gertrudis buys cheese in her district and then takes it to sell in the city of Ayacucho. She sells the cheese wholesale at the markets in Ayacucho. Gertrudis travels to Ayacucho on Mondays and returns to her district on Wednesdays.

Gertrudis needs a loan which she will invest in purchasing sugar, rice and oil. Gertrudis dreams of providing her children with a good education, of building her home made out of respectable materials and of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice and oil.

loans.name: Tene United Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata K. and Mabinty K.. They named their group Tene United, named after the home village of the group leader. They are local entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, about fifteen miles from Makeni City in northern Sierra Leone. This is the third time they’ve received a Kiva loan through SMT. Previously, each one in the group received a loan of 500,000 LE. That loan created a meaningful impact in the lives of these people. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Today, they are requesting a loan of 800,000 LE each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Fatmata K. (right) is the leader of the group. She is forty-five years of age. She was born in Sanda about thirty miles from Makeni and forty miles from Magburaka. Marriage brought her to Magburaka town, where today she has her business. She is married with six children. Five of her children are in secondary school and one is in primary school. Her husband is a school teacher in one of the schools in Magburaka. Fatmata sells clothes in Magburaka town market. With this new loan, she will expand on her business. She will use this loan to buy a bale of cotton. She travels either to Freetown or neighboring Guinea to buy the clothes she sells. In Freetown, a bale of wax cotton costs her 1,400,000 LE and a piece of dried cotton costs her 14,000 LE.

Sometimes, within a bale of cotton, there are torn pieces. This brings losses to Fatmata and poses a great challenge to her. Apart from this, she faces no major challenges and likes the business she is doing very much. To Fatmata and colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically with their educational and nutritional needs, as well as putting some money aside for emergencies.

loans.use: To buy at least a bale of cotton for her business

loans.name: Mosi

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Mosi M. from Mwanza. She is single with three children, between the ages of three and 15 years old. Mosi M. has been running a used clothes business since 2006. Her business is selling second-hand clothes from America and Europe, which are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Tanzania to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets and in the surrounding towns and villages. These clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially among the younger generation because of their low cost and the general appeal of anything modern. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Mosi M. currently earns about 300 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 500 USD in order to buy more used clothes for resale. In the future, she plans to open another business. Mosi thanks you for her support! About the field partner: SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provisioning of a leasing and payback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ramiro Juan

texts.en:
Juan is a member of the Trébol (“Clover”) Village Bank. Juan is 39 years old and lives with his partner and their two children. Juan buys used oil from oil-change shops, then brings it to Lima to resell to foundries. Juan also owns a truck, which he uses for shipping. Juan plans to start a new business recycling plastics. He needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy a machine to grind recycled plastics. Juan dreams of starting another fuel recycling business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Juan es socia del Banco Comunal El Trébol. Juan es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 2 hijos, Juan se dedica a la compra de aceite quemado que compra en los lugares de cambio de aceite, luego lo transporta a la ciudad de Lima en donde lo vende, este combustible lo utilizan en los calderos. Además Juan tiene un camión con el cual realiza transporte de carga. Juan tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio de reciclaje de plásticos. Juan necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una maquina para moler los plásticos reciclado. Juan sueña con implementar otro negocio de transformación de combustibles.

loans.use: Juan would like to buy a machine to grind plastics to recycle.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Amalia R. le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior e interior, pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder llevar acabo la mejora. Es por eso que esta solicitando un crédito para poder realizar lo mas pronto posible la mejora y así su casa va estar mucho mejor. 
Doña Amalia es una persona ya mayor de edad tiene poco tiempo que se quedo viuda con ella vive un hijo quien es que le ayudad en los gastos.
texts.en:
Amalia R.' home still lacks the finishing touches on both the outside and inside, but currently she does not have enough money to finish the home improvement. She is seeking a loan in order to do so as soon as possible so that her home is in better condition. Amalia is an elderly woman who was widowed a short time ago; now her son lives with her and helps her with her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the outside and inside of her home

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Маткаримова Шахноза  1985 года рождения, детей нет. Торгует на рынке киноаппаратурой почти 4 года. Сотрудничает почти год в Микроинвест, в бизнесе помогает муж , привозит с Китая аппаратуры и частично помогает жене. Ей необходим кредит для расширения бизнеса и приобретения товара.
texts.en:
Shahnoza M. was born in 1985 and has no children. She has been selling film equipment at a market for almost 4 years and has been working with MicroInvest for almost a year. Shahnoza’s husband helps with the business and brings the equipment from China. This loan is needed for business expansion and purchasing new products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng Y., 40, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband. She sells boiled corn and is able to make around US$ 6 per day. Her husband sells wood and earns US$ 5 every day. This couple has four children and all of them are in school. Leng Y. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport wood.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Djamala

texts.en: Djamala was born in 1965 and is the mother of three children. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied Fizuli region of Azerbaijan, and has re-settled in the Kurdmahmudlu village. Five years ago, she and her family started a farming business. They request a loan of 2000 Azerbaijani manats (or about $2500) to buy seedlings and fertilizer to improve their business. Her husband is pictured above.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Tauia

texts.en:
Tauia A., 32, is married with 3 children. She has many years of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the public and villagers 3 days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).

She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are Tauia’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Buy tools and supplies

loans.name: Thom's Group

texts.en:
Thơm Thị Nguyễn (no: 010117090068) was born in 1966. She has two children with one going to school. Her husband is a painter. She makes steamed rolled rice pancakes to sell every morning. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She is a prestige person and the group leader. She wants to borrow 5,886,000 VND (approximately $335) to buy rice to make cake.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Hòa Thị Hoàng (no: 010117090069) was born in 1965. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately $285) to breed pigs.

Xuyến Thị Đỗ (no: 010117090070) was born in 1987. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (approximately $310) to breed pigs.

Mai Thị Nguyễn (no: 010117090099) was born in 1959. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (approximately $235) to breed pigs and fish.

Khanh Thị Hồng P. (no:010117090098) was born in 1984. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (approximately $235) to buy clothes to sell in the market.

loans.use: To buy rice to make cake

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard S. is a carpenter and driver of a passenger motorcycle. He is 37 years old and has three children. He dreams of having another business to meet all his family's needs. He also wants to send all of his children to college to give them a brighter future.
Richard is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to repair his passenger motorcycle and for enrollment of his children.

CEVI provides financial services to the poor. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To repair passenger motorcycle and for the enrollment of his children

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita B. is from the village of Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Esterlita is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns & operates a business raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the busines

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Sacrifice, love and patience are some of the ingredients to make a business grow, says Erlinda. She manages a general store business in the rural and peaceful village of Dalibubon Jones, Isabela. Her desire to make her business grow motivated her to request a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000. She knows that this amount will help her a lot in making her business more productive.

Erlinda is 41 years old and still single. She manages her business well in order to extend financial support to her parents and siblings. She aims to generate more income from the business and therefore patiently sacrifices even her personal life. She hopes that the lenders will grant her request and help her attain her goals in life.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Tomas

texts.en:
Tomas S. is a 32 year old farmer from Sto. Nino South Cotabato Mindanao. He is a father of three children and a rice grower in their village. He started farming in 1994 using a 1-hectare farm that he rented. His dream is that someday he will have his own farm to till, and he will be able to support his children's education.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will help him grow his harvest and fulfill his dreams for the future.

He is actively participating in the CEVI cluster meetings held every week. He is also happy with the training and insurance coverage provided by CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia P. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Lilia is widowed and has 2 children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising poultry. The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lilia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lilia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda L. D. P. D. 26 años, resiD. en el Cantón el limón ubicado en el municipio D. Soyapango, ella vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos todos menores D. 7 años.
