Ermelinda posee un negocio D. cereales y productos D. primera necesidad, tanto ella como su familia dependen D. las ganancias D. este negocio, ya que su esposo trabaja junto a ella ayudándole a atender a los clientes. Ermelinda solicita un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y poder mejorar sus ventas y D. esta manera los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Ermelinda L. D. P. is a 26-year-old woman who lives in the El Limón canton, located in the Soyapango municipality. She lives with her husband and three children who are all under age 7. Ermelinda owns a business in which she sells grains and basic need items. Both she and her family depend on the profits of this business because her husband helps her attend to the customers. Ermelinda is requesting this loan in order to be able to restock her shop and be able to improve sales, thus improving the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a member of the Amani borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa, She is 30 year old woman, she is married.

Fatuma has owned a food business selling local beer for 4 year, she works 15 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is Fatuma`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for making local beer.


With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Fatuma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more maize for local beer

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en:
Otgonbayar is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent. His two oldest children attend secondary school while his youngest daughter stays at home with his wife.

Otgonbayar owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 2008 and has gained a lot of business experience in a short amount of time. He needs to keep his car in good condition so that he can continue to earn a living. Therefore, he is requesting a 1,100,000 tugrug loan in order for him to make the necessary repairs and to replace parts on his car.

loans.use: To make necessary repairs to his taxi

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es una mujer que siempre quiso salir adelante, tiene 61 años y vive en su casa propia junto a su familia.

El campo le ha dado a Victoria los recursos necesarios para poder mantener a su familia, ella se dedica a la crianza D. ganado desD. que tenía 15 años, actividad que aprendió D. sus padres y actualmente sus reses están muy bien cuidadas y alimentadas, es por eso que en la feria D. Huancane y Juliaca, que es donD. lleva a vender su ganado, sus reses son las más solicitadas por los compradores.

Para Victoria lo más difícil D. su trabajo es tener que llevar su ganado hasta las ferias dominicales, puesto que le es muy cansado y agotador, lleva 30 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta es pastear a sus animales. Para el futuro espera incrementar el número D. aimales que tiene para así poder mejorar sus ingresos.

Este es el segundo préstamo D. Victoria con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que quiere acceder a otros préstamos posteriormente. En su banco comunal es una D. las socias más responsables. Con los mil soles solicitados planea comprar un toro, el cual le costará al rededor D. tres mil soles, para ello pondrá parte D. sus ahorros para alcanzar el monto necesario.
texts.en:
Victoria is a woman who always wants to move forward. She is 61 years old and lives in her own house together with her family.

The field has provided Victoria with all necessary resources to be able to maintain her family. She has been working in breeding cattle for the past 15 years, an activity that she learnt from her parents. Currently, her cows are very well cared for and fed and for this reason, at the fair of Huancane and Juliaca, where she took her cattle for sale, they were the most sought-after cows by buyers.

For Victoria, the hardest thing about her work is taking the cattle to the Sunday fairs, which makes her very tired and worn out. She has been in this business for 30 years and most enjoys grazing the animals. In the future, she hopes to increase her number of animals and thereby improve her profits.

This is the second loan for Victoria with MFP and she is ready to pay her instalments on time as she wants to gain access to subsequent loans. In her communal bank, she is one of the most responsible partners. With the 1,000 soles requested Victoria plans to buy a bull, which will cost her around 3,000 soles. She will combine the loan with some of her savings to reach the necessary total.

Translated from Spanish by Stephen Bayley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a bull

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Zulma, de 24 años, es una joven muy alegre y carismática, vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar en los gastos del hogar.

Su negocio es la venta de utensilios para cocina y comedor, de forma ambulatoria recorre las ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de clientes que necesiten de sus productos, ella es una joven muy empeñosa y no se rinde fácilmente, ya que siente que es hora de apoyar a sus padres con los gastos familiares.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene libertad para decidir sus horarios de venta, lo cual es muy importante para ella, ya que también tiene que cumplir con sus estudios. Lleva 2 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes. 
Para más adelante, espera juntar el dinero necesario para alquilar una tienda y poder vender sus utensilios con más tranquilidad.

Este es el segundo préstamo de Zulma con MFP y está dispuesta a pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal donde es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará más utensilios para implementar mejor el stock de su negocio.
texts.en:
Zulma, 24 years old, is a very cheerful and charismatic young woman who lives in the home of her parents and would like to help with the household costs. She is in the business of selling kitchen and table utensils. She travels around the markets of the city of Juliaca searching for clients that need her products. Zulma is a very hard-working young woman who doesn't give up easily, as she feels that now is the time to support her parents with the family costs. What she likes most about her work is that she has the freedom to choose her own hours, which is very important to her as she also has to complete her studies. She has been in this business for two years and for her the hardest part is having to walk all day to find customers. In the future, Zulma hopes to save enough money to rent a store in order to sell more utensils more comfortably. This is Zulma's second loan with MFP and she is prepared to pay on time, as she doesn't want to cause problems for the members of her communal bank, where she is dear to her other companions. WIth the 1000 soles from this loan, Zulma will buy more utensils to better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, 37 years of age, is a walking vendor in the village of Magdalena, Cabatuan, Isabela. She works in the selling of fish. Her weekly net income approximates $5 daily. Her desire to acquire more income motivated her to request the loan amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish in the public market and sell in her village.

Nancy is married and they are blessed with four children who are in high school and elementary levels of education. She struggles to work hard for the daily necessities of her children, to supplement the family's income, to improve her business and to have a productive life.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.es:
Geraldine M. C., tiene la edad de 21 años, es casada, y no tiene hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de cerdos de cría y arreglar la porqueriza de los mismos. No es la primera vez que doña Geraldine se financia con FUDECOSUR, ella manifiesta que el comité de crédito le ha ayudado mucho y que le brindaron muchas facilidades a la hora de solicitar el crédito. Ella estudia y trabaja en el cuido de los cerdos.
Ella espera que con este proyecto pueda crecer como persona y pueda expandirse y así pueda en un futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor estabilidad económica.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Geraldine M. C. is 21 years old and is married with no children. She seeks this loan to purchase pigs and to set up their pigpens. This is not the first time Geraldine has received a loan from FUDECOSUR. She has said that the loan committee has helped her greatly and has made the loan process very easy. She studies and raises pigs. She hopes that with this project she can grow as a person and in the future have a better quality of life and more economic stability. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs

loans.name: Samaria Group

texts.en: Mary is fifty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coast in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people. Mary is a trader in utensils. She is the leader of a trust bank group called Samaria. The members of the group are mainly traders. The group requests for a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand their businesses. It is their desire to give their children the best education they can afford.

loans.use: To buy goods in bulk to expand businesses.

loans.name: María Esmeralda

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, y vive junto a su esposo, su hija de 20 años de edad y sus padres, ya mayores, en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace seis años, gracias a los ahorros familiares, pudo adquirir una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), con la que brinda servicio de transporte en Cayaltí y sus anexos. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad son de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia.

Debido a lo accidentado de las carreteras que comunican Cayaltí con sus caseríos, el vehículo ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

María desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, en especial de sus padres, que son de edad muy avanzada. Ella es una madre de familia responsable, trabajadora y emprendendora.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old, married, and lives with her husband, her 20 year old daughter and her elderly parents in Cayaltí district, which is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. Six year ago, thanks to her family's savings, she was able to acquire a "mototaxi" (a motorized vehicle used to transport cargo and passengers), with which she provides transportation services in Cayaltí and its annexes. The income she receives from this venture is a great aid to her family's finances. Because of the rough roads that connect Cayaltí with its outlying areas, the vehicle has begun to suffer some mechanical failures that require urgent repair. That is why she needs to request, for the first time, a loan of 500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. María hopes to improve her family's quality of life, in particular that of her parents, who are very advanced age in age. She is a responsible, hard working and enterprising mother.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair and Maintenance costs for a mototaxi.

loans.name: Marvin Calixto

texts.es: Marvin de 32 años de edad, habitante  de comunidad el Zapote, ubicada a 37 km de Nueva Guinea, su familia esta conformada por su esposa y 3 hijos, dos de ellos estudiantes de educacion  secundaria y el menor estudiante de primaria, pertenece a la religion catolica, en las actividades laborales de su finca trabajan en sociedad apoyandose mutuamente, el esta solicitando su primer credito a la institucion de AFODENIC,  el objetivo de  este productor es que esta  financiera le apoye con el monto solicitado para utilizarlo en retencion de ternero y asi esperar que alcancen mayor tamaño y poder obtener mejor precio en los mismos, y que de manera que su venta sea mas rentable, Marvin es un señor  responsable, honesto, trabajador, humilde, su sueño es pagar en tiempo y forma para que esta microfinanciera le siga brindando servicio de credito cuando lo necesite y de esta manera contar con recursos economicos para el sosten familiar.
texts.en:
Marvin is 32 years-old, and lives in the Zapote community (located 37km from Nueva Guinea) with his wife and three children. Two of the children are in secondary school, while the other is still in primary school. He belongs to the Catholic religion and works on his farmland (in a mutually supportive environment) with other members of his community. He is requesting his first loan form AFODENIC so he can continue to raise his calves and ultimately sell them for a higher price. Marvin is responsible, honest, hard-working, humble, and he plans to repay this loan in a timely manner. As a result, he hopes to be able to request additional loans from this microfinance institution, which will provide him the financial resources to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jim Muir, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To raise his livestock (calves)

loans.name: Julie

texts.es:
Julie es socia del Banco Comunal Los Sauces.
Julie es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Julie junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta de caña, producto que distribuyen a diferentes tiendas, su producto lo adquieren en la ciudad de Andahuaylas.
Julie necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de caña.
Los sueños de Julie son tener una tienda de abarrotes y casa propia.
texts.en:
Julie is a member of the communal bank called Los Sauces. She is 42 years old and married with 3 children. Julie and her husband have a business selling cane, a product they distribute to various shops. They buy the cane in the city of Andahuaylas. She needs a loan to purchase more cane. Her dream is to set up a small general store and to have their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more cane for her business

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia L. lives in Pagadian City. She is 55 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Julia owns and operates a butcher shop where she sells meat to local residents. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

Last year, Julia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and her business. She has successfully repaid two prior loans of 9,500 each from PMPC, and is applying for a new loan for 14,000 PHP to buy additional supplies and increase her working capital. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to improve her family's living standards. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies and increase her working capital

loans.name: Zapora

texts.en:
Zapora sells cellphone recharge cards and also provides phone calls. She has been in business for a year but before now she sold bean cake.

Zapora has improved her business since she joined LAPO micro-finance. She is grateful to LAPO micro-finance and Kiva for this wonderful initiative that has greatly improved lives.

Zapora is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more rechargeable cellphone cards to sell and promises to repay at the due-date.

Zapora is 33 years old and is married with four children, her youngest child being 3 years old.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cellphone cards to sell

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette T., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Damaso T., an electrician, and they are blessed with two children. Managing her own variety store for quite some time now, Bernadette makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.

Bernadette has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now, regularly attending their weekly fellowship meetings and paying her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow ten times from CCT’s Cooperative, using the money to expand and improve her variety store.

Now with your help, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan which will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business to buy groceries to replenish stocks and continue the operation of her variety store. Bernadetter dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful so that she can provide for her children’s education.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To replenish grocery stocks and continue operation of her variety store.

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mr. In S. is a 33-year-old married man who currently lives with his parents in a medium-sized house located in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. In S. and his wife were not available for the photograph so his mother is pictured instead.

In S. and his wife take care of two school-aged kids. To feed the family and kids, this couple work as garment laborers and have had this job for years.

In S. has been building a new house in order to live independently with his wife and children but the construction has never been completed due to the fact that he doesn’t have enough money. Therefore, In S. is applying for a loan to help him to finish building his new house.

loans.use: To finish building his new house

loans.name: Elvis Mario

texts.es:
Elvis forma parte del banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”, tiene 27 años y es soltero. Elvis trabaja en la municipalidad distrital de Anta  es asistente técnico de liquidaciones de obras. Ya es un año que trabaja en la municipalidad y le va muy bien. Su actividad económica complementaria es la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes.

Elvis es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su mamá con los ingresos económicos de la familia, el requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes. 

El banco comunal tiene 4 ciclos de funcionamiento, el socio manifiesta, que se encuentra contento y satisfecho con los servicios de crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo de permanencia en el banco comunal.
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Elvis is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”. He is 27 and single. Elvis works in the municipal district of Anta, and he is the technical assistant for finalizing projects. He has been with the town for a year and it's going very well. His complementary work is raising small animals like guinea pigs. Elvis is a young and enterprising worker who is always looking for ways to get ahead, and with his daily effort he helps his mother with the family income. He needs a loan to buy more guinea pigs. The communal bank has been functioning for 4 loan cycles. This member shows that he is very happy and satisfied with its credit services, savings and training for the time that he has been with the communal bank. This member is grateful for the opportunity offered him in this manner, and he promises to fulfill the schedule of payments. The community of Inquilpata is an hour and ten minutes from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elvis needs the loan to buy more guinea pigs

loans.name: Angelo

texts.en:
Angelo P. is from the village of Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. He is 43 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Angelo owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The other source of income for the business comes from raising fish. Angelo has been engaged in his business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Angelo joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Angelo is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will also be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be his third from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Teresita Tagubar Group

texts.en:
Teresita T. is from the village of Canicapan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Teresita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Teresita T. Group.

Teresita is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used as working capital and  to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family's living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
Elida tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito agrícola de Nueva Arica, una zona que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a trabajar negociando animales desde hace mas de dos años, ella compra animales menores a los pobladores de la zona y luego los revende en una feria que se instala todos los dias martes en el distrito de Cayaltí. Esta actividad es muy importante para el sostenimiento de su familia por lo que siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacarla adelante.

Elida desea aumentar sus ventas adquiriendo mas animales para negociar, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Elida es una mujer responsable y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a sus hijos una educación de calidad y ayudar a su madre a obtener una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Elida is 36, married and lives with her husband and children in the agricultural district of Nueva Arica, an area located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. She has worked with animals for over two years. She buys small animals from the local villagers and later re-sells them at a fair that runs every Tuesday in the Cayalti district. This activity is very important for the maintenance of her family and so she always tries to give it her best in order to get ahead. Elida wants to increase her sales through acquiring more animals, so she has requested her first loan of 500 soles with Edpyme Alternativa to help her with this goal. Elida is a responsible and enterprising woman. Her greatest wish is to be able to offer her children a quality education and to help her mother to obtain a better quality of life. In the area where she lives she is very well-known and respected by her neighbours.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Animals to grow and re-sell

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: A. Fati est née le 24 Novembre 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Fati vit depuis une vingtaine d’année au quartier Cocotomey, dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. Fati est une célibataire qui n’a pas d’enfant. Fati vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Fati n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Pour assurer ses besoins, Fati vend divers produits (riz, couscous, mayonnaise, sucre, conserves de tomate, dentifrices, allumettes, etc.)  à son domicile.  De façon secondaire, Fati vend de la farine de manioc. Fati s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et aussi au marché de Cococodji dans la commune d’Abomey Calavi. C’est la deuxième fois que Fati sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un crédit, en vue d’agrandir son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Fati a bien effectué le remboursement de son premier crédit.
texts.en:
A. Fati was born on November 24, 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For about twenty years, she has been living in the Cocotomey district, in the community of Abomey Calavi. She is unmarried and has no children. She lives by herself and is alone in supporting herself. Fati did not attend school. To meet her needs, she sells various goods (rice, couscous, mayonnaise, sugar, canned tomatoes, toothpaste, matches, etc.) out of her home. Secondarily, she sells cassava flour. She gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, and also at the Cococodji market, in Abomey Calavi. This is the second time that Fati has requested a loan from ALIDé in order to expand her business and to satisfy her customers further. She has indeed repaid her first loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 3 boxes of canned foods and 3 sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: B. Rowena is from the village of San Pedro. She is 38 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Rowena owns and operates a business providing boardinghouse rental services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her 9th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Marcenaile

texts.en: Marcenaile O. is from the city of Barra, Dipolog. She is 34 years old. Marcenaile is separated and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Marcenaile makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits in the local community. Marcenaile has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2006, Marcenaile joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcenaile has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Marcenaile is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Marcenaile from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Determined Paul K., 54, is a happily married father of 7 children. Like any other responsible man he tried to find the best means to satisfy his family's requirements, having previously engaged in dairy farming.  

He went into the poultry farming business, where he looks after chickens for egg production and broilers for consumption, and this was done alongside his milk sales. In his home area of Rubumba, Rukungiri, he has a variety of chickens and this makes his business more attractive. With this project, he has been able to capture a good market from shopkeepers and hotel owners who purchase eggs that they prepare for customers. This has seen him earn 750,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.

His main intention for taking up this loan is to help him purchase chicken feed and feeding troughs. This will improve his market supply and also his sales revenue collections as he looks at owning a hatchery project.

loans.use: purchasing chicken feed

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma E. is from the village of Magsaysay, Sibutad. She is 37 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a grocery store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of assorted household items (such as can goods, noodles, sugar). Alma has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital for the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Alma from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To obtain additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señorita Gloria tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, no tiene hijos, actualmente está cursando el 2do. Año de licenciatura en enfermería en la Universidad del Norte filial Itá.
 La señorita Gloria trabaja como empleada en la Boutique Johana hace más de 6 años, es encargada general de la boutique, el ingreso que tiene como empleada la ayuda a abonar sus cuotas de la facultad pero manifiesta que le cuesta mucho cubrir el costa de su cuotas más libros, folletos, derechos de examen ya que cuesta mucho dinero, además ayuda a la manutención de su hogar, y debido a eso recurre a la Fundación Paraguaya a solicitar un préstamo con el que pueda cancelar por adelantado sus cuotas de la faculta y derechos de examen.
texts.en:
Gloria is 27 years old, lives at her parents' house, and has no children. She is currently in her second year of Nursing at the Universidad del Norte's Ita campus. Gloria works has been an employee of the Boutique Johana for more than six years, and works as the boutique's manager. The income she earns helps her pay her university tuition, but she says it is very difficult to pay tuition plus books, printouts, and exam fees, since they are quite costly and she also helps pay for her family's household expenses. This is why she came to Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan, so that she can pay her tuition and exam fees ahead of time.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Staff

loans.use: Pay tuition fees

loans.name: María Yanira

texts.es: María Yanira L. D. B. D. 40 años D. edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y esforzada, la cual vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores D. edad, junto a los cuales vive en el municipio D. Aguilares en el departamento D. San Salvador. María trabaja en su propia tortillería en donD. elabora tortillas D. lunes a domingo con el fin D. poder brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. María elabora las tortillas que posteriormente venD. en su casa D. habitación y que sus hijos le ayudan a comercializar D. forma ambulante por diferentes colonias, esto les permite contar con ganancias extras las cuales son D. mucho beneficio para la familia. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual compre maíz por mayor con el deseo D. poder elaborar mayor cantidad D. tortillas, ya que estas cuentan con una extrema demanda en este país por ser parte D. la dieta básica D. los salvadoreños.
texts.en:
María Yanira L. D. B., 40, is a very hard working, dedicated woman who lives with her husband and two minor children in Aguilares, San Salvador department.

María works in her own tortilla shop making tortillas from Monday through Sunday in order to proviD. her husband with all the help he needs to meet household expenses.  María makes tortillas that she then sells from home and that her children take to the various neighborhoods to sell.  This provides extra income that is of great benefit to the family.

María is asking for funds to buy corn at wholesale so that she can make a greater amount of tortillas because they are in high demand in this country because they are basic to the Salvadoran diet.

loans.use: Corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en: Dolgorsuren D. is 47 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Tuv province, central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her husband works as a bookkeeper while her daughter helps out with the business. Dolgorsuren graduated from vocational training as a tailor and worked in a sewing factory from 1989 to 1995. She gained more experience working in a tailoring factory from 2000 to 2007, and has been sewing in her home since 2002, when she moved to her current town. She makes tailored clothes according to her customers' requests and has gained a lot of experience. In the future, she plans to establish her own tailoring factory. Dolgorsuren is a modest, honest and hardworking woman and is requesting a 1000000 MNT loan to purchase materials and a steam iron for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase materials and a steam iron

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is married with a son. She lives and works in Novaya Kahovka, Kherson region. She sells sportswear at a local market in her hometown. She began this business 10 years ago. Her business has grown to 30,000 Grivnyas in working capital, and provides her income of about 8,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Svetlana has a reputation as a goal-oriented, hard-working and pleasant merchant. She enjoys her work and responds to economic opportunity. Svetlana is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to increase her assortment of sportswear to sell at her kiosk at affordable prices. Svetlana is hoping to make additional income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of sportswear

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma Z. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Poblacion, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three businesses: a restaurant, a meat-vending business, and a fish-vending business. Her husband, Guillermo Z., who is 50 years old, works as an elected municipal official (sangguniang bayan member) to earn his living. They have two children who are 17 and 25 years old. Vilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired after something better for her family. With the help of her past ten loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vilma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 24,000 PHP, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eleventh loan cycle, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for the business so that she can continue to save up for future house renovation and educational plans. Vilma Z. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Melcris

texts.en:
Melcris A. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 22 years old and married. Melcris raises pigs for fattening and sale. She sells pork meat to the market. She also started her own Internet cafe. She has a few computer units now and she hopes to expand her business because it is very helpful to the students in her neighborhood. Melcris works hard to build her businesses. She wants to be financially prepared when she has children.

Melcris joined CEVI to access financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Melcris has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Melcris is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Shakirah has a business selling food and vegetables, which she has run for seven years.
To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food and vegetables. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Shakirah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Shakirah hopes to own another business.

loans.use: To purchase food and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng Y., 43, sells hand-made brooms, earning an income of $4 per day. Yeht is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. The family has to spend $30 on food, $5 on electricity supply and $25 on other necessary expenses every month. 

Y. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase cows for offspring to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy cows for offspring to sell

loans.name: Kaze Group

texts.fr:
Vincent M. est un commerçant âgé de 30 ans qui habite la Commune  urbaine de Kanyosha en Mairie de Bujumbura. Il fait le commerce des produits de boutique depuis 10ans. Il a fréquenté l’école primaire. Il est marié et père de 3enfants et ne vit pas avec les autres membres de sa famille ; sa femme et ses enfants résidant actuellement dans sa région natale en Commune Mubimbi de la Province de Bujumbura Rural. Il arrive au 4e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de  boutique à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Il compte aussi diversifier ses produits en y ajoutant les produits de première nécessite comme les fruits, les legumes, etc. Il espère qu’avec les économies réalisées avec ce credit, il pourra arriver au niveau élevé dans son métier de commerçant

Il  est membre  du groupe  communautaire« Kaze».
texts.en:
Vincent M. is a 30-year old merchant who lives in the urban community of Kanyosha, of the Bujumbura municipality. He has had his general store for 10 years. He has a primary education. He is married and he is the father of 3 children, although he does not live with them. His wife and children live in their hometown of Mubimbi in the Bujumbura Rural province. He is on his fourth loan cycle with Turame (Kiva Field Partner). 

He requests a loan from Kiva to supplement his capital funds. He plans to purchase large quantities of general merchandise to resell to his clientele with the goal of improving his income. He also endeavors to add variety to his products by including products of primary needs, such as fruit, vegetables, etc. He hopes that with the profits generated with this loan, he will be able to become a higher level merchant.

He is a member of the communal bank named "Kaze".

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Bendiya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 21 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Wela, préfecture de Konobougou; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce du savon, des condiments et de l’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Bendiya sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter du savon, des condiments et de l’arachide qui sera transformé en pâte par MAMINE T..                                                                          
MAMINE T. s’approvisionne en arachide presque hebdomadairement au marché de Konobougou. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place dans le village et au marché de Konobougou après transformation en pâte d’arachide, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes surtout.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, une partie pour prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Bendiya are married and they have an average age of 21. They have 3 children each and they live in large traditional extended families in the village of Wela, located in the prefecture of Konobougou in the Segou region (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family and they are involved in the sale of soaps, condiments, and peanuts. 

The women of the Bendiya group are on their fifth group loan and it will be used to purchase soap, condiments, and peanuts. The peanuts will be made into peanut butter by Mamine T.. 

Mamine T. purchases her peanuts almost weekly at the market in Konobougou. She makes her sales from her house in the village and at the Konobougou market, once the peanuts are made into peanut butter.  She completes her sales in cash and credit to a clientele made up primarily of women. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 20 000FCFA which will be used to make the payments for this loan; a portion will be used to cover health related expenses, to purchase food, and to pay school fees; the remaining portion will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase peanuts.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a married man with one child who is still young for school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a goat meat sales business, buying goats and fattening them for sale at a profit. He sells at the market to his neighbours and passersby. Alfred faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and establish a slaughterhouse in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase goats for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase goats for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is Salmatu. She is a widow and has 2 children ages 5 and 10. In 2005, Salmatu established her business selling slippers. She began her business because she started selling small trays and later moved to used clothes and now slippers. She opens her business 6 days a week and 11 hours a day. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to purchase more bags of slippers. She provides good customer care and the office is located close to her business place.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of plastic slippers for her business

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en: Arevhat is a hard-working hairdresser and has owned her own salon since 2005.  She lives with her retired mother and also supports her disabled brother. Business is good and Arevhat has many clients. She has applied for a loan to do some work to refinish and expand her shop to attract more customers and provide comfort to her current clients.

loans.use: to repair and remodel the salon

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is 39 years old.  She is married with four children who are between 3 and 13 years old. Patricie makes her living by sewing different styles of African clothes.  She has been in this business for five years.  She operates her business from 8am until 7pm every day. She employs three people to help her.

Patricie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company s.a. in order to purchase more African clothes for sewing.  Patricie will hopefully earn more profit, which will allow her to create other areas of the same business.  She will also be able to save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more African clothes for sewing

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: La señora Rosa  es originaria de la población de Melchor Ocampo un lugar hermosos lleno de vegetación y con un clima agradable. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, perfumería por catalogo desde hace 4 años, ella ofrece sus productos a sus vecinas y a diferentes personas que tienen empleos seguros para que no le queden mal con los pagos. Doña Rosa esta pidiendo un crédito para tener mas surtido y pueda ofrecer mas cosas a sus clientelas ella dice “a mis clientas les gusta oler los perfumes y si les gusta se los dejan por eso quiero el crédito para tener en existencia para cuando me pidan algún perfume vendérselos para que no se me arrepientan de comprarme los perfumes o los cosméticos”. Ella surte sus productos en distribuidores autorizados en la población de Zitacuaro, comenta que una de sus problemáticas para poder tener mas clientas es la falta de tiempo ya que tiene que hacer la comida para sus hijos y llevarlos a la escuela. Pero eso no la detiene ella quiere salir adelante por que es una persona constante en su negocio. Doña Rosa esta casada con el señor José Luís el cual es empleado, ellos tienen 3 hijos José Luís el cual estudia la primaria, Alison de 3 años y Ángel de un año de edad.
texts.en:
Rosa is from the village of Melchor Ocampo, a beautiful spot filled with vegetation and an agreeable climate. She has sold cosmetics and perfume by catalog for some 4 years. She offers her products to her neighbors and to different people who have secure employment, to avoid problems in payment.

Rosa is requesting a loan to obtain more selection and to be able to offer more things to her customers. She says “My customers like to smell perfumes and if they like them they buy them; that's why I need the loan, to have things on hand so that when they request a certain perfume, I can sell it to them and won't have to delay in order to buy those perfumes or cosmetics.”

Rosa buys her products from authorized distributors in the city of Zitacuaro. She notes that one problem she encounters in trying to gain more customers is the lack of time, because she has to prepare meals for her children plus take them to and from school.

But this doesn't hold her back. She wants to get ahead and she is dedicated to her business. Rosa is married to Jose, an employee, and they have 3 children; Jose Luis, who studies in primary, Alison who is 3 years old, and Angel who is 1 year old.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetics to sell by catalog.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce M., a resident of the Mulago neighborhood in Kampala, Uganda, is married and has five children, one of whom is in school. She also takes care of elderly parents. Joyce has operated a wholesale milk-selling business from home for three years, working seven days each week.

Joyce has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more jerycans of milk. The main business challenges she faces include defaulters and increasing milk prices. Her goals are to expand her business and purchase her own milk cooler.

Joyce lives in a home that she rents which has electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more jerycans of milk.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is a widow. Her husband died a few years ago. She has given birth to six children. Her eldest son works in a vegetable market and the next two are tailors by profession. Her remaining children stay at home. Nargis couldn't educate them due to limited financial resources. 

Nargis has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to financially assist her second son. He is 24 years old and an expert in men’s clothes sewing. He has good business sense and behaves very professionally with his customers. With the loan, he will buy a new sewing machine which will help him produce quality work in a short period of time. He started this business five years ago and Nargis is confident that an investment will help him improve his business further.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for a tailoring business.

loans.name: Gloria Elcidia

texts.es:
Gloria, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, se dedica a la venta de verduras, frutas y mariscos, tiene 27 años de ser comerciante, y lo aprendió por sus amistades, hoy en día le ayuda a su esposo para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de verduras, papas, güisquiles, también manzanas, uvas, peras, y pescado, esta inversión le ayudara a tener mayor disponibilidad de productos para poder atender la demanda, brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Los sueños de ella es aumentar sus ventas, ampliarse a atender nuevas zonas, con el fin de generar mayores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Gloria lives with her husband and children. She sells vegetables, fruits, and seafood. Gloria has been a merchant for 27 years and learned the business from her friends. Today she is able to help her husband with providing for their household needs.

Gloria is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, potatoes, chayote squash, apples, grapes, pears, and fish. This investment will help make available more products so that she can keep up with demand and provide better service to her customers.

Her dreams are to increase her sales and to expand into new areas so that she can generate more household income.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, potatoes, chayote squash, apples, grapes, pears, and fish.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
This is Adelaida, 57, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Nestor, and is the mother of two children who are both in high school. 

Together with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling. Adelaida herself has been an undergraduate, and she believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Adelaida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Adelaida earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 560 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Adelaida hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she fervently hopes that her children will be able to graduate one day. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery products and inventory items needed in her variety store.

loans.name: Tomasa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Tomasa, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y elaboración de hamacas, tiene el negocio desde hace 2 años y medio, estas ventas las realiza de forma ambulante tres veces por semana, el resto de días lo dedica a la elaboración de hamacas.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de pescado para revender, además de comprar materia prima para las hamacas como hilo de seda de diferentes colores, este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar el invetario y a disponer de más productos para ofrecer a los clientes.
Ella quiere ayudar a su hijo, para que estudie, además con el negocio quiere lograr un local fijo donde atender la clientela.
texts.en:
Tomasa lives with her husband and 5-year-old son.  She sells fish and manufactures hammocks.  She’s had the business for two and a half years.  She is a street vendor three days a week and spends the rest of the days of the week making the hammocks.

She is asking for the loan to buy fish to resell and to buy raw materials to make the hammocks like silk thread in assorted colors.  This loan will help her improve inventory and to have more products to offer customers.

She wants to help her son so that he can go to school.  Besides, she’d like to get a fixed locale for her business where she can tend to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell and silk thread to make hammocks.

loans.name: Njemo

texts.en:
Njemo is a 37 year old married father of two children, ages three and two. He is a livestock trader in Mariakani. His business has been in operation for the last three years and it has been a success.

This marks his second borrowing from KADET to finance his business. With this loan amount, he plans to increase his herd of livestock. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and gradually expand his business. His dream is to become a livestock distributor in Coast Province.

loans.use: to increase his herd of livestock

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Imran is a forty two year old married man with three children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

Imran has been in the transportation and farming business for fifteen years. This has enabled him to educate his children. His hardships are poultry diseases and unstable prices. His vision for the future is to have a big poultry farm. Imran needs the credit service to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture to offer for sale

loans.name: Tomua

texts.en:
Tomua is 48 years of age. She is married and has six children. Tomua owns & operates a business of planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Tomua needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the profits from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand the business.

Tomua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Tomua's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: La Paz 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Martha is a member of her group L. Paz (The Peace). Her group is located in the area surrounding L. Romana, where the economy is based around the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. 

Martha is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, and starting to invest in her business selling clothing and shoes. She will uses this loan to buy shoes, for women, men and kids (sandals, sneakers, slippers, etc). She started her business with her Esperanza first loan, almost 1 year ago. She is using her business profits to reinvest in her business and to uses ot for her expenses.

Martha and other members are dedicated to do business around their community and other villages, selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, underwear, and many other products. She thanks you all for your support. 

Picture were taken in two different groups, that is why there are 5 members in a second photo.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Juanita

texts.es: La señora Juanita es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta el oficio de comercio por lo que desde hace 4 años inicio su negocio de venta de ropa usada en una de las colonias muy pobladas de la ciudad. La señora es madre de 2 pequeños y esta en espera de uno nuevo a los cuales quiere ofrecer una calidad de vida y un mejor patrimonio. Para Juanita es muy difícil ser madre y padre a la vez, ya que su esposo por cuestiones de trabajo no puede estar al tanto de sus hijos, pero si responde en el ámbito económico. Es una de las cosas por las que opto por tener su propio negocio, ya que es la forma que podrá atender a sus pequeños sin ningún problema. Para que el negocio siga generando ingresos necesita comprar ropa de temporada
texts.en:
Sra. Juanita is a hardworking woman who enjoys the retail trade. Four years ago, she started her business of selling used clothes in one of the most populated neighborhoods in the city. Juanita is the mother of two small children and is expecting another one, which is why she wants to offer her family a better quality of life and a better inheritance. For Juanita, it is difficult to be both mother and father at the same time since her husband cannot be with the children because of work. However, he does provide financial support. This is one of the things she had to consider when starting her own business, so working in this manner allows her to look after her young children without any problems.

In order for her business to continue generating income, she needs to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with no children. Her husband is a businessman who helps provide for the family's basic needs. She has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and paraffin. 

Nyamvula has operated a retail shop for the past twenty-eight years, and her potential clients are her neighbors and passersby. Transportation is a major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sugar bags and bales of corn flour. She decided to join Yehu because of the development with already existing clients.

loans.use: To purchase sugar bags and bales of corn flour.

loans.name: Gerard

texts.en:
Gerard is 38 years old and is married with five children between one and ten years old. He is well-known in the business of selling rice, sugar, and cooking oil. He has been in this business for about ten years, and his business hours are from 7 a.m. until 9 p.m. every day.

Gerard has requested a loan from Vision Finance Company, a Kiva Partner, in order to purchase a greater quantity of goods like rice, sugar, cooking oil, and cassava flour.

If successful, Gerard hopes that he will earn more profits than he did previously. With these profits, he will keep reinvesting for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like rice, sugar, cooking oil, and cassava flour.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Delia has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Delia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Delia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Marco, se dedica a la venta de agua embotellada, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 9 años de edad, él trabaja todos los días de la semana en su vehículo, vendiendo agua embotellada, además en su vivienda también ofrece para los clientes.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de un pedido de agua embotellada, para aumentar el inventario, teniendo más capacidad para atender la demanda y sobre todo generar más ganancias. El quiere mejorar el negocio, aumentar el número de clientes, para distribuirles agua y de esta manera contribuir a la superación de su familia.
texts.en:
Marco sells bottled water.  He lives with his wife and 9-year-old son.  He works every day of the week in his vehicle selling bottled water; he also sells it to his customers at home.

He’s asking for a loan to pay for a delivery of bottled water to increase his inventory to be able to meet increased customer demand and, above all, to generate more profits.  He wants to improve the business, increase the number of customer to sell water to and contribute to his family’s betterment this way.

loans.use: to pay for a delivery of bottled water.

loans.name: Mariana Marlene

texts.es: Mariana, de 39 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León, donde el comercio de pulperías son parte de las actividades económicas propias de la ciudad, ella trabaja desde su casa tiene un pulpería y además vende esquimos (ice cream) de todos  los sabores, vende granos básicos y demás productos para el hogar. Este negocio le permite estar cerca de sus hijos de 9 y 12 años de edad, donde les ayuda en sus tareas de clases y están con ella en el negocio, además de que aporta con los gastos del hogar y su esposo la ayuda con las compras de mercadería esta actividad al igual que las tareas del hogar las distribuyen entre los dos y es de esta manera que sacan adelante a su familia y su negocio. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar gaseosas, jugos, esquimos de diferentes sabores, granos básicos, como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz, aceite, pollo que son parte de los productos que le solicitan sus clientes y de los cuales necesita mantener surtida su pulpería para poder vender mas y satisfacer las necesidades de su zona y con el crédito que le otorguen podrá adquirir con mas facilidad estos productos. Por lo pronto tiene pensado en lo futuro un freezer nuevo y vitrinas para surtirla de productos de necesidad en su vecindario.
texts.en:
Mariana, 39, lives in the city of León where grocery stores are part of the city’s economic scene.  She works at a home-based grocery store and also sells ‘esquimos’ (ice-cream) in assorted flavors; she sells basic grains and also items for the home.  This business allows her to support her children who are 9 and 12 years old.  When they are with her in the store she helps them with their homework.  She also contributes to household expenses and her husband helps her to buy the merchandise.  The two of them share tasks in the store and also at home and this is how they move their family and their business forward.

She needs the loan to buy soft-drinks, juices, assorted flavored esquimos, basic grains like rice, sugar, beans, corn, oil and chicken which are the items most requested by customers and which she has to have in stock in the store to sell more and meet the zone’s needs.  The loan she’ll be granted will make it easier for her to acquire these products.  For now, she plans in future to install a new freezer and display cases to stock items needed in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en:
Tuinanau is 52 years old and married with seven children.

Tuinanau works in her business, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has three years of experience in this business. Tuinanau needs a loan of 1800 Samoa Tala (WST) to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 WST or US $104 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tuinanau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tuinanau's 3rd loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат клиентка организации с 2009 года. Ей 41 год, замужем, имеет троих детей. Она живёт и ведёт свою деятельность в городе Худжанде. Её ассортимент товара составляет нежные домашние лепёшки. Она каждый свой кредит берёт на поддержку своего товарооборота. У неё свои постоянные клиенты. На полученные доходы от бизнеса она старается обновить свою домашнюю обстановку. Вот например недавно она купила новый плазменный телевизор. Она благодарна организации за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en:
Karomat has been a client of the organization since 2009.  She is 41 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives and has her business in the city of Khujand.  She sells delicate homemade breads and has her own regular customers.  

Every time she borrows money, she uses it to support the turnover of her inventory.  With the income she receives from her business, she tries to update her home furnishings and appliances.  For example, she recently bought a new plasma TV.  She is grateful to the organization for its support and understanding.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Lizandro

texts.es:
Lizandro es un hombre de 61 años que vive en Isla Trinitaria - un barrio periurbano de Guayaquil. Allá tiene su negocio por el cual vende productos alimenticios como pescado, cocada, manjar, y melcocha (un dulce tipico de aquí). 

Desde hace 6 años ha trabajado en este negocio, vendiendo cuatro dias por semana. Por el resto de su tiempo se ocupa de su esposa que está discapacitada. Juntos tienen hijos, pero ya son adultos y independientes.

Lizandro está solicitando este prestamo para invertirlo en su casa, mejorandola y volviendola en una casa de cemento. 

También sueña con un aumento de las ventas de su negocio.
texts.en: Lizandro is a 61-year-old man who lives on Isla Trinitaria, a semi-urban neighborhood of Guayaquil. There he has his business selling food products such as fish, coconut candy, cinnamon custard, and spreadable honey, a traditional sweet from the area. He has had this business for six years and sells four days a week. In his remaining time he takes care of his wife who is handicapped. Although they have children they are adults now and independent. Lizandro is seeking this loan to invest in his home, making improvements and converting it into a cement house. He also dreams of increasing sales in his business.

loans.use: to purchase stone and cement for making improvements to his home.

loans.name: Carlos Yubani

texts.es:
Carlos Yubani  tiene  21 años de edad, él vive en Mala, ubicado alrededor de una hora y media al sur de Lima, Mala, con sus playas de arena, ruinas pre-incas, y la producción del adorado nacional licor de Perú, el Pisco (una especie de aguardiente de uva), ha sido durante mucho tiempo un destino turístico para los peruanos adinerados. Pero la verdadera Cañete es una ciudad cálida y tranquila con una gran población afro-peruana, los restos de un camino indígena, y las influencias del imperio español. La ciudad, junto con otros cerca de la costa del Pacífico, fue dañado durante el 2001 y 2007 terremotos Perú, pero ha soportado como lo ha hecho durante gran parte de su historia..  En su tiempo libre disfruta;  como bien se sabe el Perú se caracteriza por tener las comidas más deliciosas del mundo y uno de los platos que a Carlos le gusta mucho es “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Carlos estudió hasta tercer año de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Mecánica. Carlos es soltero y trabaja en su negocio de vidriería , el se dedica a este trabajo 12 horas diarias.

En un día Carlos puede atender  de 2 a 3 clientes diariamente, ya que depende de los pedidos que le realicen y esto le permite ganar aproximadamente un promedio de hasta S/. 100 diarios y en un buen día puede ganar hasta S/. 200 lo que le ayuda en algunos gastos adicionales, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es puntual en la entrega de los pedidos que le hacen y por la calidad y la buena atención hacia los clientes. 

Carlos esta muy agradecido con la ayuda otorgada por los prestatarios Kiva, ya que con este apoyo el podra comprar mas mercadería para su negocio. Esta mejora le ayudara en aumentar su inventario y seguir dando buena atención y así poder en algunos meses ampliar su local y tener mas variedad de productos lo que le generara mas ganancias y con ello lo ayudará a cumplir su gran sueño: “Comprar una camioneta".
texts.en:
Carlos Yubani is 21 years old and lives in Mala, a city located about an hour and a half to the south of Lima.  Mala, with its sandy beaches, pre-Incan ruins, and the production of Perú's nationally-adored liquor, Pisco (a type of hard liquor made from grapes), has been a tourist destination for wealthy Peruvians for a long time.  But the authentic city of Cañete is warm and peaceful with a large Afro-Peruvian population, the remains of an indigenous pathway, and the influences of the Spanish empire.  The city, along with others along the Pacific coast, was damaged in 2001 and 2007 as a result of earhquakes which occurred in those years, but has continued on as it has always done through its history.  In his free time he enjoys himself; it is well-known that Perú is recognized for having the most delicious food in the world and one of the dishes that Carlos likes a lot is "carapulcra con sopa seca" a traditional Peruvian dish with meat and vegetables.  Carlos studied up to his third year in high school but he would have liked to study to be a mechanic.  Carlos is single and works as a glazier in his shop.  He is so proud of his shop that he works there 12 hours every day.  

In one day Carlos is able to assist 2 or 3 customers, though it depends on the the requests that are made.  This allows him to earn an average of approximately 100 soles (or about 37 dollars) every day and on a good day he can earn up to 200 soles (about 74 dollars).  This helps Carlos to be able to pay for some additional costs, and he thinks that his business is going well because he is punctual when he delivers the requested work that is asked of him and because of the quality and the attention he pays to customers.  

Carlos is very grateful for the help granted him by those who loan through Kiva, because with this support he will be able to purchase more merchandise for his business.  This improvement will help him to increase his inventory and continue caring for customers and as a result it will allow him in a few months to be able to enlarge his place of business and have more variety of products.  This will generate a higher return for Carlos and will help him to achieve his big dream: to buy a truck.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (pieces of glass).

loans.name: Claudia Griselda's Group

texts.es:
El comité está compuesto por 12  integrantes de la ciudad de Encarnación, son clientes desde mayo del año pasado con excelente conducta de pago. El comité  tiene mucha experiencia en trabajo grupal, ya que hace mucho tiempo que trabajan juntas. Ellas ven en el programa de la fundación paraguaya una gran ayuda.
Una de las integrantes, Mercedes, tiene 33 años, tiene 1 hijo, es madre soltera. Ella trabaja  de peluquera y a la misma vez en la venta de comestibles y es la única que genera ingreso en su hogar. Es por eso que se integro al comité de su barrio para que con la ayuda que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya pueda salir adelante y por medio del trabajo en conjunto y salir adelante, ya que se encuentra sola y de esa forma es muy difícil.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tintes, esmaltes para uñas, tijeras, peines y demás insumos para abastecer su peluquería, ya que es su medio de subsistencia. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee has 12 members from the city of Encarnación; they’ve been clients since May of last year and have an excellent payment history.  The committee has a lot of experience working as a group since they’ve been working together for a long time.  They see Fundación Paraguaya’s program as a great help.

One of the members is Mercedes, 33.  She has a son and is a single mother.  She works in a beauty salon and also sells groceries and this is her only source of household income.  Because of this she joined her neighborhood committee so that with help from Fundación Paraguaya she can get ahead through joint efforts and get ahead because she’s alone and that way is very difficult.

She asked for the loan to buy hair coloring, nail polish, scissors, combs and other supplies to stock her shop since it’s her means of support.  She’s very grateful for the opportunity she’s receiving.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
