Alice is 40 years old, has 5 children, and lives in Lwala Nyamor village in Ndhiwa sub county, Kenya. Alice works as a schoolteacher for a living. Her community of Lwala Nyamor village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases. Alice is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by her village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Alice represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Alice and three other promoters in her community, including WIllis, Michael, and Syrus, need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Alice wants to be a promoter because she believes that the dispenser will help to prevent water-borne diseases so that the community can have good health.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Alice’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To install and maintain chlorine dispensers to provide access to safe drinking water for the community

loans.name: Marika

texts.en:
Marika G. – Blagoevgrad 

Marika G. is 43 years old and keeps a little grocery in Blagoevgrad. This is a family business. Marika is a seller in the grocery and her husband makes the delivery. When she is not engaged in the grocery Marika has an extra business as an accountant consultant. Marika and her husband need a new professional refrigerator for their grocery and thet is the reason they apply for a $ 2 000 loan.

loans.use: For a new professional refrigerator for the grocery

loans.name: Adéméwolé

texts.en:
Adéméwolé A. was born in Atchandomé in 1955. She is married, the mother of five, and is a merchant with over 20 years of experience. Her husband, a farmer, does not make enough money to take care of the whole family. That is why Ms. A. is a trader of corn and condiments; in her own way, she helps her family to cover household expenses. The arrival of new corn is a great opportunity for her to build up her stock. And so she is requesting a loan of $600 to increase her ability to stock corn and also to sell condiments. The resulting income will serve to improve her living conditions and those of her family, especially with regards to health and nourishment.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Née en 1955 à Atchandomé, Madame A. Adéméwolé est une commerçante de grande expérience. Mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants, elle pratique cette activité depuis une vingtaine d’années. Son mari, agriculteur de profession ne possède pas assez de revenu pour prendre en charge toute la famille. C’est pour cette raison que Madame A. pratique le commerce de vente de maïs et des condiments pour contribuer à sa façon aux charges du ménage. L’apparition de nouveaux mais est une aubène pour elle de constituer son stock. Elle sollicite ce crédit de $600 pour augmenter sa capacité de stockage en maïs et aussi vendre les condiments. Les revenus lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie de toute sa famille surtout en matière de besoins en santé, et en nourriture.

loans.use: To do commerce in corn

loans.name: Norma Angélica

texts.en:
Norma Angelica is married and has two children, ages 11 and 18. Her family is originally from Monterrey, Nuevo Leon. Her husband is a welder, yet his salary is not sufficient to cover their living expenses and school for the children. Facing this challenge, Norma decided to start selling kitchen utensils and accessories five years ago and thanks to the payment options that she offers her clients, her clientele continues to grows everyday.

At this time, she needs a loan in the amount of $250, which she will use to purchase merchandise to meet the needs of her clients. She pledges to repay this amount within three to six months. You can be a fundamental part of the growth of this business and help improve the life of this family. They will sincerely appreciate your help.

Translated from Spanish by Lighthouse Translations, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Norma Angélica es casada y tiene dos hijos 11 y 18 años de edad, esta familia es originaria de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Su esposo tiene el oficio de soldador, sin embargo el salario que obtiene es insuficiente para todos los gastos del hogar y la escuela de sus hijos, ante esta necesidad Norma decidió iniciar con la venta de artículos de cocina desde hace cinco años, y gracias a las facilidades que otorga para los pagos, sus clientas se incrementan cada día.

En estos momentos necesita de un préstamo por $ 250 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 3 a 6 meses. Tú puedes ser parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, y mejorar la vida de esta familia, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use:
To puchase inventory

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria has a small job selling food, her main source of income, and three children who depend on her, especially since her husband is unemployed. She has small accomodations for field workers who travel from the rural area that are currently disabled due to the lack of equipment (blankets, folding beds, and mirrors).

She asks for a loan to furnish her accomodations. This would give her husband the chance of working and thus help support the family. This is her second credit with Impro. Her timely payment of her first loan allows her access to a second one.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria tiene un puesto pequeño de venta de comida que es su actual y principal fuente de ingreso; tiene tres hijos que dependen de ella pues el esposo se encuentra desempleado. Tiene un Alojamiento pequeño para viajeros campesinos de la Área Rural sin funcionar por falta de equipamiento (frazadas, catres, espejo).

El Crédito requiere para equiparlo el alojamiento, de esa forma el esposo que se encuentra desempleado tendría la posibilidad de trabajar y así poder ayudar en la manutención de la familia. Es el segundo crédito con Impro; la puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas en el primer crédito le faculta acceder a este segundo préstamo.

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Imuetiyan

texts.en:
A woman full of life who works hard all day long, Mrs. Imuetiyan O. is 48 years old, married, and mother of four children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she mills palm nuts and sells edible cooking oil to people by the gallon.

Imuetiyan has been in this business since 2001 and has been a client of LAPO for the past 8 years. She hopes to get a loan in the amount of US$ 800 to boost her business and buy more palm nuts for milling.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts for milling

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 42-year-old mother of three and a resident of Vituka. She has been doing business for the past ten years. She sells vitenge and Kanga (traditional attire) which she supplies upcountry. She also has a shop in the Vituka area where she sells some of her stock before supplying the clothing to the nearby regions. She is in need of USD 550 to help her expand the business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Chioma

texts.en: "Through the financial assistance I receive from LAPO, my business has increased in volume and in values," says Miss Chioma A., who is 27 years old and lives in Lagos state Nigeria. She has been in her business since 2002 and needs a loan to buy more foodstuff and drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Bushra N. Ahmed. I am the mother of five sons and three daughters. I live with my family in a mid-size city, Faisalabad, Pakistan. I make and sell blankets whereas my husband is a daily wage laborer. My husband is sickly and cannot work continuously. I require expanding my blanket business for which purpose I desire a loan from you.

There are three other members in my group and we are mutually responsible for each other’s loans. My group members are Zarina K. who needs a loan for their blanket-stitching business; Mehmooda A. who requires a loan for their detergent-manufacturing business; and Rafiq B. who is a widow and wants to buy her son a rickshaw."

loans.use: Expand home-based blanket manufacturing business

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Luís F. José was born in the city of Tete in the province of Tete. He is 39 years old, he has 4 siblings, including two girls and they are orphans. He grew up in the city of Tete. Luís studied until the 7th grade, later he moved to Cahora Bassa where he attended the secondary school of Songo. He graduated as a primary school teacher. Before he could start working he was forced to attend the Military school of Munguine in the province of Maputo in 1992.3

Later he worked as an instructor in Munguine for 2 years. In 1994, he was transferred to Quartel of Boane where he continued his career as a teacher until today. In 1997, he married. He has 5 children, still in their teens. He was introduced to HLUVUKU-ADSEMA by his aunt Regina and co-workers. His first loan was of 8.000mt. He repaid this in a timely manner. Luís is requesting a loan of 14.000mt to buy construction material to build his home. His dream is to see his home finished and to make his family happy.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização Bairro 1- Boane/ Maputo Cliente: Luis F. José Actividade: Habitação Valor De Empréstimo: 14.000,00Mt Aplicação:Compra De Materiais De Construção Inicio:28/01/2008 Fim: 23/03/2009

Luís F. José, Natural de Cidade de Tete província de Tete, de 39 anos de idade tem 4 irmaos dos quais duas são meninas, e órfão de Pai. Cresceu na cidade de Tete onde estudou ate a 7ª classe e depois transferiu-se a Cahora Bassa para fazer o nível básico na escola secundária de Songo. Depois foi a formação de Professores primários. Antes de começar com o seu primeiro emprego foi capturado para a tropa e enviado para o centro de formação básica em Munguine na província de Maputo em 1992. Depois da formação Militar foi afecto em munguine como instrutor no centro, onde ficou dois anos. Em 1994 foi transferido para o Quartel de Boane pra continuar a sua carreira como instrutor, estando a desenvolve-la até hoje. Em 1997 casou-se e deste resultaram 5 filhos dos quais 3 são rapazes ainda adolescentes.

Ouviu falar da HLUVUKU-ADSEMA apartir de conversas com a sua tia Regina Dzimba, cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema e colegas de serviço. Depois decidiu aproximar-se para saber das condicoes de acesso ao credito. Tendo um conhecimento claro decide remeter seu pedido de credito no valor de 8.000,00MT tendo sido aprovado na sua totalidade e pagou-o em tempo recorde. Com o credito de 14.000,00MT que ainda esta por ser financiado, pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a sua obra. Tem como maior sonho ver sua casa concluída para confortar a sua família e alegra-la.

loans.use: To buy construction material

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian is a very hard-working woman, as a result of the economic crisis that her family was going through, at one time she decided to sell Christmas cakes. Little by little and with the support of her husband she would sell some other goods from time to time, until as a result of requests by some clients she decided to sell garmets and cosmetics. This latest activity has given her much satisfaction and now her travel routine and product supply are more constant. Her constant travel to the national capital is in order to acquire one-of-a-kind goods, with that objective and with the desire to increase her sales and quality of life she will also travel to the city of Huaraz to bring from there artisan goods so that the entire population of her native Huancayo can decorate their homes with Peruvian crafts. Her wish to increase the quantity of goods has lead her to ask for a loan in order to acquire more and better quality of products.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer.

Lilian, es una mujer muy empeñosa a raíz de la crisis económica por la que atravesaba su familia, decidió en una época vender panetones por navidad, poco a poco y con apoyo de su esposo vendía algunos artículos ocasionalmente, hasta cuando por solicitud de algunas clientas decidió vender prendas de vestir y cosméticos, esta última actividad le ha otorgado muchas satisfacciones y ahora su rutina de viaje y oferta de productos es más constante.Su desplazamiento constante a la ciudad capital de su país es para adquirir artículos novedosos, con ese objetivo y con el deseo de incrementar sus ventas y calidad de vida ahora también se desplaza a la ciudad de Huaraz para traer desde allí artículos artesanales para que la población entera de su natal Huancayo pueda adornar sus hogares con artesanías peruanas.Su deseo de incrementar la cantidad de artículos la han conducido a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir mayor y mejor calidad de productos.

loans.use: Increased capital to acquire more and better quality goods

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha Monsiváis began her business 12 years ago, almost by chance, when her oldest daughter refused to continue studying. Martha was looking for an activity that would help her daughter continue to grow so that she wouldn’t waste time and would be occupied with something. Martha decided to sell chips and soft drinks out of her home. Little by little she has invested in the business and it has grown so that now she has a grocery store. It has become a family business, since her husband now helps Martha run it.

Martha is requesting a loan of $675 US that she will repay in four months in order to restock the store and thus to be able to continue growing and getting ahead. Let’s help Martha and her family move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha Monsiváis empezó su negocio hace mas de 12 años de manera fortuita, cuando su hija mayor no quiso seguir estudiando entonces buscando una actividad en la que se pudiera desarrollar para que no perdiera el tiempo y se ocupara de algo, fue que decidió vender frituras y refrescos en su casa, poco a poco han invertido al negocio y lo han hecho crecer hasta tener una tienda de abarrotes, la cual se convirtió en un negocio familiar ya que su esposo le ayuda a atenderla.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $675 que pagara en 4 meses para surtir mercancía para la tienda, y poder seguir creciendo así como salir adelante. Ayudemos a Martha y su familia a seguir adelante

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Asia's Muongozo Group

texts.en:
Asia is 26 years old and is a married woman with a 2-year-old child. Asia owns a small cosmetics shop, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cosmetics for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Angela, who sells food.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics items for her business.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Mrs Angélica, is the president of Communal Bank Señor de los Milagros of the community of Imicate, in the district and province of Yunguyo. She is 24 years old, and she managed to finish middle school. She is a mother of 2 young children. Since she got married she has been working in the production and sales of manna of corn, wheat and noodles at the market “15 de Agosto” in the city of Yunguyo on Thursday and on Sundays. Sometimes she delivers her production directly the intermediary merchants of the localities of Juli and Ilave. Because of the bigger demand of her products by the intermediary merchants of other localities, she decided to belong to the Communal Bank Señor de los Milagros gaining access initially to a loan of $100; that she used to buy only a quintal of sugar and 3 bags of noodles. With the loan of $525, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy 10 sacks of imported wheat for production of manna. She is satisfied and happy because she will increase her production and family revenue. Her vision for the future is to promote her business, to have a bigger capital, to provide an education to her children, to have a high quality material house and a car to transport her products to the local and regional markets.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Angélica, es presidenta del Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros de la comunidad de Imicate, del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, tiene 24 años de edad, logró estudiar secundaria completa, es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad. Desde que tuvo su esposo viene trabajando en la producción y venta de maná de maíz, trigo y fideos en el mercado de 15 de Agosto los días jueves y domingos en la ciudad de Yunguyo, a veces entrega directamente a los comerciantes intermediarios de las localidades de Juli e Ilave. Por mayor demanda de sus productos por los comerciantes intermediarios de otras localidades, han decidido pertenecer al Banco Comunal Señor de los Milagros accediendo inicialmente a un préstamo de S/. 300.00, con ella adquirieron solamente un quintal de azúcar y 3 bolsas de fideos. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 4 meses comprará 10 sacos de trigo importado para producción de maná, esta satisfecha y feliz porque va incrementar su producción y ingreso económico familiar Su visión futura es potenciar su negocio, capitalizarse más, dar educación a sus hijos, tener casa material noble y movilidad para transportar sus productos a los mercados locales y regionales.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her business

loans.name: Wala Jan

texts.en:
This young man is Wala Jan, son of D. S.; he is 21 years old and married. He lives in the Shewa district of the Ningarhar Province.

Wala Jan has three children, and he graduated from class twelve last year. Because of financial problems, he had to stop his education and find a job. He tried to find a job in one of the government administrations because he wanted to help people this way, but he has been faced with some difficulties, so he decided to start a personal business.

He became a farmer and he is growing wheat, cereal, onions, and other vegetables in his land. He cannot solve all his family's problems with his small amount of income, so he wants to buy seeds and some stocks to increase his income through his farm. He requested a 50,000 Afghanis loan for 24 months from AFSG. He hopes that if he is able to solve his financial problems with this loan, then he will restart his higher education and begin to live his dreams.

loans.use: To buy seeds and some stocks

loans.name: Helga

texts.en:
Helga has owned her own food shop in Arusha for two years. She is 35 years old, married, and has two children ages 5 and 7. She works every day from 7:00am to 7:30pm and is able to generate a monthly profit of $50.

Helga has taken out one previous loan through BRAC Tanzania. She paid it back successfully and on time. She would like to take out this loan so that she may buy more goods for sale in her shop, like sugar and salt.

loans.use: To buy sugar and salt to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add the sale of fresh meat to her small business of selling vegetables

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 25 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 1 year old. She has been a decorations seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Halima is now looking for loan to buy more decorations items for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more decorations items for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es:
Verónica, inicio su negocio hace 4 años por tener un ingreso extra para los gastos de su hogar, ya que no les alcanzaba con el ingreso de su esposo y su hijo iba creciendo y necesitando mas cosas, fue entonces que se unió a un grupo de vecinas y se instalo en un parque con la venta de calzado por catalogo y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio y aumentado sus clientes.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar mercancía y poder continuar con su negocio, ya que el lugar en donde vende tiene mucha competencia.
texts.en:
Verónica began her business 4 years ago to have additional income with which she could pay the household expenses, as her husband's income was not sufficient, and her son was growing up and needed more things. It was then when Verónica joined with a group of neighbors and located herself in a park and began to sell shoes through a catalogue. Little by little she has grown her business and expanded her client base. She needs a US $300 loan, which she will repay in 3 months, to purchase merchandise and to continue her business, as she faces much competition in her shoe business.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shoes

loans.name: Die

texts.fr: Agé e de quarante cinquant (45) DIE F. est une femme mariée mére de cinq (05) enfants .Son activité principale est le commerce de mercerie surtout de fils à coudre .elle a installé sa boutique à côté des tailleurs ce qui lui permet de faire un chiffre d' affaire journalier assez important.Elle bénéficie d'une longue experience de plus de 8 ans dans le domaine. son histoire de credit avec la caisse date de plus d'un an .les fêtes de fin d'année etant une periode de forte activité pour les tailleurs la demande en fils est tres importante pour satisfaire à cette demande elle sollicite un pret.
texts.en:
Ms. F. DIE is 45 years old and a married mother of five. Her main business is in dressmaking supplies, especially thread. She has set up her boutique next to tailoring shops. This allows her to achieve fairly large sales figures each day. She benefits from lengthy experience, on the order of 8 or more years in this domain. Her credit history with the savings bank goes back over a year's time. With the year-end holidays being a time of good business for tailors, the demand for thread is quite high. To meet this demand, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Eva M., a 38-year-old woman from Mwanza. She is single and has two children, who are 8 and 12 years old, respectively.

Eva has been running a clothing sales business since 2004. In particular, she sells clothes such as vitambaa (materials), vitenga (African traditional clothes with wax prints), and kanga. She works at her business 8 hours per day and 6 days per week, though she is assisted by one employee. By doing so, Eva is able to earn approximately $80 per month from her business operations. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $425 in order to buy more materials to make more clothes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Eva M. thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are not considered to be credit-worthy by financial institutions because they lack tangible assets that can serve as collateral. As such, low income women in Tanzania typically receive poor financial support and in turn only limited access to basic needs and services. Fortunately, SELFINA has been a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women in Tanzania. Simply put, SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women through an arrangement called a sale and leaseback transaction. More specifically, when a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extends a loan to her to facilitate the transaction, and then leases the equipment back to her. As such, one of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use their equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional materials

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the Suni (“Strength” in Quechua) Village Bank. Francisca is 60 years old and is widowed with eight children. Francisca and her children farm potatoes on rented land. She also buys potatoes from other local growers and sells them in the Abastos Market, in the city of Ayacucho. In addition to selling potatoes, Francisca owns two cars, which she uses as taxis around Ayacucho. Francisca needs a loan of 1250 soles to buy potatoes. Francisca dreams of having her own investment capital and of helping her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal Suni. Francisca es viuda, tiene 60 años y 8 hijos, Francisca se dedica a la agricultura D. papa en terrenos alquilados, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos, Además compra papa D. los productores, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, cuenta con 2 carros con los cuales transporta a la ciudad. Francisca necesita un préstamo D. 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. papa. Los sueños D. Francisca es tener capital propio y ayudar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy potatoes for resale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama A. is 37 year old married and mother of two kids who are in school. She has been a food vendor for two years. She prepares and sells rice and stew and she has also added beans and gari to it. It is a delicacy many Ghanaian enjoy everyday either as breakfast, lunch or dinner. She also sells fried rice. Her business is doing well and she wants to expand her operations to serve more customers. With the loan, she wants to buy more beans, grains, vegetables, rice and assorted meat for her operation. She hopes this loan would help her increase her savings to improve her family well-being. She would be very grateful for that assistance. 

She belongs to a village bank called ‘Jacob’. She also hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her save more to support her husband in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy bags of dried maize grains, rice, vegetables, assorted meat, etc.

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
Umedjon F. is 25 years old. He and his wife have one child. Umedjon is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 5 years. He bakes the national bread “lepeshka” at home. His wife helps him with his business. Having many customers, Umedjon is selling the majority of his products just out of his place. However, he is also running a stand in the central market selling ”lepeshka”. Now Umedjon is requesting 800 USD for a term of 12 months. He is planning to purchase flour wholesale, as required for his business. Umedjon is grateful to all supporting him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing  flour wholesale for  “lepeshka”

loans.name: Hoi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hội 33 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Gia đình chị có  3 con đang tuổi đến trường. Hiện tại chị Hội đang kinh doanh hàng tạp hoá và chăn nuôi tại nhà còn anh Bình chồng chị đi làm nghề thợ xây. Mức thu nhập hàng tháng của gia đình chị đạt  4.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Hội mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư mua thêm các mặt hàng bánh kẹo, rượu bia... về bán.
texts.en:
Ms. Nguyễn Thị Hội is 33 yrs old, and joined TYM fund since 2005. Her family has 3 children of school-age. Currently Ms. Hoi has a grocery store and raises animals at home, while her husband, Mr. Binh, is a construction worker. Average income for her family is 230 USD per month. For her next loan, she wishes to borrow 575 USD to purchase merchandise such as cakes, candies, wine, beer to sell .

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Ephraem

texts.en: Ephraem  M. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur. He is married with four school children, two of them in colleges and two in secondary school. He runs three businesses at once: a guest house, a fruits shop, and a pub from which he sells varieties of both soft and alcoholic drinks at Yombo Kilakala in Dar es Salaam. He manages to pay for the school fees of his four children as well as his family's daily needs. He has employed three workers. He wants a loan of TZS 1,400,000 to boost his business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary has been a tomatoes seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to the Nuru Njema group loan (Group code 2026). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day, she works at her business for 8 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tomatoes for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mary is 37 years old, married, and has a 14-year-old child. She also cares for two additional dependants.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for resale, to expand her business.

loans.name: Benedicto's Group

texts.en:
S. Benedicto is the chairperson of the Magoma Nezikokolima group in Mityana. He is a hard-working married man who wants the best for his people, his group members, and all those that he cares for.

Benedicto is a farmer as well as a tailor, making school uniforms and growing foodstuffs both for sale and home consumption. For 30 years he has been dealing in the same businesses. He has 3 school-going children of his own plus caring for 2 orphans.

Benedicto has been in his lending group for 1 year and his goal, together with that of his fellow group members, is to develop themselves and in fact he says right now, he is seeing a change since money is available. Most of his group members were in a Government organization called NAADS ‘National Agricultural Advisory Services’ getting hybrid seeds and farming advice, but what was lacking was money. Now that he has the knowledge and money, he believes nothing will hinder his road to prosperity.

Benedicto needs another loan to help him buy more school uniform materials since the term is soon beginning.

loans.use: Buying cloth for making uniforms

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is managing a hog raising business located just beside their house. At the age of 55, Teresita keeps working in order to help her husband, Restituto, who is working as a gasoline boy, to provide for their family's basic necessities. They are blessed with two children: Wendel, 28 years old, now married and working as a bakery boy, and Juliet, now 25 years old.

Teresita has been raising pigs for 5 years now. Her goal is to make her livestock business a success; thus, Teresita is hoping to borrow 6,000 PHP from lenders to use as financial support for her business. At the moment, since her children are no longer studying and already have their own families, Teresita is hoping that her hog raising business will earn a better profit to enable her to repair her house so that she can stay more comfortable.

loans.use: For business capital

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Гулнора Отаева проживает в Ганчинском районе. У нее маленькие дети, мальчик и девочка. Муж Гулноры вот уже 2 года, как уехал на заработки в Россию. Каждый месяц он посылает оттуда 200-300 сомони на пропитание семьи.
 Сама Гулнора преподавательница. Работает в средней школе №38 Ганчинского района. 
 Как и множество сельских женщин Гулнора занимается животноводством. Дома у нее несколько голов домашнего скота. Овцы, козы и корова, которая два раза в день дает до 10 литров молока. Гулнора доит корову, перерабатывает молоко, производит из него масло, кефир и творог. Ее маленькие дети любят молочные продукты. Гулнора утверждает, что когда дома есть корова, то всегда есть свежее молоко и кефир для ее детей. 
 Гулнора хочет получить займ, для того чтобы купить еще одну дойную корову и продавать полученное от нее молоко на рынке. Для этого ей требуется займ в размере 1200 сомони.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Gulnora O. lives in the Gonjy region. She has small children, a boy and a girl. Gulnora's husband is already two years working in Russia. He sends 200-300 somoni from there every month to support the family. Gulnora is a teacher. She works in the secondary school #38 of the Gonjy region.

Gulnora does animal husbandry as many other village residents. She has several heads of cattle at home - sheeps, goats and a cow which gives up to 10 liters of milk twice a day. Gulnora milks the cow, processes the milk and makes butter, buttermilk and cottage cheese from it. Her little children love milk products. Gulnora says that when there's a milk cow at home, there's always fresh milk available and buttermilk for her children.

Gulnora wants to get a loan to buy one more milk cow and sell the milk that she will get on the market. She needs a loan for 1200 somoni for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Somaly

texts.en:
Mrs. Somaly I., 47, is a widow with one son and two daughters (she is in the picture with one of her daughters). One of her children was married and lives outside the family house, and the other two are garment factory workers. Besides her children, she also has two grandchildren are living with her. The family lives along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Somaly has been selling groceries since 1993. She buys grocery items from Prek Phnao market for resale in the village. She now is requesting another loan from Kiva through MAXIMA to purchase a motorcycle to use in the family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for using in the family.

loans.name: Kinegamgosi  A Group

texts.en:
Auleliya is a member of the Kinegamgosi A borrower group in Ruaha, Iringa. She is a 34-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children. Her children are ages 13, 9, 6 and 3. She also cares for two other dependents. 

Auleliya started her own grocery business selling local alcohol six years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Schillings (about $113).

This is Auleliya’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Auleliya hopes to save money, get more food for her family and expand her business. 

Subira, another member of the Kinegamgosi A borrower group, has also requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own grocery business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Zerish

texts.en:
Zerish is a member of the Ikweta East borrower group,she is 27 years old woman,she is married.

Zerish started her own shop business selling commodities like rice,wheat,2 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 50,000 Tsh.

This is Zerishi`s first loan from BRAC.She requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,wheat,sugar for her business.

With the profit she gain from the use of this loan Zerish hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,soup,cooking oil

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina Juárez C. tiene 27 años de edad. Vive en su propia casa con su conyugue su único hijo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica y ha tenido la oportunidad de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, ya que le han brindado la ayuda suficiente para salir adelante con su negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por cuenta propia los productos que inicio a vender fueron arroz, azúcar, frijoles y golosinas en general. Con el paso del tiempo fue aumentando sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra pan, refrescos naturales, jugos, gaseosas y golosinas.  El sueño de Rosa es obtener otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina is married with two children. She sells clothing at a small market in Mukachevo city and has been in this business for eleven years. Being very enthusiastic and optimistic she provides a good example to her neighbors, encouraging them to work more, develop their businesses and deal with any problems.

Georgina would like to borrow 11,000 UAH to purchase more inventory. She would like to have a big variety of items - both expensive and inexpensive items - to attract even more clients.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
Consorcia A. is from the village of POblacion1 ,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Consorcia is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Consorcia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from sellingdriedfish in the local community. Consorcia has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 15,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Consorcia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consorcia is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Consorcia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita C. is from the village of Pala-o, Iligan City. She is 42 years old. Carmelita is separated from her spouse and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Carmelita owns and operates a business of making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Carmelita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmelita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Carmelita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida S. is a 35 year old businesswoman from a Habitat for Humanity village in Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila. Her husband Domingo, 39, is a jeepney driver. All their three children are in grade school. Adelaida has been into direct selling of cosmetics and apparel for three years now. She makes more than P 3,000.00 a month from this business. Just three months ago she opened a general store in her house. Over time, her general store steadily grew and now earns P 6,000.00 a month on top of her earnings from her cosmetics. Her profits are helpful enough to support her children’s education. She has been with the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative for two years since 2005. She recently applied for a P 10,000.00 loan with CCT as additional capital for her store. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store

loans.name: Delaila

texts.en:
Delaila S. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Delaila owns and operates a business running a sari-sari (variety) retail store. She sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Delaila has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $162 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Delaila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Delaila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Delaila is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 25 años, es una joven muy alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo (Edgar) de 37 años, y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida.

Aunque todavía es muy joven sabe que tiene que trabajar duro si quiere darle a su familia una buena vida, es por eso que junto a su esposo decidieron abrir dos negocios a la vez. 
Desde muy temprano atiende las cabinas donde ofrece el servicio de Internet; posteriormente llegada la noche, se dedica a la venta de hamburguesas y salchipapas (salchichas y papas fritas).
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es preparar los deliciosos platillos que vende por la noche, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender sus cabinas de Internet, ya que no entiende mucho de computación y no puede ayudar a sus clientes si tienen algún problema.
Para más adelante, espera mejorar su pequeño snack, para poder brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Elizabeth con MFP y está dispuesta a ahorrar todos los días un poco con tal de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. Con los tres mil soles solicitados comprará más mesas y sillas para implementar mejor su local donde vende comida.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 25, is a cheerful young woman who lives in her own home with her husband, Edgar, 37. What she most desires is to get ahead in life. Although still very young, she realizes that she must work if she wants to provide her family with a good life. This is why she and her husband decided to open two businesses at once. From very early in the day she tends to her Internet access booths and in the evenings she sells hamburgers and salchipapas (sausages and fried potatoes). What she most enjoys about her work is preparing the delicious meals she sells at night. She has been in this line of work for 2 years and considers the most difficult part of it to be tending to the Internet access booths because she doesn't know much about computers and can't help the customers if they encounter any problems. For later on, she expects to improve her small eatery to offer her customers improved customer service. This is Elizabeth's 7th loan with MFP and she is determined to save a little every day so that she can make her repayments on time. With the 3000 soles requested she will buy tables and chairs to better equip the area where she sells food.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy furniture.

loans.name: Antioch Group

texts.en:
Comfort is thirty-four years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Takoradi, which is along the coast in the western region of Ghana. Fishing is the major occupation of the people there. 

Comfort is a fish monger. She makes income mainly from this businesses to support her family. She is the leader of a village trust bank group called Antioch. The members are all traders and food vendors who support their families through these businesses. They want to use the loan to purchase stock in bulk to avoid price hikes and also cut down on frequent travels. They are expecting to make higher profits this season to help pay their kids school fees. Your support would enable them grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock in bulk.

loans.name: Nurali

texts.en: Nurali T. is 40 years old. He is married with five children. From the time he was young, Nurali learned to work in small business with his parents. With a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer in agriculture in the area where he lives. After he married, he continued working in the same business, watching the business grow as a result of his sacrifice and seeing his family progressing more and more. With that income, Nurali was able to open a dispensary in his house and also raise cattle successfully. His hope is to continue growing and improving his business to offer a better future for his children and see them as professional, ethical and hardworking. For this reason he is asking for a loan of $800. He wants this loan to buy livestock, as raising and selling the animals generates an excellent profit margin. Be an important part of the growth of Nurali’s business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle to expand the business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana pertenece al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Juana vive en la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco. La ciudad de Rayanniyoc esta ubicado a una 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
  
Juana se levanta muy temprano para hacer sus actividades del hogar como por ejemplo preparar desayuno y mandar a sus hijos menores al colegio. Juana tiene una pequeña chacra donde siembra cebolla, orégano, papa, papaliza y muchas semillas más. La socia también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Juana requiere el préstamo para invertir en la educación de sus hijos y también va comprar más semillas y fertilizantes para la chacra. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the “VILLA RAYANNIYOC” Community Bank through Kiva partner Asociación Arariwa. She is 51 years old, married and has four children. She lives in the city of Rayanniyoc, province of Calca, department of Cusco, Peru, about 30 miles from the city of Cusco. Juana gets up very early to take care of her household duties, for instance preparing breakfast and sending her small children to school. She has a small farm where she grows onion, oregano, potato and many other items. Juana also makes a living raising small animals. She has been dedicated to her business for a number of years and it has been going well thanks to her hard work. Juana is requesting a loan so she can invest in her children's education as well as purchase more seeds and fertilizers for her land. She is grateful for the opportunity this program provides and promises to fulfill her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her children's education as well as purchase more seeds and fertilizers for her land

loans.name: Margarita Verónica

texts.es:
La señora Margarita J. es comerciante del mercado central de Chinandega desde hace quince años donde tiene un negocio de venta de productos de uso doméstico como productos de madera como sillas, ollas de aluminio, perchas, entre otros.

Es madre de tres niños, dos en edad escolar, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo ya que el también trabaja en un taller. Es importante destacar que ella y su esposo se esfuerzan por sacar adelante a sus hijos y que no les falte nada y puedan tener comida y techo donde vivir.

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de los productos de uso doméstico tanto de madera y de aluminio para así ofrecerlos en el negocio y obtener los ingresos para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
Margarita Verónica J. G. has been a businesswoman in this market for 15 years. She has a business selling various products like glasses, plates, aluminum pots, wood chairs, and hangers, etc. She has three children; two are school-age. She has her husband’s support because he also works in a shop. She has worked with Ceprodel for three years. She and her husband put forth great effort to get their children ahead and to make sure they do not need anything (food, a roof over their heads). She opens her business at nine in the morning, and she closes it at four in the afternoon everyday, even on Sundays. She always takes money out to invest in her business. She takes advantage of paying in cash and is able to get reductions and discounts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy aluminum pots and plastic products

loans.name: Ma. Chita

texts.en:
Ma. Chita P. is from the village of Cabu-an, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Ma. Chita is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Ma. Chita owns and operates a business venture in the food sector; she runs a bakeshop. Though not the only means by which it generates revenue, the business' main source of income is the baking and selling of bread in the local community. Ma. Chita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2009 Ma. Chita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Chita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ma. Chita has now opted to request a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in the expansion of her business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Ma. Chita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI: 
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Veronica Atieno

texts.en:
Veronica Atieno is a 30-year-old single mother to Shalin Achieng, who is 10 years old and in primary school, and Wallace Otieno, who is 4 years old and is in nursery school. They live in Nyalenda, a town in Kisumu city.

Veronica runs a hairdressing salon and she has been operating it for the last eight years. She has a gift in plaiting ladies’ hair as she started doing it while still young.

Veronica is applying for her first loan through KADET to enable her to purchase a hairdryer to add to her salon. It has been a challenge when customers come to have their hair set to find that she doesn’t have a hair dryer available. 

Veronica’s desire is to diversify into selling clothes and in future open a boutique alongside her hairdressing salon.

loans.use: To buy a hairdryer for her salon

loans.name: Ake

texts.en:
Ake P. is 40 and married with 8 children.  She owns a business venture, 0.  Ake has 3 years of experience in this business.  Ake needs a loan of WST $1500 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 260 talas or US $108 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Ake joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Ake's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Ake P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Olexander

texts.en:
Olexander, who is the married father of three daughters, is a small businessman from the region of Vinogradovo, Kherson where he owns several greenhouses and grows early spring vegetables including cabbage, tomatoes, peppers, sunflowers and watermelons. He has been in this business for 10 years and presently has about 100,000 Grivnyas invested in this farming business.

Olexander is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase seeds, fertilizers and a drip irrigation unit for his greenhouses. He believes better quality equipment will facilitate vegetable growth and guarantee richer harvests and better sales as a result. An experienced farmer and agronomist, he loves working with plants and agricultural produce. Olexander hopes to continue expanding his business, building new greenhouses and growing more vegetables and melons for sale in the markets of his region.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and a drip irrigation unit

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.es:
Jeronima pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA D. INQUILPATA” D. la Asociación Arariwa. 

Jeronima tiene 48 años y tiene cuatro hijos D. los cuales depenD. todavía D. la socia, ella vive en la comunidad D. Inquilpata del distrito D. Anta del departamento del Cusco. Su principal actividad económica es la venta D. chanchos y su actividad económica complementaria es la venta D. queso y leche, ella venD. sus productos en el Campo Ferial D. la Comunidad Campesina D. Inquilpata-Anta los días viernes. 

Jeronima es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia, ella requiere el crédito para comprar chanchos. 
 
Jeronima se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Jeronima belongs to the community bank “VIRGEN MARIA D. INQUILPATA” with Asociación Arariwa. Jeronima is 48 years old and has four children that still depend on her. She lives in the community of Inquilpata in the district of Anta in the department of Cusco. Her principal economic activity is the sale of pigs and her complementary economic activity is the sale of cheese and milk. She sells the products in the Fair Grounds in the Country Community of Inquilpata-Anta on Fridays. Jeronima is am entrepreneurial and hard working woman that at every moment finds the opportunities to get ahead and with her daily strength to help her family. She needs the loan to buy pigs. Jeronima is grateful for this opportunity and is committed to complete the payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jeronima needs the loan to buy pigs.

loans.name: Noeub

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a young, married mother blessed with a small child whom she cares for as the child does not yet attend school. To help with the family’s living expenses, S. works as a waitress in a pizza company located in the middle of Siem Reap province. She has been receiving a suitable salary to resolve the family's financial problems. As his responsibility for the family's daily living expenses, S.’s husband is an internal staff member in a private ministry of education. S. will be using her first loan to construct a hedge to surround her house to protect the property; the rest of the loan will buy material to decorate her house.

loans.use: to construct a hedge to surround her house to protect the property

loans.name: Ferolyn

texts.en:
46-year-old Ferolyn D. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Ferolyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ferolyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Ferolyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ferolyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ferolyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Ferolyn from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: M'ringera

texts.en:
M'ringera is 74 years old and is married with five children who are all adults.

M'ringera is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town. He has been practicing mixed farming for forty years and employs one permanent employee and one casual laborer. His products are potatoes, cabbages and milk which he sells to the local market. His main challenges in farming are the high cost of inputs and delayed payments during the glut seasons when milk supply is high and the prices are low.

M'ringera successfully completed a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes 45,000. He has requested this new loan of Kes 50,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The income from this loan will improve his family's living standards.

M'ringera hopes to expand his dairy farming by acquiring two more dairy cows. He also plans to grow horticultural products. He is happy with the project because it has helped him buy dairy cows and will even help him to expand further.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en:
Vugar is 39 years old and an internally displaced person from Fuzuli city. He currently lives in Fuzuli region (an area still under Azerbaijan's jurisdiction). He is married and has three children. His 17 year old daughter studies in university, his 13 year old daughter studies in a music school, and his 10 year old son studies the game of chess. For the past 3 years, Vugar has been selling the meat and milk produced by his sheep from his home. 

Vugar is seeking a loan of 2000 Azerbaijani manat (AZN) to buy more sheep so that he can increase the amount of meat and milk he produces. There is high demand for his products, especially from his neighbors who enjoy the taste and quality of his products. This is his first loan.

loans.use: to buy more sheep

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. is from the village of Centro Norte, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 53 years old and is married with four adult children.

Teresita owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia N. is from the town of Centro Napu, Tudela, Mis. Occ. She is 73 years old. Cornelia is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Cornelia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Cornelia is just starting this business.

In 2010, Cornelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cornelia is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Zikusooka Women's Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
By and large, the last 3 years have seen 60 year old N. Christine succeed in making profitable use of the relative short time that she has been at the helm of her fish sales business in Nkokonjeru-Lugazi. She has used her down the line sense of determination to make the progress she only envisaged at the beginning. She was prevailed upon by her husband to begin this business. She supplies the profit deficiencies in her fish sales business with modest additional profits from a firewood sales business. 

Christine is a good humored, married woman with 5 children. In a month, she makes as much as 900,000 shillings and, with this loan, she is anticipating revamping her business. She specifically wants to buy more firewood to sell.

loans.use: The purchase of more fire wood to sell.

loans.name: Ma.ana

texts.en:
Ma. Ana N. is a married woman who lives in Purok Riverside, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: vegetable vending, food vending, and a livestock businesses. Her husband Rey, who is 45 years old, also buys and sells livestock, in addition to helping with his wife's businesses.  

They have 2 children who are 4 and 16. Ma. Ana joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Ana has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 14,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to pay for more stocks of vegetables and an extension of her stall. She plans to continue to save up for the future education of children and a house renovation. Ma. Ana N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Mr A. Kossi est né en 1988 à Kpalimé. Il réside actuellement à Gapé Atchanvé. Il n’eut pas la chance de poursuivre ses études secondaires fautes de soutien. Pour se prendre en charge, il fait le commerce ambulant de villages en villages en vendant de produits de premières nécessités notamment les pâtes alimentaires, savons, boîtes de conserves et autres. Son objectif est d’ouvrir une petite boutique d’alimentation générale. C’est à cette fin qu’il sollicite un crédit qui va lui servir à s’installer et à approvisionner sa boutique en marchandises (savons, pâtes alimentaires, huiles, boîtes de conserves et autres) sur la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en: Mr A. Kossi est né en 1988 à Kpalimé. Il réside actuellement à Gapé Atchanvé. Il n’eut pas la chance de poursuivre ses études secondaires fautes de soutien. Pour se prendre en charge, il fait le commerce ambulant de villages en villages en vendant de produits de premières nécessités notamment les pâtes alimentaires, savons, boîtes de conserves et autres. Son objectif est d’ouvrir une petite boutique d’alimentation générale. C’est à cette fin qu’il sollicite un crédit qui va lui servir à s’installer et à approvisionner sa boutique en marchandises (savons, pâtes alimentaires, huiles, boîtes de conserves et autres) sur la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: ouvrir une boutique d’alimentation générale et l'approvisionner

loans.name: Diana Virginia

texts.es:
El clienta Diana Virginia P. López. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león Iglesia Católica 3 ½ C al Norte . Casada  trabaja actual mente en MINED santa Rosa del peñón desempeñan el cargo como maestra de educación primaria   a cursado quinto año. En Magisterio tiene 18 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de sin para el mejoramiento de su techo. Esto le permitirá que la clienta pueda obtener una mejor condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Diana Virginia P. L.lives in the Santa Rosa Del Peñón municipality in the León Iglesia Católica 3 ½ C North section.  She is married, and currently works in MINED in Santa Rosa del Peñón as a primary school teacher.  She has been at this institution for 18 years.

She has a home of her own, which she would like to make improvements to.  The loan would be used to buy supplies to repair her roof that, in turn, would allow her to provide a nicer living environment for her family.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita M. is from the city of Malaubang Ozamis. She is 61 years old. Pedrita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Pedrita owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, toothpaste, powder for laundry, soap, sugar, salt, biscuits etc. in the local community. Pedrita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pedrita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pedrita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell  Pedrita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Pedrita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rechael

texts.en:
Rechael N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Luweero in the Luweero region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. Rechael has a business of selling vegetables, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Rechael has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase tomatoes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rechael hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Rechael hopes to own a retail shop. Rechael is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving on her business.

loans.use: Tomatoes

loans.name: Lovyne

texts.en:
Lovyne L. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Sta. Cruz, Brgy. Don Virgilio, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fishing / fish vending and food vending businesses. Her husband Dario L., who is 38 years old, works in furniture to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are seven to 17 years old.

 Lovyne joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Lovyne has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,200, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use as working capital for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Lovyne L. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams.
