They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund business operations

loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.en:
Nurbubu A. is 50 years old and married. She was born in a large family and from early childhood she helped her parents around the house.   Nurbubu got married at the age of 21 and had three children. In 1983, Nurbubu with her husband started to work at the Karabalta’s carpet factory but their wages didn’t cover household expenses, like rent and supplies. For this reason, Nurbubu decided to start her own business in furniture production. She purchased a garage to use as a furniture workshop and bought equipment. Nurbubu has been engaged in this activity for more than 20 years and has achieved success. With the revenues,  Nurbubu was able to buy an undeveloped house, where she still lives with her family. Last year, she obtained her first loan from Bai Tushum and Partners for purchasing wood and repaid it without any delays. 

Now Nurbubu plans to use the loan of 40,000 Kyrgyz Soms to buy wood, fibreboards and fittings. With the revenues from this investment, Nurbubu plans to open a furniture-making shop near her house.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population.  Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase materials for furniture manufacturing

loans.name: Mary Owiti

texts.en:
Mary Ogondo is 43 years old a widow and has three children; Fredrick, 20 years, Josephine, 22 years and Chris, 13 years old.

Mary sells motor vehicle spare parts in Jua Kali, in Kisumu county.  She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client.  Mary wants to use the money to buy motor vehicle spare parts to add to her stock.  Her monthly income is Kes 12,000. 

Her desire is to expand her business and open another hardware shop.

loans.use: Buy more motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Lem

texts.en: Lem S. is a hard-working woman who tries her best to support her family. She is a Khmer noodle seller and she always gets up early in the morning to go around her community to sell Khmer food. She has been operating this business since 2007, and she makes a profit of approximately $2.50 per day to use for daily expenses in the family. Lem S. has other income from her husband. He is a motor taxi driver, and he always shares his revenue with Lem S.. Unfortunately, his existing motorbike has often broken down during use. Because of that, Lem S. has decided to seek a loan of $1200 from Kiva that she will use to replace the broken motorcycle.

loans.use: To replace her husband's broken motorcycle.

loans.name: Fousseyni

texts.fr:
Monsieur FOUSSEYNI Koné est un homme marié de 30 ans, monogame qui est père de deux enfants. Il  vit avec son épouse et ses enfants dans le quartier Koko de Kolondièba,  troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du  Mali. 
Monsieur Koné en plus de ses activités de maçonnerie fait aussi le stockage des céréales depuis maintenant  5 ans.  
Afin d’augmenter son capital il adhère au programme crédit du prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est à son premier cycle. C’est un jeune qui a abandonné l’école au second cycle du  fondamental (système éducatif Malien).
Avec ce prêt, il compte avoir acheter, 4 tonnes  de maïs  pour les revendre à aux grossistes de Kolondièba. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  21.875  F CFA qui sera investi dans les articles  divers afin de mieux diversifier ses activités génératrices de revenus, en ouvrant une boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Fousseyni Koné is a monogamous, 30-year-old married man and father of two children. He lives with his wife and children in the neighborhood of Koko, in Kolondièba, Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Koné quit school in the second cycle of the fundamental program (Mali’s educational system). In addition to working as a mason, he has also been engaged in grain storage for five years.

Wanting to increase his working capital, he joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution to avail himself of its individual loan program for grain storage and marketing. This is his first loan cycle with the organization. 

He plans to use the loan to buy four tons of corn to be sold to Kolondièba wholesalers. He gets his stocks in surrounding villages and hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 21,875 FCFA, which will be invested in various items to diversify his income generating activities by opening a shop.

loans.use: To purchase grain

loans.name: Denkisse Group

texts.fr:
Les neuf membres du groupe DENKISSE (8 mariés et 1 veuve) avec une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, le prêt passé est payé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de de tasses à travers MARIAM S. .
MARIAM S.  compte acheter avec son  prêt  5 douzaines de tasses  .
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Sikasso et à Bamako .
Les tasses sont revendus au  marché de SANOUBOUGOU à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The nine members of the group named Denkisse (8 are married and 1 is a widow) have an average age of 26 and they each have 2 children. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the quarters in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region in Mali). 

They are on their second loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner). Their goal is to satisfy client demand. The previous loans were all successfully repaid. This group of women is involved in the sale of kitchenware through Mariam S.. 

Mariam S. plans on investing her loan on the purchase of 5 dozen cups. 

She makes her purchases at the large market in Sikasso and Bamako. 

The cups are resold in the market in Sanoubougou and Sikasso to family and to a clientele made of men and women. She completes her sales in cash. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 45.000 FCFA which will be used for her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase cups.

loans.name: Federico

texts.en:
Federico is a widower who lives in Brgy. San Pablo, Manapla, Negros Occidental. He earns his living by operating 3 businesses: sugarcane hauling, rice retailing and dry goods sales. He has 4 children between the ages of 22 and 35. Federico joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because he hoped for something better for his family. With the help of his past 8 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through his own efforts, Federico has been incrementally lifting his family out of poverty.

Federico's previous loan of PHP 2,500 helped him earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for his 9th loan, he is borrowing PHP 25,000, which he intends to use to pay for spare truck parts and to fund his other businesses so that he can continue to save up for the future expansion of his rice and dry goods businesses. Federico B. is a Dungganon man who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of his dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to buy spare truck parts and to fund his businesses

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina I. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 54 years old. Esterlina is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Esterlina owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and selling chorizzo & langgonisa or home made sausage in the local community. Esterlina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esterlina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients & working capital. Esterlina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed such as ground pork. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Esterlina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase raw ingredients such as ground pork

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine is 24, married, and has a 1-year-old child. She and her husband own a boutique together for the past 3 years. They would like this loan to reinvest in their business, and with the profits, they hope to increase their capital and begin a savings account.

loans.use: Reinvest in their business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Catalina, de 43 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Victoriano de 53 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeña Catalina aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra arveja, papa, olluco y cebada, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 21 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Su deseo es comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Catalina, age 43, is a simple hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with husband Victoriano, age 53, and their five beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. As young girl, Catalina learned from her parents how to work on a farm. They showed her everything that needed to be done to achieve a good crop. Now she has her own land that she cultivates and cares for with much love and patience. She grows peas, potatoes, ulluco, and barley to sell at the wholesale market in Tarma. What she enjoys most about her job is harvesting her crops because she feels that her hard work yields fruitful results. Catalina has been farming for 21 years and considers the most difficult part to be protecting her crops from diseases that could have a harmful effect. Her wish is to buy additional farmland so that she can increase her production.

This is her seventh loan with MFP. Catalina knows that she must submit her payments on time and is willing to do so. She is one of the most cheerful members of her Communal Bank and always shares her sense of humor with the group. The loan of 1500 PEN that she is requesting will be used to buy compost for her land because she wants her new crops to yield good results.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of compost.

loans.name: Sann

texts.en:
Mrs. Sann was born in 1967 married to Mr. Ing who was also born in 1967.  They are farmers, who own a 1.50-hectare plot of land, which they use to grow rice and corn for their family living. 

They do not have enough money to buy what they need, to support their farming activities. Therefore, Mrs. Sann decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and corn seeds for the farm. The couple has three children, who all are students.  The children also help their parents with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds, and corn seeds for farming

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de comida y pupusas, reside en San Miguel, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 28, 15 y 12 años de edad, ella tiene el negocio desde hace 11 años y trabaja todos los días de 7:00am a 6:00pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar productos para la venta tanto de comida como pupusas, los materiales que comprara son Aceite, carnes, condimentos, quesillo, entre otros que son necesarios; Esta inversión le ayudara a contar con disponibilidad de ingredientes y poder dar abasto a la demanda.
El objetivo de ella es crecer en el negocio, apoyar a sus hijos y que estos salgan adelante con sus estudios y puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Ana sells food and pupusas.  She lives in San Miguel and is a single mother.  She has three children aged 28, 15 and 12.  She has owned her business for 11 years and works every day, from 7.00am to 6.00pm.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy products to sell, both food and pupusas.  She will buy oil, meat, condiments, quesillo (soft cheese) and other products she needs.  This investment will help her as it means she will continue to have ingredients available and she will be able to meet her demand.

Ana's goal is to grow in her business, to support her children and for her children to get ahead in their studies and be able to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy oil, meat, condiments and 'quesillo' (soft cheese)

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is widowed and has eight children, four of whom are currently in school. Jane has a salon business, which she has run for two years. She also has a second business selling sugar cane.
To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is from the village of Kidahon, Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Rosa is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts and bananas in the local community. Rosa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Rosa is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional coconuts and bananas. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconuts and bananas

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es: La señora Romelia y su esposo son una pareja muy estable desde hace 14 años aproximadamente adquirieron su vivienda de interés social pensando en el bienestar de sus hijos para ofrecer un hogar digno y respetable. Este tipo de casa son un poco incomodas ya que hay ocasiones, el terreno donde se ubica esta muy cerca del vecino solamente los separan unos cuantos metros y de la única manera para solucionar el problema es bardear alrededor de la vivienda para tener privacidad de uno a otro. Por  tal motivo Romelia recurre al a institución solicitando apoyo para comprar el material y pagar mano de obra para realizar su proyecto y no quiere tener problemas con su vecino para seguir manteniendo una amistad.
texts.en: Romelia and her husband are an established couple.  About 14 years ago, wanting to offer their children a proper and respectable home, they got a house for low-income people.  This type of housing is a bit uncomfortable because the land on which it is located is only a few meters apart from the neighbors'.  The only way to solve this problem is to build a wall around the house so they can have some privacy.  For this reason, Romelia is asking for help to buy the material needed and to pay for the labor, since she does not want to have problems with her neighbors and wants to keep the peace.

loans.use: to build a wall around her home.

loans.name: Alisa's Group

texts.en:
Alisa is the leader of this group. She is 24, and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up a three year-old son. In order to earn money to meet their daily needs, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds cattle. The family started to breed cattle four years ago with an initial investment of 45,000 soms.

Alisa applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing a calf to increase the cattle stock. In the near future, Alisa plans to enlarge a shed, where she keeps cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Las Alondras Del Creston Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Las Alondras del Crestón" tiene este nombre porque el lugar de donde se reúnen pasa un rio y bajan a bañarse las aves (alondras). Esta ubicado en el estado de Hidalgo en México. El grupo esta conformado por 9 integrantes. La señora Eusebia es integrante del grupo. Ella vende antojitos mexicanos desde hace 30 años. Solicito el préstamo para invertir en insumospara su negocio. Los clientes dicen que les agrada comer porque la señora es muy amable. En este momento se siente contenta y con muchas ganas de trabajar, ya que solicita el prestamo para mejorar su negocio y seguir brindando un buen servicio, quiere continuar mejorando su negocio e incrementar el número de clientes para expandirse y ser una de las mejores vendedoras de la zona. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere ahorrar para seguir invirtiendo y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Alondras del Crestón” (Crestón’s Larks).  It has this name because a river flows past the place they meet at and birds (larks) alight to bathe.  It is located in the Mexican state of Hidalgo.  It has 9 members.

Eusebia is a group member.  She’s sold Mexican fast food snacks for the last 30 years.  She asked for the loan to buy ingredients for her business.  Customers tell us that they enjoy eating because the lady is very kind.  

At present she feels very happy and with much desire to work since she’s asking for the loan to improve her business and to continue to provide good service.  She wants to continue improving the business and increasing the number of her customers to expand and be one of the best sellers in the zone.  She will use profits obtained to save and continue investing and to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make fast food snacks.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a 41-year-old married father of four children aged between two months and ten. He owns a retail shop in Mariakani, a business that has been in operation for the last two years and which has been a success. 

Morris has been a KADET client and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase wheat flour, tea leaves and cooking oil for his business. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to gradually expand his business. His hope and dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, tea leaves and cooking oil.

loans.name: Asahel

texts.en: Asahel is a 33 year old hardworking man with two children living in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. He has been selling soda and beer for seven years. He started his business with 4,000,000UGX, but now has stock worth eight million UGX. He faces a challenge of defaulters and his dream is to own a depot. Asahel needs a loan to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Paraiso Perdido Group

texts.es: L. SRA GUILLIANA D. 36 AÑOS D. EDAD,MADRE SOLTERA CON DOS HIJOS EN ETAPA ESCOLAR,ES SOCIA D. GRUPO PARAISO PERDIDO.L. SRA GUILLIANA EN L. ACTUALIDAD SE DEDICA A L.  VENTA D. COMIDA  EN UN PUESTO AMBULATORIO QUE ESTA UBICADO EN L. PLAZA PRINCIPAL D. IZCUCHACA,POR LAS TARDES L. SRA GUILLIANA TAMBIEN SE DEDICA A L. VENTA D. BOLLOS Y EMPANADAS.L. SRA GUILLIANA SOLICITO EL PRESTAMO PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA  Y ASI PODER IMPLEMENTAR SU NEGOCIO CON UNA GRAN VARIEDAD D. PRODUCTOS. L. SRA GUILLIANA QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO PODER TENER SU  PROPIO RESTURANTE  PARA ASI PODER OBTENER MAS INGRESOS .L. SRA GUILLIANA SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA A LADO IZQUIERDO D. L. SRA QUE VISTE  UN POLO COLOR CELESTE .L. SRA GUILLIANA  VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR NEGRO Y TIENE LAS MANOS CRUZADAS.
texts.en:
Sra. Guilliana is 36 years old and a single mother with two school-age children. She is a member of the group “Paraíso Perdido” (Paradise Lost). Sra. Guilliana currently sells food in the afternoons from a mobile street cart in the main plaza of Izcuchaca. She also sells buns and turnovers.

Sra. Guilliana is requesting a loan so that she can buy more supplies to keep her business in operation and help her offer a wiD. variety of products. In the future, she wants to have her own restaurant so that she can earn more income.

In the photograph, Sra. Guilliana is the woman who is wearing a black sweater and has her arms crossed.

loans.use: to buy more supplies.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
59-year-old Cecilia is a married woman with eight children. Her oldest child is 37 years old while the youngest is 18.

Cecilia is a farmer working in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. According to Cecilia, she has been engaged in farming for 40 years. Her income from farming has allowed her to provide for their basic needs and send her children to school.

Cecilia is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes for this loan to help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Jose Antonio es soltero, tiene 20 años de edad, curso los 9 años de educación escolar, se dedica a tomar fotografías y al tejido de telas típicas, inicio el trabajo de tejidos siendo empleado para otro negocio, y ahora va iniciar su propio negocio.

Por eso solicita un préstamo que le servirá para compra de telar e hilos necesarios para realizar este trabajo, espera ver su negocio en el futro con varios empleados.
texts.en:
Jose Antonio is a single young man who is 20 years of age. He completed nine years of his education. Jose Antonio takes photographs and also produces traditional woven fabrics. He started weaving as an employee of another business, but now he has started his own business.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy a loom and yarn, since these are the necessary items for completing his work. In the future, he hopes to see his business with several employees.

loans.use: to purchase a loom and yarn to start his weaving business.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is married with three children.  Virgincita is 55 years old and lives in Pangi, Siquijor.

To earn a living, Virgincita sells "longganisa" every day and has has this type of business for three months.  She has requested a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for the "longganisa" business to sell in her neighborhood.

Virgincita has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for five months.  In the future, Virgincita hopes to gain more income and have savings deposited for her family`s good future.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for 'longganisa' (sausages) to sell in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Marvin Antonio

texts.es:
Marvin, continua trabajando con préstamos, los cuales necesita para fortalecer el negocio y comprar la materia prima para el comedor y  la pupuseria, de esa forma podrá tener más ingresos económicos. Lo que necesita comprar es carnes, arroz, aceite, bebidas (gaseosas y jugos), todo pues, para atender de manera eficiente a la clientela.
El sueño de Marvin, ampliar su negocio, mejorar en sus ganancias y que su familia tenga una mejor vida.
texts.en: Marvin continues working with loans, which he needs to strengthen his business and buy the ingredients for his restaurant, and in this way he will be able to earn more income. He needs to purchase meats, rice, oils, beverages (soft drinks and juices) and other items to tend to his customers efficiently. Marvin's dream is to expand his business, increase his revenue and for his family to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy furnishings and materials to prepare for his food sales.

loans.name: Kidemi

texts.en:
Kidemi is 34-years old and married with three children who are in school. He does mixed farming i.e. rearing sheep and wheat farming which he has been doing for the past seven years.

Kidemi learned about Kadet through a KADET staff member and he is a good client. He has currently applied for his third loan which he plans to spend part on farming and the remainder to purchase more sheep for fattening.

Kidemi hopes to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. He dreams of expanding his farm.

loans.use: To spend part on farming and the remainder on more sheep for fattening.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en: Anahit is from the village of Anoushavan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is the proud mother of a 27-year-old daughter and a 31-year-old son.  She was educated as a nurse and has been working with her husband on the family farm for twenty years.  Anahit helps to support her relatives with fruits and vegetables grown on the family farm.  She is known for being a hardworking, honest person.  Anahit would like a loan to increase her livestock.  According to her plan, this investment will increase her income by 15%.  In addition to helping her children, Anahit dreams of renovating the family home.  Even though life is difficult, she enjoys being a farmer living in Anoushavan.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr. Wilfredo; el tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; El socio sigue con sus negocios de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant junto con su esposa administran los dos negocios,el socio vende diferentes productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,fideos y aceite y tambien su esposa prepara diferentes platos de comida como pollo al horno,estofado de pollo y sopas,el socio por medio de estos pequeños negocios saca adelante a sus hijos,el scoio quiere ampliar y mejorar la atencion de restaurant y rienda de abarrotes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,carne,pollo y verduras para el restaurant y también productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite y leche para la tienda de abarrotes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 40, lives with his partner, and has a son.  He continues to have a grocery store and restaurant. He and his wife run the two businesses. 

He sells various household necessities, such as rice, sugar, noodles, and oil. As well, his wife prepares different dishes such as baked chicken, chicken stew, and soups. He is supporting his family by means of these small businesses. He wants to expand and improve the restaurant service and the grocery store. 

He is applying for the loan in order to buy cooking ingredients for the restaurant, such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables, as well as products for the grocery store, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and milk.

Wilfredo is happy to receive the loan, and is committed to making his instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients for the restaurant, such as rice, meat, chicken and vegetables, as well as products for the grocery store, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and milk.

loans.name: Waliki Sartasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WALIKI SARTASIÑANI” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Eleuteria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de api, confección de ropa, venta de cuadernos, macramé, venta de pescados, venta de comida.

La señora Eleuteria,  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta y elaboración de ropa (pollera y mantas).

El crédito que ahora sacará es para la compra de una máquina de confección (máquina recta) que adquirirá de la 16 de julio y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Waliki Sartasiñani” is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Eleuteria. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses in order to get ahead such as selling corn porridge, making clothes, selling notebooks, macramé, selling fish, and selling food.

Sra. Eleuteria says that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer. She joined the organization after receiving an invitation from one of the other members. At the moment, she has a business making and selling clothes (traditional skirts and shawls).

The loan she is receiving now will be used to buy an upright sewing machine which she will acquire in the July 16th neighborhood. She will then sell her products from her vending post. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family. Eleuteria is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Eleuteria said she enjoys the health services.

loans.use: to buy an upright sewing machine.

loans.name: Roselle Jane

texts.en:
Roselle Jane is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Roselle Jane has a shop that makes and sells longganisa (home-made sausages). She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy the raw ingredients she needs to make the sausages. 

Roselle Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Roselle Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed to make home-made sausages.

loans.name: Alex Efrain

texts.es: El sr. Alex es Chapista (arreglo de movilidades, pintado) hace varios años,  vive en casa familiar en la casa de los Papás del Titular, tiene 3 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el taller que tiene el cliente es en la casa de sus papás, otro ingreso es el puesto de comida que tiene la esposa en el mercado cerca de la zona donde viven, ambos trabajan por el bienestar de su familia, ya que desean un bienestar para sus hijos  El crédito lo invertirán en compra de algunas herramientas  para su taller de chapería y compra de materiales de construcción  para techar el taller ya que esta época es época de lluvia  y esto le perjudica en el trabajo diario, y con el techado podrá ya trabajar sin dificultad, es Sr. Alex es una persona joven con ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el trabajo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Alex is an auto mechanic who has been performing paint and body work for several years. He lives in the home of his parents and has three school-age children. His workshop is located at his parents’ house. To earn additional income, his wife operates a food stall at a nearby market in the district where they live. Both of them work for the welfare of their family. They desire the best for their children.

Alex will invest in this loan in the purchase of equipment for his repair shop and construction materials so that he can install a roof over his shop for the rainy season, which can have a negative impact on his daily work. Having a roof will allow him to work without any difficulties. Sr. Alex is a young person who has the desire to succeed. He is grateful to Emprender for the work it has done.

loans.use: to purchase equipment and construction materials for installing a roof over his repair shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: For the past 10 years Mary has been cooking banku and serving it with hot pepper sauce and fried fish at Ayinase, near Elmina. She is married to a driver and has four children who are currently in school. She hopes to expand her banku business and so needs a loan to buy maize, pepper, tomatoes, cassava dough, and firewood to make her food production easier. Her future plan is to build a better place to host her customers.

loans.use: to purchase maize, tomatoes, cassava dough, and firewood for cooking banku

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 50 year-old married woman with 8 children. Her husband is a farmer.

Rebecca runs a sari-sari (convenience) store business in Trinidad, Bohol, where she also lives with her family.   She sells items like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, soap and shampoo.  Rebecca also helps her husband manage their rice farm.

Rebecca has requested this loan to buy fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar and eggs.  Rebecca plans to use her profit to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 49 year old woman from Baqa'a Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell. She would like to expand her project so that she can better supporting her mother.
In the future she wants to increase her social economic status.

Amal prefers not to put her photo on the internet, thus the above photo is of her brother

loans.use: to pay for materials for flower arranging to sell.

loans.name: Rosilah

texts.en:
Hello,
Meet 20 year old Chantal, living with her parents in Mathare north, Nairobi Kenya. She is the eight born kid in a family of ten; five girls and five boys. Born in a large family of humble backgrounds with only my mother working as a janitor was really hard, having school fees was a challenge but her parents tried their best and managed to see her through primary and secondary school with the help of governmental bursary and parents added the little they could find.
Chantal currently works with Digital Divide Data Kenya where she is offered a partial scholarship to register at Kenyatta University. However, more money is required to cover her tuition balance. Therefore she is requesting for $500 to cover the fee deficit. She wants to pursue her dreams of becoming a teacher by earning a bachelor’s of Education Arts. With this degree, she will be able to use her knowledge and expertise to impart her students positively, uplift her family, support needy people in the society, save for the future and gain confidence to tackle any challenges that may came ahead.
Her dream of completing a degree may only be a reality with a KIVA loan.
Thanks.

loans.use: TO PAY FOR SCHOOL FEES

loans.name: Evgenia

texts.en:
Evgenia M. is 42 years old. She was born in the town of Biala Slatina but after she graduated the Specialized Technical School in Vratza she decided to stay in the city.

After graduation Evgenia has worked as a support manager in a technical company but it was closed so 10 years ago she found her little shop in which she sells spares for electric appliances.

Her husband also has a business. He is an aeromechanic and has his own garage. She and her husband have a daughter who is a student.

Evgenia M. needs to supply some extra spares for electric appliances so she needs a $ 1200 loan.

loans.use: To supply some extra spares for electric appliances

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo has a restaurant in the market where he sells breakfast, lunch and snacks. He started his business by borrowing 200 dollars from his brother. He started out selling breakfast only. With a lot of effort he now offers not only breakfast but lunch, snacks, and sweets.

Richard would use the loan to buy an industrial kitchen. This new tool would set the stage for the growth of his business, since he would be able to cook in much larger quantities.

Ricardo is 56 years old and married. He has 4 children, one of whom one is still in school. He depends entirely on his business to support his family. Ricardo has confidence that this loan will give him economic security and allow him to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Ricardo tiene un comedor donde vende desayunos, almuerzos y meriendas en el mercado. Ricardo empezó su negocio prestando un dinero a su hermano de 200 dólares. Él empezó sólo vendiendo desayunos. Con mucho esfuerzo ahora él ofrece este mismo servicio junto a almuerzos, piqueos y golosinas.

Ricardo usara el préstamo para invertir en comprar una cocina industrial. Esta nueva herramienta de trabajo le facilitara el crecimiento de su negocio, ya que el podrá cocinar en cantidades mucho mas grandes.

Ricardo tiene 56 años, está unido tiene cuatro hijos uno de ellos estudia. Él depende completamente del negocio para apoyar a su familia. Ricardo tiene la confianza que este préstamo le dará seguridad económica a su familia y permitirle adecuar su vivienda.

loans.use: Buy an industrial kitchen

loans.name: Dayanat

texts.en:
This young man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fizuli region. He settled in the Salyan region in Khaladj village, and he is single.

Dayanat breeds sheep. He has had his own business since 2005. This 26-year-old man thinks about his future, and he wants to provide himself with a better future. He has a lot of plans. Now, he needs a loan of $600 to buy 10 sheep in order to improve his sheep-breeding business.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a hard working woman who started her "fritureria" business, which is a place where she fries and sells food to customers. She started it about 7-8 months ago, and before that she used to work at a house as a cleaning lady. She buys her food in the market, and in her establishment she sells salami, plantains, and other foodstuff.

She is a single mother with four children and she was born and raised in her community of Los Caños.

loans.use: To fix her establishment

loans.name: Korkmaz

texts.ru:
Korkmaz A. was born and lives in the town of Aksu. He is married and has 4 children. In 2005, he took his first loan of $300 from Aksu branch of Normicro to open a business. He used the money to rent a small store where he now sells a variety of goods. Korkmaz paid off his first loan promptly and took another one in 2006 to purchase additional inventory. Korkmaz A. has been in business for three years. Now he wants to take a $1000 loan to repair his store and purchase additional inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Коркмаз родилься и проживает в городе Аксу. Семейный, имеет четверо детей. Первый раз взял в кредит из Аксунского филиала ООО Нормикро 2005 году 300$, чтобы открыт свой бизнес. Взял в аренду небольшой магазин и продает различные товары. Он вовремя вернул кредит и 2006 году второй раз взял кредит 600$. На эти деньги купил необходимый инвентарь для магазина. Коркмаз уже третий год занимаеться этим бизнесом. До этого занималься скотоводством и занимаеться. Теперь он еще раз хочеть взять кредит 1000 $. На этот кредит будет отремонтировать магазин и купить больше товаров.

loans.use: Store repair and purchase of additional inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en: Svetlana is a friendly entrepreneur who offers customers a great selection of teas and coffees from her colorful kiosk at one of the busy outdoor markets in Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, Ukraine. Svetlana’s husband, Valeriy, originally started the business eight years ago. It has now become a family venture with both Svetlana and Valeriy and their daughters helping out with operations. They typically make an annual income of around 40,000 Ukrainian Ghrivna from their business, which works out to about $8,000. In the near future, Svetlana and Valeriy hope to be able to open a grocery store which will expand their business and hopefully increase their income. Svetlana has requested a loan of $1000 that will add to their available working capital and allow them to continue developing and improving their business.

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Florence Adu

texts.en:
Florence Adu – G. sells provisions (milk, milo, oats, rice, biscuits, minerals, and mineral water). She is married with three children ages 16, 12 and 8 years respectively. Her husband is a steel bender and his income is low. To help with the family finances, Florence works very hard. In addition to the provisions that she sells, she is also a seamstress and sews dresses for people while at her provision store.

One of the challenges that she faces is that her hand sewing machine is old, so she needs a new machine to help her sew dresses more quickly for people since the old one gives her problems when sewing. Her stock is also going down because she now has to make an advance payment before she receives supplies from her suppliers.

She is therefore asking for a loan of US $1,000 to enable her to make advance payment to her suppliers so that they can supply provisions such as milk, milo, nido, biscuits, sardines, mineral water, and crates of minerals; also, to purchase a new hand sewing machine. She intends to pay the loan back within seven months.

loans.use: To make advance payment to her suppliers for milk, milo, nido, biscuits, sardines, mineral water, and crates of minerals; also, to purchase a new hand sewing machine.

loans.name: Sujayet

texts.en: Sujayet is 43-year-old trader who owns a small store from which she sells clothes and underwear. She imports her quality goods from Russia. She is married and has two children. Sujayet would like to expand her business and applies for a 1000 USD loan.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: María Josefina

texts.es:
María Josefina is a single-mother of 3 children. Because she did not earn enough income from her job to raise her children, she started selling perfumes by catalogue to her friends and neighbors 4 years ago. She now has a long list of customers who order perfume from her.

However, she currently has some orders that she has not been able to fill, so she is requesting a loan of $475.00 USD that she is willing to repay within 6 months. With this loan, she will be able to buy the perfume that her customers ordered, thus generating more revenue. With your support, María will be able to earn extra income that will help her pay for her children’s living expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

María Josefina es madre soltera de 3 niños. Y debido a que con lo que gana en su trabajo no le alcanza para pagar los gastos de sus hijos. Es por lo que comenzó a vender perfumes por catálogo entre sus vecinas y amigos hace 4 años. Actualmente ya cuenta con una cartera grande de clientes que le piden los perfumes.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene unos pedidos que no a podido surtir es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar los perfumes que le encargaron y así tener mayores ingreso. Con tu ayuda María podrá obtener un dinero extra para pagar los gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise

loans.name: Zenobia

texts.es:
Zenobia, is very hard working and she demonstrates this by supporting her parents through her agricultural activities. This help and knowledge has allowed her to get involved more with this activity and now she grows potatoes and corn, also with the help of her husband she has purchased a motortaxi which they use to dedicate themselves to the manufacturing of bricks in their small workshop. The strength that this pair possesses has helped them to succeed with each task they do and thanks to their daily work their two children have health and security. This spring season the requests increased and they cannot get enough material to manufacture their products, because of this they seek your help with the objective of obtaining the quantity that they request to fulfill all the demands.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Zenobia, es muy trabajadora y eso lo demostró cuando apoyaba a sus padres en el desempeño de sus actividades agrícolas, esta ayuda y conocimiento le ha permitido involucrarse mucho más con esta actividad y ahora siembra papa y maíz, también con ayuda de su esposo ha comprado un mototaxi el cual dan en alquiler para dedicarse por entero a la fabricación de tejas en su pequeño taller.La fortaleza que esta pareja posee los ha ayudado a alcanzar cada una de las cosas que se han propuesto y gracias a su desempeño diario pueden otorgarle bienestar y seguridad a sus dos pequeños hijos. Durante esta temporada las solicitudes se incrementan y no disponen de suficiente materia prima para la fabricación de sus productos, por esa razón recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda con el objetivo de obtener la cantidad que solicitan para concretar cada una de las solicitudes que albergan en su taller.

loans.use: To increase capital to acquire a better quantity of material for the manufacture of bricks.

loans.name: Ro Teng Ii Group

texts.en: Mrs. Somaly Chork, Village Bank President, is a single mother with two children in Ro Teng Village. Both of her children attend school. She is 32 years old and she sells vegetable for a living at the Ro TH. market. On average, she can generate approximately $2.50 of income per day. As she is a widow making very limited income, her and her family's standard of living is quite poor; specifically, she is unable to pay for her family’s expenses, such as her children’s educational costs. In order to get her family out of poverty, she is hereby requesting a loan to buy more vegetables to resell at the market for a profit. Mr. Chandy Na S. and Mr. S. Oark V. are not pictured; instead, their wives are pictured in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to resell at the village market.

loans.name: Anweri's Group

texts.en:
Anweri K. has been married for four years and is the mother of an only son, who is two and a half years old. She lives with her family in a two-room brick house in Multan, Pakistan. Her husband runs a pharmacy that he started five years ago. Anweri mostly does her household chores but in her free time she embroiders clothes for her neighborhood clients.

Currently, Anweri and her husband have an income of $100 a month. They want to expand their pharmacy and Anweri hopes that their income will increase after this expansion and will let her build an additional storey on her house. Anweri is the leader of a group with three other women. Zareena B. runs a grocery store, Pakeeza B. has a fruit business, and Sajida B. sells cloth.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand a pharmacy and other businesses

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso is 37 years old and lives with his partner, Luz Mabel who is 33 years old. They have been together for 5 years and have a small child that doesn't attend school yet.

Celso is a craftsman. He works on pottery (making crafts out of clay). He comments that he started in the trade since he was a kid because all of his family worked on it.

The abilities to work with clay are passed from one generation to the next and it was his mother, a renowned local craftwoman, the one that taught Celso since he was little to work with the clay creating different types of figures like: jars, vessels, pitchers, and decorative animals.

He wakes up early every day to start his daily routine while his wife works as a clerk at a known mall in the capital where she goes early as well too.

Celso says that all his pieces are handmade, because in this way they are more precious and are highly quoted and valued especially by foreign tourists that visit the country and want to take a beautiful keepsake back to their home countries.

At this time, Celso needs a loan to invest in expanding his workshop since it is too small and the demand for his products has increased considerably.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Celso tiene 37 años, vive en pareja con Luz Mabel que tiene 33 años de edad. Hace 5 años que están juntos y tienen un hijo pequeño que aún no va a la escuela.

Celso es artesano, se dedica a la alfarería (elaboración de artesanías en barro).Comenta que se inició desde pequeño debido a que toda su familia se dedicaba a este mismo rubro.

Las habilidades con el barro se transmiten de generación en generación y fue su madre, una conocida artesana de la ciudad, la que enseño a Celso desde muy pequeño a trabajar con barro creando distintos tipos de figuras como jarrones, vasijas, cántaros y animales decorativos.

Se levanta todos los días muy temprano para comenzar su actividad diaria, mientras que su esposa trabaja como empleada de un conocido centro comercial de la capital hasta donde se traslada todos los días muy temprano también.

Celso comenta que todos sus trabajos los hace a mano, ya que de este modo es mucho más preciado y cotizado especialmente por los turistas extranjeros que visitan el país y llevan un hermoso recuerdo a sus países.

En esta oportunidad, Celso, necesita de un préstamo para invertir en la ampliación de su taller, debido a que ya le resulta pequeño y la demanda de sus productos ha aumentado considerablemente.

loans.use: Expanding his pottery workshop.

loans.name: Thi Nhan

texts.vi:
Joined the TYM Fund in 2006, Mrs. N. Thi Nhan, 53 years old, and her husband, Mr. Vu Thanh Dai, borrowed money to improve their family's economy. They are one of the families in the village with many years of experience in rearing pigs so all the loans were used to invest in the pig-rearing business. Their system is extensive, with large, clean pig sty and proper waste disposal system. Beside feeding the pigs everyday, Mrs. Nhan's family also bathe the pigs and clean the sty frequently. Currently, her family has 100 pigs, 50 of which are waiting to be sold and the other 50 are still small. Mrs. Nhan has 3 children, 1 of whom is still schooling. This time round, she wants to borrow 9 millions VND (550USD) to invest in her pig-rearing business. Her family's average monthly income is 6 millions VND (387USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006, chị Nguyễn Thị Nhân 53 tuổi cùng chồng anh là Vũ Thanh Đại vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Là một trong những gia đình tại địa phương có nhiều năm kinh nghiệm chăn nuôi lợn nên các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn mô hình chăn nuôi lợn của gia đình chị rất lớn, chuồng trại chăn nuôi cũng được gia đình chị đầu tư rất khang trang thoáng mát, hệ thông thoát nước đảm bảo, hàng ngày ngoài việc cho ăn gia đình chị thường xuyên tắm cho lợn và vệ sinh chuồng trại, hiện nay gia đình chị đang có 100 con lợn, 50 con đang chờ xuất chuồng, 50 con lợn bột, gia đình chị có 3 con hiện đang sống cùng chị, 1 con đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lơn. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs rearing

loans.name: Ith

texts.en:
Mr. Ith K. is married with five children and lives with his wife at Bathambong province, Cambodia. He works as a motor-taxi driver transporting passengers from place to place, making around $3 per day of income. His client base is at a market near his town. Meanwhile, his wife is employed by the local gas station and she can make about $3 each day. One of her children works at a restaurant and the other four are students. The income he and his wife make is used to cover all of their family's expenses, including her children's tuition.

Mr. Ith K. is now seeking a loan to purchase a new motor-bike to replace his old one which is frequently broken and wastes his family a lot of money. A new motor-bike could not only reduce his expense but also could make his clients much more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy a new motor-bike to replace his old one

loans.name: Soeurng

texts.en: This is the fourth time Mrs. Soeurng S. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions. She is a rice and Khmer cake seller in Kann Yuor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Ech Morn, is a pig breeder in the local village. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it, so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for her husband's business. Mrs. Soeurng S. is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending school. Previously, Mrs. Soeurng S. had obtained a loan to buy Khmer cakes to resell, and she has fully paid it back. Her husband is on the right side of the photo.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for her husband's business.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is married with 1 child who is 8 years old. She has run her own shop since 2003, and she works every day from 8 am to 8 pm, earning a minimum profit from her sales.

Tatu is now seeking a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Damaris De La Concepcion

texts.es:
La joven Damaris Concepción Gálvez R. con 24 años de edad, la cual su estado civil es de casada, ella tiene 3 niños con edades de: 3, 5 y 7 años los niños con edades de 5 y 7 años de edad cursan la primaria en una escuela  pública el niño de 3 años no estudia, la señora  recibe apoyo de su esposo el cual se dedica a trabajar como transportista de carga pesada, el señor trabaja en lugares como occidente, Managua y otros  departamentos para que de esta forma ambos puedan aportar cierta fuente de ingresos para su familia ya que sus hijos todavía están en una etapa en la que necesitaran la ayuda de poder terminar sus estudios.

 El fin que tendría el destino de esta inversión seria para poder invertir fuertemente en su negocio en el capital de trabajo que seria para la compra de mercadería  ya que es su actividad  económica  como es ropa, calzado, cosméticos  y otros para ofrecerle todo a sus clientes la forma como ella logra vender mas es realizándolo de manera ambulante, la idea que ella tiene es de poder comprar una vitrina, estante y todo tipo de accesorio para establecerse en su casa para que ella de este modo poder permanecer mas tiempo con su familia, otras de las cosas que Doña Damaris desea es incrementar y tener una variedad de  productos en el negocio, ella da inicia en esta actividad  de forma ambulante comercializando en sectores aledaños a su comunidad hace dos años y surge de la necesidad de colaborar en los gastos de su casa por lo que su esposo no estaba trabajando por lo que como mujer emprendedora tuvo  la idea de empezar a vender ropa y aumentar un poco mas su capital e ingresos familiares
texts.en:
The young Damaris Concepcion G. R. is 24 years old and she married and has three children, aged 3, 5 and 7 years. The two children aged 5 and 7 are attending a public school and the three-year old stays at home. This young Mom receives support from her husband. He works as a truck driver, working in the west, in Managua and other regions. The both work hard so that there are two incomes to support the family, especially their children that require so much just to finish school.

The funds of this loan will be invested in her business as working capital, to purchase merchandise. She sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics and she wishes to offer her clients these products. She sells her products door to door, but she would like to set up a small shop or stand in her home. This way she will be able to spend more time with her family. Deamaris wishes to also increase the selection of the products she offers in her business. She has been selling in her region for the last 2 years and she now sees the need to contribute more towards the house hold expenses. Her husband found himself without work, and she being a hard worker, she decided to start up a business selling clothing to increase the family income.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice M. is a 40-year-old woman. She is divorced and the mother of two kids. Currently, the kids are in school. She lives with her kids in Odumase, a suburb of Koforidua in the Eastern region of Ghana. Beatrice loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. She has traded in maize and sweet potato in Odumase market for three years. She treks to the farming communities around Koforidua to purchase stock and retail it to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick up enough stock to make enough profit to support her family.

With the loan, she wants to purchase a bulk of maize and sweet potatoes to enable her to scale up sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her kids in school. She is member of the group called God is Good Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of maize and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheng L., 53, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. One of their children is employed in a private company, and one is a student.  She raises pigs and makes approximately $4 each day.  Her husband is a teacher; he makes $3.50 a day as well to help support the family.  
Mrs. Cheng L. would like to request a loan of $1200 to add more pigs to her stock and purchase feed for them.  (Her husband is pictured.)

loans.use: To expand her stock of pigs.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia C., a 60-year-old mother, has nine children. Despite her age, she is still working for the food that she eats. Almost all of her children are married and have separate lives already, but she still wants to help them raise their children. So, when she heard about CEVI, she immediately joined the credit program and started a business. As a member, she maintained good repayment records on her loans and availed higher loans in succeeding cycles.

Virgilia engages in retail business. She sells gasoline and crude oil in her town. Since her business is situated along the highway of Lun Masla, Malapatan, Sarangani Province, Virgilia has had a very good market of her product. She just started with PHP 40,000 in capital for her business and earned a lot of profit from it which she used to renovate her house.

Now, she wants to avail a higher loan this time. Virgilia needs to purchase more stocks of gasoline to cater to all her customers. She believes that by doing so, she will earn higher earnings.

CEVI helps Virgilia sustain her business. Through CEVI, she has access to the credit assistance, trainings, and insurance coverage it offers to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia P. is a twenty nine year old married woman with three children– one female and two males. Two of her children are already in school while the youngest has yet to start. Afia lives with her husband and her children in a family house in Koforidua, a small community near Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Koforidua is a business and farming community in the region. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates plantain and cassava. Afia is a food vendor and has been in business for three years. She cooks rice and stew and sells her food from a small table top in the house she lives in. Afia says she buys the rice from the distributors in her community and surrounding towns. She is requesting a loan to procure bags of rice in bulk. Afia hopes to save enough to help her husband put up a building of their own and sponsor their children through to the university level.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize in bulk.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a business woman in the Usariver neighborhood of Arusha. She belongs to the Juhudi loan group (group code 2033). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $225. Every day she works at her business from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Janeth is married, and has three children.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Rokiya

texts.en: K. Rokiya has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2003. She started the business practically from scratch but thanks to previous loans she opened a specialized trade outlet for selling flowers. Rokiyahas been engaged in flower selling for 12 years. Rokiya asks KIVA for a business development loan of 4100 STJ to import gifts which will permit her to expand her existing assortment and increase her business turnover.

loans.use: Gift importing

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia P. is a 41-year-old mother of three. Her husband, Rolly, is a farmer. Herminia has been in business since she was a child. She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) to get access to more capital for her sari-sari "variety store" store. Her business has had to be put on hold at times due to insufficient funds for the operations of her business as she finds it hard to obtain credit. She will use this loan to buy assorted foods to maintain her regular customers. She wants to expand to a bigger store in the future so she could stock in bulk in order to take advantage of discounts and earn more income. She hopes to save for the education of her three kids. She is thankful to the lenders for helping her realize her dreams.

loans.use: To buy assorted foods for her variety store

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Lan Thị Nguyễn was born in 1959. ( no:010105050020) She lives with her husband and 2 children. Her main job is farming. She has a monthly income of about 2,500,000 VND. Daily, she buys eggs from other farmers in the surrounding villages to resell at the market. She wants to borrow 2,436,000 VND ( or 137 USD ) to increase her operating funds for her business. There are 4 fund participants in her group.

Thành Thị Phạm was born in 1954. (no:010105050023) She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (235 USD) to buy bamboo to make brooms.

Thụy Thị Nguyễn was born in 1974. (no:010105050022). She wants to borrow 1,090,000 VND ( or 65 USD ) to breed pigs and poultry. 

Minh Thị Tuyết C. was born in 1977. (no:010105050025). She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 235 USD) to start a small business.

loans.use: to have more money for her business

loans.name: Nguyen  Thi

texts.en:
Tien Nguyen Thi is thirty-five years old and lives in the town of Hung Nguyen.  She is married and has three school-age children.  To make a living, Tien owns and operates a business of raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising rabbits for sale.  Tien has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately $290 a month from these activities.


In 1998, Tien joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by getting the ability to engage in business activities.  Tien has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to purchase breeding livestock.  Tien is now requesting a new loan that will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  This loan will be her eleventh loan from TYM Fund.  Tien plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Odelia

texts.en:
Odelia D. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 30 years old. Odelia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Odelia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Odelia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Odelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Odelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Odelia is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Odelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tozhihon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Маннонова  Тожихон – женщина  1948  года  рождения,  замужем,  имеет  3-х  детей,  образование  высшее.  Чтобы помочь  мужу  прокормить  семью,  она  решила заняться  бизнесом.  С  этой  целью  три года  назад  она  арендовала  маленький  продуктовый  магазинчик  и  начала  торговать  продуктами  питания.  В  данное  время  тей  помогают  невестка  и  внук.  Тожихон  очень  рада,  что  обратилась  в  нашу  организацию  за  кредитом.  Это  помогло  ей  расширить  свой  бизнес  и  увеличить  ассортимент  товаров.  Она  благодарна  нашим  партнерам  по  KIVA.
texts.en:
Tozhihon M. was born in 1948. She is married and has three children. She has a higher education. To help her husband support the family, she decided to start a business. Three years ago, she rented a small grocery store and began selling food. Today, her daughter in law and grandson help her fun the store. Tozhihon is very pleased that our organization is giving loans -- these loans have helped her expand her business and enable her to sell a wider range of products. She is grateful to Kiva's partners.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of flour and sugar

loans.name: Kalisizo South Nakyange Goreti Group

texts.en: N. Goreti is a single businesswoman, aged thirty-eight, and mother of five children who are all going to school. She is also looking after one dependent. She has been dealing in the clothing business for three years, buying and selling used clothes. She is using the loan to purchase inventory; she will purchase used clothes in large quantities, for sale. She is a hardworking business lady whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: Purchasing of used clothes, in large quantity, for sale.

loans.name: Rose Marilyn

texts.en:
Rose Marilyn S. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 40 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rose Marilyn owns and operates a business in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from her husband providing carpentry services to local community members. Rose Marilyn has had her business for over eight years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Rose Marilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rose Marilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Rose Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase carpentry tools. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Rose Marilyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry tools

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Chhum Y. is a 56-year-old local farmer and is the good father of seven children: four of them are single and the others are married and have already started new homes.

Presently, Chhum Y. is a consultant adviser in the village. On the other hand, he and his wife have always cultivated a variety of natural crops for additional income. Beside this, Chhum Y. has always raised a pig in a stall that he built but, due to his income not being enough to continue raising, that is why he has stopped this operation.

Right now, Chhum Y. hopes to invest in his pig-raising business again; thus, he has decided to seek a loan of $500 on Kiva. He will use his loan to buy pig food and piglets to raise, as well as to buy fertilizer for growing his crop.

loans.use: To buy pig food and piglets to raise, as well as to buy fertilizer for his crop

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience   sells medicine. She is 46 years old and married with 5 children. She has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more medicine to sells. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
As a grandmother, Mariana's main priority is her grandchildren, and providing a good life and education for them. Providing for her family is one of the reasons she opened her store when she came to the U.S. 22 years ago. She started selling hair accessories on the street in Upper Manhattan when she came to New York from Ecuador, after having a similar business back in her home country. She is very proud that she was able to open a shop and truly become successful in this country. 

With the profits from her business, Mariana helps her son with his university expenses so that he can become a successful, educated worker. Her son helps her, in return, by working for her as a salesman from time to time. 

Mariana heard about ACCION USA from a friend who recommended she take a loan to develop credit. She will use this loan to purchase back-to-school items, such as backpacks and school supplies, along with fall accessories, that she will sell in her store. She plans to work as hard as possible to expand her business and be able to hire more people in her community. She also hopes to help her son succeed and to help pay for her grandchildren's education, too.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Mariana from  United States

loans.use: Fall accessories and back-to-school gear

loans.name: Kimlang

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimlang C. lives in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers. She will use the rest of the loan to buy rice soup and Khmer noodle ingredients to start a new business.

Mrs. Kimlang C. is 42 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer while the younger one is attending the local school. Mrs. Kimlang C.’s husband, Mr. Em Sovann, helps her with the rice farming. He is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer plus ingredients to start a food business

loans.name: Colita

texts.en: Colita A. is from the village of Manabay, Ozamiz City. She is 58 years old, is married, and has three adult children. Colita owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Colita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies and to purchase another piglet to raise and sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and another piglet

loans.name: Senior Quarters 1 Jeniffer Ogwang Group

texts.en: Jeniffer O., the President of this group, is 38 years old, married, and blessed with three children, all attending school, and looks after six dependents who are also in school. Jennifer sells produce including maize, simsim, and beans, a business she has now operated for over three years.  Unfortunately, increasing prices and seasonal changes have really reduced her business profits, so she is requesting a loan to purchase at least 20 bags each of maize, simsim, and beans in order to bolster profits.
