Jennifer is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to support and look after neglected children and orphans.

loans.use: To purchase additional produce (maize, simsim, beans, etc) for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Rem Yaem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twelve people who live in Sokram village in Takeo province make up the Village Bank Loan Group. Mrs. Rem Y. was selected to be the Village Bank president by the members. She is a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding and pig food. Mrs. Rem Y. is a widow with three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory. Another one is enrolled in the local school while the youngest is staying at home.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Katty Milagros

texts.es:
La señora Katty Milagros, pertenece al Banco Comunal “10 de Agosto II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 30 años y 02 hijos, que aun depende de ella y están estudiando, y es el orgullo, para seguir trabajando.

Katty Milagros, es una mujer joven, trabajadora y luchadora, se siente muy contenta por el trabajo que realiza, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de la linea Avon y Esika. Con esta actividad económica, poco a poco fue ahorrando y generando  su propio capital. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y nos cuenta, que esta marchando muy bien. Tiene clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y que mensualmente realizan sus pedidos, mediante catálogos, que ella misma, todos los días por las tardes, sale a ofrecer sus productos en stock. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas.

Katty, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Katty Milagros, 30, is a member of the "10 de Agosto II" communal bank, which is in the Tarapoto district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is in a common-law relationship and has two children, both of whom are students and still dependent on her. They are both her greatest pride and the reason to continue working. Katty Milagros is a young, hard-working woman who is very happy with the work she does. She sells beauty products of the Avon and Esika brands. With this line of work she was able to little by little have some savings and to generate her own capital. She is currently continuing with this work and she tells us that all is going well. She has regular customers who know her and place orders from her catalogues monthly which she, herself, goes out every afternoon to show. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy stock items like perfumes for women and men, creams, powders, compacts, lipsticks, nail polish. Katty, with her maturity, is an example for many women who want to start their own business and who, through perseverance, manage to reach their goals. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her own business and other women to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Old Timers Group

texts.en:
Francis P. is the leader of a group of two borrowers called Old Timers Group. He is 54 years old and is married with seven children aged 13 - 32 years, their educational levels 6th grade- university student and some high school dropouts. He also cares for a nephew.

Francis is a high school graduate but could not continue to university due to poverty. He and his family live on the Selega Road and he sells in the Voinjama central market, Voinjama city, the capital of Lofa County, northern Liberia.

Francis’ business is the sale of general goods. He buys general goods wholesale and sells retail in a shop at the Voinjama central market. He has been running this business for four years, and is hoping to improve his shop business to a better one. He approaches his customers in a good manner and gives good customer service in order to encourage customers to continue buying from him.

Francis needs this loan to purchase more cosmetics, body cream and fish to serve customers. He dreams of supporting his children and giving them a quality education.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics, body cream and fish to serve customers

loans.name: Gulnafisa

texts.en:
R. Gulnafisa is 23 years old. She is running her own business. For 5 years she has been working in a beauty salon. In the salon she provides the various services of hair styling, haircutting, manicures, and cosmetologist. Her business is successful and generates the stable income for her family. Now Gulnafisa is planning to purchase cosmetics and other accessories for her beauty salon. With this purpose, she requests 4500 Somoni. Gulnafisa thanks all supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and other accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children. One of her children completed senior high school and only one is in school. Esi manufactures palm kernel oil. Palm kernel oil is produced from the palm kernel. The palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her operation is on a limited scale because she doesn't have adequate capital to buy machines for the processing. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials (palm kernel) and processing equipment to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and profit to provide for her family and finance her child's education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and processing equipment

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah G. is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in Sto. Catinggib, Barangay Sua-aym, Himamylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fish vending. Leah’s husband helps her in running the business. They have four adult children, some of whom are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores. Leah joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a fish vending business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 21,000 from her business activities. Leah is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of Php 18,000 was used to fund operations of her fish vending business and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing Php 18,000 for her 17th loan which she intends to use to continue supporting and sustaining her fish vending business. Leah is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business and to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Oeut

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeut N., age 29, raises many pigs in a stall next to her house, and earns she earns a living from this work. She breeds and sells her pigs at least twice a year and has been in this business for more than three years. 

Oeut N. is married and two young children who are enrolled in primary school. Her husband, who appears in the picture, helps to support the family by selling fish in the market. For many years, Oeut N.'s husband has been spending a lot of money on taxis to transport his fish, because he doesn’t own a vehicle. Therefore, Oeut N. is seeking a loan to be used to buy a motorcycle for her husband's fish business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ramona Albertina

texts.es:
la señora Ramona Albertina M. tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos, solo uno depende de ella, tiene casa propia.
Ramona se dedica a la comercializacion de productos como ser perfumenes, desodorantes, lociones, cremas y otros productos para la limpieza de la casa.
 
esta solicitando el credito para comprar productos al por mayor, asi los compra mas baratos y obtiene mayores ganancias. 
 
su mayor deseo es que sus hijos sean personas de bien para la sociedad.
para Ramona esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Ramona Albertina M., 60, is single and has four children, one of whom still depends on her; she has her own home. Ramona sells a variety of products like: perfumes, deodorants, lotions, creams and cleaning products for the home. She is asking for funding to buy at wholesale because she can get her merchandise at a better price and thus make higher profits. Her greatest wish is that her children become useful members of society. For Ramona, this activity is her sole source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy floor disinfectants, creams, liquid soap, hair gel, deodorants, lotions, perfumes.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia B. is a 28-year-old woman who is passionate about her desire for having her own children. It has been one year and a half since she married her husband who is a farmer. Since then, they both long to have their own children. Despite not having one until now, Sonia believes that since her and her husband’s faith is strong, one day God will answer their prayer.  

Instead of preoccupying herself with the thought of having her own child to nurture and love, she concentrates on loving and caring for her husband instead. She saw how hard he works all day in the field just to have his own income to provide her with her needs. Thus, she wanted to help him enhance his rice farming business by supporting his financial need to be able to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and other necessary farm inputs. Since her membership in ASHI in 2009, some portion of the loans she received has been used for this purpose and some was used to put up her own business which is a “sari-sari” (variety) store business.  

Sonia feels happy having her own business to manage, because she can be productive and make herself her busy and not think too much about having a baby. Now, she is requesting a larger amount to finance her intention of growing her “sari-sari” store. She wants to have more savings to be able to improve their standard of living while they don’t have children yet and in preparation for having children in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her "sari-sari" store

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: LA SRA LUISA, ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA QUE HA EMPESADO A TRABAJAR CON LA INSTITUCION EL 14 DE 12 DEL 2006. LA MENCIONADA CLIENTE ES VIUDA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA PARA SEÑORAS DE POLLERA, ADEMAS ES MUJER SOLA QUIEN HACE ESTUDIAR A SUS TRES HIJAS QUIENES ESTAN EN LA UNIVERSIDAD QUIENES TIENEN MUCHOS DESEOS DE SUPERACION PARA ENFRENTAR A LA VIDA Y POSTERIORMENTE AYUDAR A SU MADRE QUE LES DEDICA SU TIEMPO Y SU AMOR.ES UNA PERSONA TRABAJADORA QUE DESDE LA MUERTE DE SU ESPOSO SE SACRIFICO SOLA POR SUS HIJAS PARA DARLES UNA BUENA EDUCACION, FUE MUY DIFICIL CUENTA LA SRA. LUISA SUPERAR LA MUERTE DE SU ESPOSO TANTO PARA ELLA COMO PARA SUS HIJAS, PERO SE ESFORSO PARA SALIR ADELANTE Y AHORA LE VA BIEN SENTIMENTALMENTE Y EN SU NEGOCIO. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Luisa is an old client who began to work with the institution on the 14th of December, 2006. She is a widow who is dedicated to selling clothing to "Pollera" women (Pollera is a national costume). Additionally, she is a woman who makes her three daughters, who are at university, study. They have many desires to get ahead and face life and later help their mother who has dedicated her time and love to them. She is a hard-working woman who, since the death of her husband, has sacrificed only for her daughters in order to give them a good education. She has told us that it was very difficult to get over the death of her husband, as much for her as for her children. However, she pushed through to get ahead and now she is emotionally well and her business is going well. With the money from the loan, she will buy merchandise at wholesale. She is very appreciative for Emprender and Kiva for the trust provided in granting her a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Pollera skirts and Cholita hats.

loans.name: Ev

texts.en:
Ev O. is 57 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She sells mangos and weaves silk cloth for a profit of $3.30 US every day, while her husband is a construction worker building houses. On average, he makes $3 US per day. This couple has four children, three of whom are employed as garment factory workers. 

Ev O. would like to take out a loan of $1,200 US so that she can purchase a motorbike to transport mangos to sell at the market. (Ev O. is pictured with her husband at home.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for product transport

loans.name: Nazirahon Toppieva Group

texts.ru:
Назирахон, 38, разведена. С ней проживают мать и 3 детей: сыну 12 лет, дочерям 9 и 2 года. Мать получает пенсию, старшие дети ходят в школу, младшая дочь дома, за ней присматривает мать клиентки. Клиентка работает в детском саду нянькой, также на земельном наделе выращивает картофель и хлопчатник. На кредит она планирует закупить минеральный удобрения.

Муяссархон, 35, замужем. Ее супруг строитель и она мать 4 детей. Все дети ходят в школу.  Клиентка работает в детском саду №1, помощником повара, также занимается сельским хозяйством на своем земельном наделе и откормом скота. На кредит она закупит 2-х МРС для откорма и перепродажи.

Мавжудахон 33 года. Ее супруг работает лаборантом в институте. Клиентка работает в садике воспитателем, кроме этого она имеет фруктовый сад, где выращивает черешни, абрикос, хурма. Супруг активно помогает в бизнесе. Сейчас она хочет закупить 2 МРС и бычка для откорма и разведения.

Нафисе 31 год. Она замужем, ее супруг работает частным строителем. У нее трое детей: дочерям 13, 10 и 5 лет. Они учатся в школе. В этот году посеяли хлопчатник. На кредит планирует закупить минеральные удобрения для хлопчатника.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Nazirahon is 38 years old, she is divorced. She lives with her mother and three children: her son is twelve years old, and daughters are nine and two. Her mother receives pension, her oldest children go to school and her youngest daughter is at home, the client's mother is taking care of her. Nazirahon works as a caretaker in the kindergarten and also grows potatoes and cotton on her plot of land. She wants to use the loan to buy mineral fertilizer. Muyassarhon is 35 years old, she is married. Her husband is a construction worker and she is a mother of four children. All of them go to school. She works in the kindergarten as an assistant chef and also does agriculture on her plot of land and breeds cattle. She wants to use the loan to buy two small cattle for feeding and resale. Mavjudahon is 33 years old. Her husband works as a lab tech in an institute. She works as a caretaker in the kindergarten and also has her own fruit garden where she grows cherries, apricots and persimmons. Her husband actively helps her in this business. At this time she wants to buy two small cattle and a calf for feeding and resale. Navisa is 31 years old. She is married and her husband works in construction. They have three children: daughters are thirteen, ten and five years old. They go to school. Navrisa has sown cotton this year. She plans to use the loan to buy mineral fertilizer for the cotton.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizer and cattle

loans.name: Temps De La Grace Plus Group

texts.en:
“Temps de la Grace” is a group of 27 owners of small businesses chaired by Pululu. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses. Pululu sells soft drinks and cakes, a business she started in 2006 with $30. A hardworking woman who has demonstrated effective organizational and management skills in her enterprise, Pululu is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC who has already received 11 loans, all repaid in a timely manner.

Pululu is planning to use her next loan to increase the stock of her goods by buying 10 crates of soft drinks and 4 cartons of eggs in order to meet the high demand of her customers. Confident in her business, she knows how to attract and maintain customers by offering what they need and like. She is also diplomatic when she talks with her clients. Pululu’s long term plan is to open a clothing shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for resale

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita D. is from the city of Prenza Tangub City. She is 30 years old. Perlita is married and has 2 school-aged children. Perlita owns & operates a motor transportation business. Perlita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Perlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle to improve her service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Perlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle to improve customer service

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en: Eliud is married to a businesswoman and has one child. For the last four years, he has made a living selling scrap metals and now employees one person. He supplements his income by working as a driver. Before going into these lines of work, he made a living selling clothes. Eliud enjoys his current business because it allows him to recycle waste such as scrap metals and thereby help keep the environment clean.  He sells this metal to companies and individuals. Eliud has applied for a loan for Kes. 30,000 to buy more scrap metals to resell. He long-term goal is to open more outlets for his business.

loans.use: To buy more scrap metal to resell

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim S., 36, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. (S.'s husband appears in the photograph.) 

She is a garment-factory worker, earning an income of $2 per day. Her husband grows hay and mushrooms and raises chickens, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a new motorbike to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike to commute to work

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Mr. Bonifacio G. is from the barangay of Maquilao in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He is 49 years old and married to Marivic, a fish vendor. They’re blessed with 3 children and one is already working while the other two are school age. To make a living, Bonifacio sells shrimp and crab. His wife also contributes a daily income of about PHP 500 from her sales. Bonifacio has been engaged in this business for 8 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month. In 2009, Bonifacio joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bonifacio has successfully repaid a loan of PHP 7,000 and now requests his second loan for PHP 7,000 to be used for additional capital for his business.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To support his seafood selling business.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Carolyne M. is twenty years old and married with four children to whom she hopes to give a quality education. She lives in Kakamega and owns a general store at her home where she has been selling such items as sugar, cooking fat, flour, detergents, soft drinks, and paraffin for the last five years. She says that this business is profitable, but her major challenge is customers not paying their debts, therefore reducing her profit. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more general items to expand her business. She hopes to move to a busy trading area where she can get more customers. She describes herself as focussed.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking fat, paraffin, flour etc

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
Madel L. is 26 years old, married and has one school-aged child. She is from the village of South Mapang within the Rizal municipality, Zamboanga Del Norte province in the Mindanao islands. Madel farms crops such as corn and rice to sell. Madel has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009 Madel joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Madel has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC of 3,000 PHP which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer for the farm.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ilhama

texts.ru:
Ilhama T. G. I. 41 dog. Ona imeyet 3 detey, strashaya dochka 19 let kotoraya uchitsya v universitete ,dochka 17 let uchitsya v shkole  i sin 14 let toje uchitsya v shkole i zanimayetsya sportom. Ilhama yavlyayetsya IDP personoy ,ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli ,seychas projivayet v Khirdalane. 

Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Ilhami. Ona uje 1 qod kak pomenyala svoy bizness i seychas ona uje imeyet maqazin ryadom so svoim domom qde prodayet odejdu. Seychas Ilhama nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi rasshirit pomesheniye i razvit svoy bizness.
texts.en:
Ilham T. G. I. is 41 years old. She has three children: her eldest daughter, 19 years old, who is a university student; a 17-year old daughter who is a high school student; and a 14-year old son who also attends school and practices sports. Ilhama is an Internally Displaced Person; she is a refugree from the Fuzuli region and currently lives in Khurdalan. This is Ilhama’s second loan. A year ago she changed her place of business; now she has a clothing store next to her home. At present Ilhana needs 2000 AZN in order to expand her facility and continue to grow her business.

Translated from Russian by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her store

loans.name: Rosa Verónica

texts.es: Rosa Verónica T. vive en el municipio Santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de León. Es una madre soltera  y trabaja actualmente como maestra de educación primaria  ya que tiene 14 años de estar laborando en esta institución. Cuenta con una casa de habitación propia el cual quiere mejorar.El destino del crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar las condiciones del local de la cocina de su vivienda. Este crédito le permitirá obtener una mejor condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en: Rosa Verónica T. C. lives in the municipality of Santa Rosa Del Peñón, in the department of León in Nicaragaua. She is a single mother currently working in MINED in Santa Rose Del Peñón as a primary school teacher in the region. She graduated from university with a degree in teaching and has 14 years of working in this organization. She has a clean home which she is hoping to improve. She is asking for a loan in order to build a small kitchen which would improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: Building a kitchen

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian G., Jr. is from the village of Old Kibawe, Bukidnon. He is 28 years old. Christian is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Christian owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Christian has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Christian joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Christian is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Christian from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with two children, all of whom attend school.  He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are transportation and food expense.

He operates a boda boda (motor bicycle) and taxi business. He has been in operation for over three years. Abdalla faces the challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to own a car hire company in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase a motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to get loans and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred M. is from the village of Poblacion 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Mildred owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Mildred has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. 

Mildred joined Gata Daku Multi-purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mildred has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Mildred from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Dunda Mu Yesu Group

texts.fr: Kahindo M.  est  présidente du groupe Dunda mu yesu, âgée de 27 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants dont tous  étudient. Son mari est  petit commerçant.  Elle vend aussi les divers  comme son conjoint. Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre reçu  de son mari,  il ya 2 ans. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$. Elle installe ses produits  au le marché Nyabushongo. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir d’augmenter son stock avec  10 pièces des pagnes dame. En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et construire une maison. La cliente Kahindo M. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique.  Il sied de signaler que ce groupe Dunda mu Yesu est  composé de 44 membres.photo prise devant la chapelle catholique, du quartier Ndosho, avenue cariere.
texts.en: Kahindo Mbilize is the president of the Dunda mu Yesu group, and is 27 years old, married, and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Her husband is a small shopkeeper. Like her husband, she also sells various items. She began her business with her own funds, provided by her husband 2 years ago. Later, she benefited from a $50 loan through the microfinance institution Hekima. She sells her products at the Nyabushongo market. This new loan will serve to increase her stock with 10 sets of ladies pagnes (a type of brightly printed cloth). In addition, she aspires to buy a plot of land and to build a house. The client Kahindo Mbilize is grateful to Hekima for its actions on behalf of the poor who are excluded from the traditional banking system. It should be noted that this group, Dunda mu Yesu, is composed of 44 members. The photo shown here was taken in front of the Catholic chapel in the Ndosho area, on Avenue Cariere.

loans.use: To buy 10 sets of ladies' pagnes (a type of African cloth)

loans.name: Turumkan's Group

texts.en:
Turumkan T., 44, is the treasurer of the group. She is the resident of Tup, a small town located in the North of Kyrgyzstan in Isykul region. Turumkan is married to a farmer. She has two sons and two daughters. The first son and the first daughter work in Bishkek and the other children study at school. 

In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Turumkan and her husband breed cattle, then resell them at higher prices after fattening. In this way they earn 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, the family wants to purchase two cattle for breeding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle for breeding

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea P. is employed at the factory, earning an income of USD 4 per day. P. is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. The family has to spend USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 35 on other necessary expenses every month.

P. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell.

loans.name: Mahamadou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mahamadou S. est un homme marié de 29 ans qui vit dans une famille monogame dans le village de Niamala dans la Préfecture de Kolondièba (troisième  région administrative de la république  Mali.
 Mahamadou fait le commerce d’articles divers avec l’achat vente d’habits, de chaussures, de tissus etc. 
Afin d’augmenter son capital et satisfaire sa clientèle, il a décidé d’adhérer au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son premier  prêt. 
Il compte acheter avec ce prêt, 35 complets de prêt-à-porter, 90 pagnes de wax  et 100 paires de chaussures.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako la capitale de la République du Mali. Avec une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, il vend au comptant et souvent  à crédit.
Il compte   réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  60. 000  F CFA qui sera réinvesti dans la santé, nourriture et l’habillement des enfants.
texts.en: Mr Mahamadou S. is a married 29 year old man that lives in a monogamous familly in the village of Niamala in the District of Kolondièba (third largest administrative region in the republic of Mali). Mahamadou works in retail selling a variety of articles including clothes, shoes, cloth, etc. In order to increase his revenues and satisfy is customer base, he decided to join the microlending group Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first loan. He plans to purchase 35 bundles of clothes, 90 specialized Malian cloths named pagnes and 100 pairs of shoes. He stocks up on articles in Bamako, the capital city of the Republic of Mali. He sells his articles mostly on a credit base to a customer base composed of both women and men. He hopes to gain monthly profits of 60.000 CFA [approximately 120 USD] which he will reinvest in health, food and clothing for his children.

loans.use: Purchasing diverse articles

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil

loans.name: Hieng

texts.en: Fishing is the most essential part of Mrs. Hieng P.’s daily work. She and her husband have been in the fishing business on the river for more than ten years. This couple wakes up every morning, drives their boat toward the middle of the river, and then fishes. After the fishing is done, they hurry to bring their fish to the market and sell to their regular buyers. Hieng P. and her husband also support their two children who are enrolled in school. Recently, this family couldn't catch as many fish as before because their boat is often broken. Therefore, Hieng P. is applying for a loan to buy a new boat to replace the broken one.

loans.use: To buy a new boat to replace the broken one.

loans.name: Kann

texts.en: Kann T. has been spending most of her life cultivating rice crop on her own farmland, which she received from her grandparents in 1990. She is a 51-year-old married woman with seven children: three of them are single, two are employed in different jobs, and the remaining four are married already. Her husband works in the farm fields frequently alongside her. Planting rice crop is an annual activity with which she has had great success. She can plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Because her house is narrow, it is not easy for all the members of the family to live in. Thus, Kann T. will use the requested loan to build a wooden house that is bigger than what they currently have.

loans.use: To build a bigger wooden house

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is 28 years old and she has three children who are between the ages of 2 and 8 years old. Apart from the youngest, the other children are enrolled in school. 

Jeannette owns a boutique in which she sells items such as candles. She is requesting a loan in order to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To reinvest in her business

loans.name: Claudia Alejandra

texts.es: La Señorita Claudia es una joven emprendedora que a sus 20 años de edad ya tiene su propio taller el cual desea agrandarlo, por lo cual solicito un préstamo de nuestra institución para compra de una maquina de coser, ella se dedica a la confección de cortinas.  Ella aprendio el oficio de su papa quien por ser la hija mayor era su ayudanta, esta actividad la realiza para financiar su sueño el cual es salir profesional en enfermería, actualmente ella esta en cursos de enfermería básica. Aparte ayuda a sostener a su familia sobre todo a sus hermanos menores a quienes ayuda con los gastos de sus estudios es una joven muy responsable y trabajadora que esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Claudia is an enterprising young woman who, at the age of 20, already owns her own sewing workshop which she would like to expand.  She requested a loan from our institution in order to buy a sewing machine.

Claudia's business is making drapes.  She learned the trade from her dad because, as the eldest daughter, she was his assistant.  She carries out this business in order to finance her dream which is to become a nursing professional.  She is currently taking courses in basic nursing.  The business also helps to support her family, above all her younger siblings who she helps with their education expenses.  Claudia is a very responsible and hard-working young woman and she is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered her.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim P. is 47 years old and the mother to two children. One is single and the rest are married and have already started new families. 

In the beginning of 2000, Kim Pao built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a few snack products, soft drinks, cooking ingredients, and other products to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. She is married to Ban Phea, 48, a local rice farmer. 

Kim Pao will take out a loan to buy some feed and small chickens for breeding, and she will sell them when they are big enough. She hopes to increase her income by using Kiva’s loan.

loans.use: to buy feed and small chickens to breed

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Olinda; es  conviviente; la socia tiene 30 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de (8, 4) años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y elaboración de panes, la socia alquila un local para poder elaborar los panes, la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar harina, levadura y otros insumos; la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Olinda, age 30, lives with her partner and has two children aged eight and four. She is member of the communal bank  “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; the bank is located in the Oropesa settlement of the Quispicanchis province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Olinda divides her time between her household work and her bread baking business; she rents a space where she does her baking work. Olinda is seeking a loan to purchase supplies such as flour, yeast, and other items. She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it in the timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for a bakery (flour, yeast, etc)

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi S. is 44 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Mayi has a small retail shop business, which she has run for six years.
To help expand her business, Mayi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities, such as bread, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Mayi hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, such as bread, for resale.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a 39 year old single lady. She is a mother of three children, aged between five months and six years. She is a very hard working business lady who runs a butcher shop as a primary business. She also offers outside catering services as a secondary business. She earns an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Consolata learned about KADET LTD through a friend and this is her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy a deep freezer. This will make it possible for her to store the meat for a longer period of time. The profits generated from the proceeds of this loan will be used to improve her family's living standard.

In the future she hopes to expand her business and supply meat in large quantity.

loans.use: to buy a  deep freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of carrot seeds as well as inputs for its development.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a married father of six children aged between 21 and 5 years. Five are still in school.

He has been in mixed farming for the last seven years, producing and selling eggs and maize in the local market in his hometown of Kitale in Western Kenya. 

Fredrick has made a request for a loan worth 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the acquisition will help him improve his income as well as provide supplementary food for the family.

Fredrick says providing animal feed is a serious challenge, especially during dry seasons.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Edy

texts.es: Edy es natural de Huancayo, siempre ha vivido en esta ciudad,  tiene 37 años, es madre de 2 hijos y vive en una casa arrendada desde hace 6 años. Tiene su tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad que adquiere mediante sus proveedores que acuden a su tienda  para traerle los pedidos que cada cierto tiempo realiza. Pero cuando debe abastecer de verduras y frutas, éstas son adquiridas en el mercado central de su ciudad. Paralelamente se dedica a los bordados artesanales, es así como se desenvuelve todos los días, administrando su tiempo para así no descuidar de sus hijos. Son muchos años de trabajo donde Edy es el único sostén de su familia y ha demostrado ser muy valiente cada vez que emprende un negocio y ahora tiene proyectos de ampliar su tienda. Es la segunda oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP donde ha demostrado ser responsable en sus cuentas mejorando  siempre la calidad de su negocio y recuerda con agrado el momento que decidió apoyarse de los créditos y su empeño para avanzar en el crecimiento de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para su tienda, como gaseosas, así como arroz y azúcar en sacos.
texts.en:
Edy is from Huancayo; she has always lived in this city.  She is 37 years old, has two children, and has lived in a rented house for six years.  She has a grocery store where she sells basic needs products.  She gets the products from her providers.  They come to her store to bring her the orders from time to time.  However, when she needs to stock fruits and vegetable she gets them from the central market of her city.  

She also makes embroidered handicrafts.  That is how all of her days unfold.  She manages her time so that she does not neglect her children.  Edy’s work has been the only support for her family for many years.  She has shown herself to be very courageous each time that she takes on a business.  She now plans to expand her store. 

This is the second time she has had a loan with MFP.  She has shown herself to be responsible with her accounts.  She is always improving the quality of her business.  She fondly remembers the time when she decided to get support from the loans and her determination to advance and grow in her business.  She will use the requested loan to buy more merchandise like soft drinks and sacks of rice and sugar for her store.

loans.use: to buy carbonated drinks, rice, and sugar in order to stock her store.

loans.name: Florites

texts.en:
Florites works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Florites requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Florites would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Betty Isabel

texts.es: Betty D. 39 años vive con su cónyuge y su hijo D. 13 años D. edad  en la ciudad D. Barranquilla, en un sitio muy cercano a la zona comercial D. la ciudad, donD. coexisten la interacción D. almacenes, empresas y el comercio informal. Allí  Betty emprendió su negocio D. elaboración D. alimentos dirigido a empleados D. empresas del sector,  con la diversidad  D. sus menús, pero D. esta manera su negocio no tenía sostenibilidad, porque sus clientes, empleados provisionales, se fueron con una gran parte D. su capital. Decidida a sostenerse en el mercado logró idearse la venta D. comidas por porciones, ubicándola  en 2 puntos D. venta, por eso ahora venD. arroz D. liza, (muy autóctono D. Barranquilla) arroz D. pollo, los cuales sirve en hojas D. bijao , acompañados D. huevo cocido y chicha D. maíz, a los clientes D. manera independiente. Cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo y D. su padre para el desempeño diario  del negocio. Ella está en la búsqueda D. crecimiento por eso acuD. a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen , con ello ganará descuentos y aumentará su producción, iniciando su proceso D. crecimiento  empresarial. Ella agradece la oportunidad D. fortalecer su negocio, pues   le va a permitir el incremento D. sus ingresos familiares,  para en compañía D. su esposo, lograr el progreso D. sus hijos. Mientras trabaja por cumplir su sueño Betty maneja en su negocio una rotación D. cuentas por cobrar D. 15 días, rotación D. productos terminados D. 1 día, y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 20%, que planea aumentar con su buen desempeño.
texts.en: Betty is 39 years old. She lives with her spouse and her 13-year-old son in the city of Barranquilla, in a location very close to the city's commercial zone, where various stores, businesses and informal traD. all coexist. Betty founded a business preparing food which was aimed at employees of companies in the area, with a diversity of dishes. However, her business was not sustainable in this manner, because her customers were provisional workers, and they left, draining a large part of her capital. Determined to sustain herself in this market, she got the idea to sell food by the portion from 2 points of sale. Thus, she now sells rice with mullet and vegetables (a characteristic local dish in Barranquilla), and chicken and rice, which are served on bijao leaves, accompanied by hard-boiled eggs and a corn-based drink, to her customers in an independent manner. She receives help from her husband and her father in the daily operation of the business. She wants to achieve growth with her business, and for this reason she applied for a Kiva loan, her first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. She will use the loan funds to buy raw materials and supplies in greater volume, and thanks to this she will receive discounts and be able to increase her production, initiating her process of entrepreneurial growth. She is grateful for the opportunity to strengthen her business, because it will let her increase her family income, so that together with her husband she can help her children get ahead in life. While she works to achieve her dream, Betty manages her business with a 15-day turnover of accounts receivable, a turnover of 1 day for finished products, and a profit margin on sales of no less than 20%, which she plans to increase with her good performance.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk (rice, oil, root vegetables, etc.).

loans.name: Jordin Joan

texts.es:
Jordin es un joven  estudiante de 18 años,  que cursa el tercer semestre en la especialidad de Ingeniería en Computación e Informática en la universidad privada Alas Peruanas (U.A.P.) hace año y medio. Sus padres son quienes le  apoyan en su educación. Desde que estuvo en el colegio le gustó las computadoras y es muy hábil en ello, se dedica casi  a tiempo completo en estudiar para seguir siendo uno de los primeros alumnos en su clase; tal lo demuestra sus notas. Sabe que se necesita mucha lógica en su carrera; por ello que aprovecha en sus cortos tiempo de descanso a jugar fútbol y escuchar música. 
Ser un egresado profesional competitivo es su mayor sueño. Agradece a sus padres por el apoyo que le brindan a pesar de las dificultades de su hogar y éstos a la vez están orgullosos de él y sobre todo por el esfuerzo que Jordin les demuestra ya que ellos no tuvieron la oportunidad de ser profesionales.
Al finalizar sus estudios en la universidad buscará un empleo que le permita solventar por sí mismo sus siguientes estudios de inglés; requisito indispensable en su profesión. Posteriormente se especializará en redes y telecomunicaciones.
El crédito que requiere lo invertirá en pagar la matrícula del cuarto semestre además de sus pensiones.
texts.en:
Jordin is a teen-age student, 18 years old.  He is in his third semester in the specialty of Computing and Information Engineering at the private university Alas Peruanas (U.A.P.), where he started a year and a half ago.  His parents are the ones who support him in his education.  Since he was in high school, Jordin has enjoyed computers, and he is very skilled with them.  He dedicates practically all of his time to his studies so that he can continue as one of the top students in his class, as shown by his grades.  He knows his field requires a lot of logic, which is why in his brief moments of spare time he takes the opportunity to play soccer and listen to music.
Jordin's greatest dream is to be a professional, competitive graduate.  He is grateful to his parents for the support they offer him in spite of difficulties at home.  And his parents, in turn, are proud of him, especially of the effort he has shown, since they themselves did not have the opportunity to be professionals.  
Upon finishing his studies at the university, Jordin will look for a job that will allow him to pay for his own studies in English, an indispensable requirement in his profession.  At a later date, he will specialize in web telecommunications.
The loan that Jordin needs will be invested in paying his fourth semester tuition and his boarding.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and boarding.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mr. Sam, age 40, is a humble man and he now resides in Kompong Speu Province. He is blessed with three single children, one of whom is a domestic laborer and the other two are studying in the local school.
    
Mr. Sam is a domestic rice cultivator. He has had experience in this sector for a long time. He usually plants rice crops on his existing fertile farm and is earning $1 USD a day for use for daily expenses. His wife also works alongside him in the field. Mr. Sam would like to ask for a loan from Kiva in order to buy seeds and fertilizers and other farming materials for supporting him in his farming business. 

Mr. Sam believes that the increase in his income will be used for decoration of his old house, and to sustain his children to finish the high school level. Note that Mr. Sam and his wife's photo was taken in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and other farming materials

loans.name: Sixto Tomas

texts.es: Muy contento se encuentra Sixto, porque está aplicando a su segundo credikiva, pues con el primero logró comprar naranjas en cantidades, dos vitrinas: calentador y una exhibidora, hasta le alcanzó para comprar productos nutritivos y surtir su punto de ventas. Ahora con su nuevo financiamiento espera adecuar el carro de jugos, cambiar la carpa pues tiene unas ranuras y se moja cuando llueve;  igualmente quiere surtir su pequeña miscelánea y comprar un exprimidor eléctrico. Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Sixto ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/236035
texts.en:
Sixto is very happy because he is applying for his second credikiva. With his first, he managed to buy many oranges and two showcases: one for heating and another for displaying. He was even able to buy nutritious products and stock his stall.

With his new financing he hopes to adapt his juice cart and change the cover because it has holes and he gets wet when it rains; he also wants to stock his stall and buy an electric juicer. If you would like to read Sixto's story, click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lnd/236035.

loans.use: to adapt his juice cart, change the cover because it has holes and he gets wet when it rains, buy goods to stock his stall and purchase an electric juicer.

loans.name: Rosally

texts.en:
This is Rosally, 25, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Roberto, a seaman, and is mother to her only child. She manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses

Rosally is a soft drink distributor. She buys soft drinks from a company or supplier, and then sells them by the case to earn a profit. Her regular customers are variety stores in her community. She does a minimum of 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 36,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more stock of soft drinks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosally hopes to expand her business and acquire a house someday. She also wants to give her child a high quality education by working hard in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. In these meetings she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of soft drinks.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a married man with five children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past four years, he has operated a business selling coconuts at the market and door-to-door to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in his business. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop to sell his products. 

With the 10,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en: Cissy lives in  Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (father). Cissy has a business of selling second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for 1 year, and she works 7 days out of every week. Cissy sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Cissy has requested for a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second hand clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Cissy include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on wholesale only and also to open up another shop selling clothes. Cissy lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa is separated from her husband, and she has two children. Celsa is 35 years old and resides at Aguada, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Celsa owns and operates a general store to earn a living.  She's been 5 years in this business.  Each month, she earns 20,000PHP.  She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase more goods to sell.  Celsa has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Celsa wants to have a rice mill.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Jose Balmore

texts.es: José, se decidió por una nueva solicitud, debido a la necesidad de aumentar el inventario de ropa, pues tiene planeado comprar blusas, faldas, ropa de niño y ropa interior, con la intención de mejorar la atención a los clientes, estos préstamos le han permitido a José un incremento en las ventas, ya que la disponibilidad de mercadería le ayuda para con los clientes.
texts.en: José decided to request a new loan because he needs to increase his stock of clothing; he plans to buy blouses, skirts, children’s clothes and underwear hoping to improve customer preference.  The loans have helped José increase sales because it’s helpful to have merchandise available for customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Olga Visitación

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Olga; La socia tiene 70 años D. edad; La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos;La socia sigue trabajando en una farmacia y tambien se dedica al negocio D. bisuteria,ella venD. collares,aretes y pulseras,la socia por medio D. este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio D. farmacia y mejorar el negocio D. bisuteria. La socia requiere el crédito para comprar medicamentos y tambien comprar materiales como lanas y hilos al por mayor.

La socia se encuentra satisfecha con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Olga, 70, is married with 2 children.  She still operates her pharmacy and has a second business selling necklaces, earrings, bracelets and other jewelry.  The businesses have allowed Sra. Olga to support her children.  Now she wants to expand her pharmacy and improve her jewelry business.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy medicines for the pharmacy and wholesale supplies of wool and thread.

Sra. Olga likes this form of borrowing and is committed to repaying her loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail businesses.

loans.name: Ric

texts.en:
Ric manages a small farm in his village. He plants and harvests rice, which he sells to the market. He is 35 years old and is married with two children. The eldest child is currently studying while the youngest one is still an infant. Ric patiently tills his rice farm in order to provide for his family's needs.

Ric has been running his farm for eight years and he only earns PHP 20,000 per crop season. According to Ric, his generated income goes to their daily needs such as paying the electricity bill monthly. Due to increased household expenses, his budget for replanting and maintaining his farm is no longer enough. So, he is asking for financial support from lenders in the amount of PHP 30,000, which he will use to buy fertilizer and insecticides for the  care and maintenance of his rice crops. These inputs will greatly affect his farming for the better, which will enable him to save for the future of his children and improve his business production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for the care and maintenance of his rice crops.

loans.name: Edrahy

texts.es:
La señora Edrahy, tiene 30 años, vive en unión libre con su esposo, tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, su esposo es albañil, reside en una comunidad de Santa Elena en el Municipio de Quimistan, Santa Bárbara.
Doña Edrahy  se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de ropa nueva, cosméticos, sandalias y zapatos, inicio su negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante con su familia.
Ha tramitado un préstamo de 8900 Lempiras, los cuales invertirá  una parte en la compra de mercadería y  la otra parte para pago de escritura de un terreno en el que piensa construir en el futuro su vivienda y el local para su negocio.
Considera que las ganancias que obtiene son muy buenas, sintiéndose motivada a continuar con su negocio y poder brindarle la educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Edrahy, 30, lives with her husband in a common law relationship; she has a 7-year-old son.  Her husband’s a bricklayer and she lives in the community of Santa Elena in Quimistan Municipality, Santa Bárbara.  For the last two years she’s been selling new clothes, cosmetics, sandals and shoes.  She started the business because she needed to get ahead with her family.

She has negotiated an 8900 Lempiras loan that she will invest part of in the purchase of merchandise and the other part to pay for the title on a piece of property that she plans to build her future home on as well as the locale for her business.  She considers that the profits she earns are very good so she’s motivated to stay in business and be able to provide an education for her son.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to pay for property title.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald, tiene la edad  de 41 años, está casado  y vive con su esposo que es su mayor prioridad. El con el crédito pretende comprar los insumos como el abono y herbicidas para asistir su cafetal. El cuenta con el terreno apto ya sembrado para la explotación de este cultivo y actualmente tiene una parte en producción que necesita asistir. El quiere con esta mejorar darle a su cafetal una mejor calidad de cosecha para así obtener una mejoría en rendimiento de cosecha. El quiere generar el máximo de ganancias para el bienestar de el y su familia y mejorar su estabilidad económica cada día. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ronald is 41 years old. He is married and lives with his spouse who is his biggest priority. 

With the money from this loan he wants to buy supplies such as compost and herbicides for his coffee plantation. 

The land has already been planted and is ready for harvesting and currently he has a section which needs looking after. He wants to make improvements to his coffee plantation and with this loan to gain a better quality of crops in order to have a better return from the harvest.

He hopes to make the maximum profits for his wellbeing and that of his family and to improve his economic stability each day. 

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given a loan with better terms and the rate of interest is much lower.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as compost and herbicides for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Marlin Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marlín  de 44 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene un asadero de pollos en la entrada de su casa. Comenzó con el negocio para mejorar sus ingresos. Ahora trabaja desde las 16h00 hasta las 23h00pm. 

Vende pollos asados, con arroz y menestra todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones de continuar con su negocio ya que ayuda a su familia con los gastos familiares. 

Por eso quiere mejorar la fachada de su negocio para darles una mejor presentación a sus clientes. Con el préstamo desea comprar pinturas, sillas, bloques etc.
texts.en:
Marlín is 44, and a hard-working woman who has a chicken grill at the entrance of her house. She started the business to improve her income. Now she works from 4:00pm to 11:00pm. She sells grilled chickens with rice and lentil stew every day.

She has many ambitions for continuing with her business, as it helps the family with the household expenses. That's why she wants to improve the facade of her business, to present a better appearance for her customers. With the loan, she will buy paint, chairs, and cement blocks.

loans.use: To buy paint, chairs, and cement blocks.

loans.name: Lowela

texts.en:
Lowela is 31 years old and lives in Poblacion 1, Clarin. She is married with five children. Lowela has a store that sells a variety of products. Lowela has had this business for 11 years. 

She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. Lowela has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Rasmia

texts.en: Rasmia is a 25 year old single woman from Jubaiha, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 600 JOD to buy products to use at the nursery school that she runs which will help her further develop the school. Since Rasmia is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for products to use at her nursery school

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en: Kibibi is making new investments in her store, where she sells cereals, fruits, and vegetables. She has been running a clothes selling business for several years. Kibibi says that the previous loan helped her open a new line of operation, which is her the current business. However, she is also in her clothes selling business.Both businesses are doing well.Her daughter assists her in her activities.  She is asking for this new loan to buy cereals, fruits, and vegetables to stock her store. By doing this she is sure to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy cereals, fruits, and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Ergashoy

texts.ru:
Эргашой трудолюбивая женщина 1958 года рождения. Она очень  хорошая и добрая женщина.  Она очень стремительный и трудолюбивый человек  Она  живёт вместе с мужем и ребёнком  в собственном доме в Ганчинском районе. У неё есть высшее образования. Эргашой занимается животноводством. Для дополнительного дохода семьи она занимается приготовлением салатов. Она получает заказы на приготовление салатов на свадьбу и другие мероприятия, а также поставляет в магазины. 
Для своего и для семейного уюта Эргашой хочет улучшить условия своего проживания. Она хочет сделать ремонт в доме. Она решила обратится  за кредитом для покупки стройматериалов. Эргашой  сотрудничает с МДО Арванд с  2013 года  и знает что поддержка МДО Арванда это ее успех. Она заранее благодарит МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Ergashoy is a hardworking woman, born in 1958.  She is very good-natured, kind, and dynamic.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her child, in the Gonchi district.  She has a college education and is now involved in animal husbandry.  In order to provide an additional income for her family she also prepares salads.  She receives orders to prepare salads for weddings and other celebrations, and she also supplies stores.  For her own well-being, and also her family's comfort, Ergashoy wants to improve her living conditions.  She wants to repair her house and she has decided to apply for a loan to buy construction materials.  Ergashoy has been a client of MDO Arvand since 2013 and she knows that we support her toward her success and her decision to turn to MDO Arvand given her lack of funds.  She thanks you in advance for your support and your trust.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Balikyegomba Kikonge Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a resident of Kagadi-Uganda aged 34, married and a mother to 4 children. Agnes operates a retail shop which she started in 2008. She also gets additional income from farming. 

Agnes started her business in order to improve on the house hold income and is very ambitious to becoming the leading seller of house hold items but her challenge is lack of enough capital to buy more stock. 

She will use the loan to buy sodas, sugar, salt, and soap for selling. Agnes is a member of Balikyegomba Kikonge group where members guarantee one another to access loans since they don't pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy sodas, sugar, salt, and soap for resale

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
She is engaged in the production and selling of local clothing and textiles for the West Africa sub-region. Her products attracts a lot of tourist to her shop. 

She has been trained by Kraban Support Foundation staff in basic book and records keeping and sales and marketing skills. She has also developed small business plan. This is based on the skills acquired from the TEACH lending strategy of KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION.

She wants to expands her business and therefore needs about $650 to improve her working capital.

loans.use: Fabric moulding and designing equipment

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Don Angel has borrowed from Kiva and Mifex previously. He has a stand in a local market in Bastion Popular where he sells yucca, plantains and avocadoes. He was able to use the first loan as planned; he invested in more of his products at wholesale prices. Angel was able to witness the immediate effects of the capital as his profits increased.

He and his wife have been steadily making improvements to their home and also saving up. They are now applying for a second Kiva loan in order to set up another point of sale. Their business is going so well they believe they can make additional profit from a new stand. This new stand will be run by Angel’s wife, who is his business partner and an integral part of their operation. They extend their gratitude to the community that helped them with their first loan, and hope they will continue to be benefactors of the Kiva system.

loans.use: Open a new stand where he'll sell his products

loans.name: Virginia Teodora

texts.en:
Virginia Teodora has a seamstress business. She makes clothing for children, which she sells in the popular fairs of the city of El Alto. She does not have a husband, and she lives with her four children, ages 18,10,6, and 3 years, in a hous in the Rió Seco neighborhood of the city of El Alto. The income generated by this seamstress work allows her to support her family.

This loan will be used to buy an Overlock sewing machine, which will maximize her time and enable her to sew a larger quantity of outfits to sell, and in this way increase her income.

This is her third loan. Her good record permits her to request another credit, so that she can offer better living conditions to her four children.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is a fast learner and very enthusiastic woman. She is married and has a young son. They live in Escobedo, in the state of Nuevo León. In order to earn some extra money and to help her husband to cover their household costs as his workers’ salary is very low, Cristina decided to start her own business selling cosmetics and shoes. Her love of sales and her desire to give her family the best has motivated her to try harder everyday. She wants her son to have a good quality education so that he can have better opportunities.

In order for her business to grow, Cristina would like a loan of $475 which she will use to buy merchandise which her clients have asked for as she wants to offer them the quality service that they go to her for. She will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. You can help to improve this family’s life and to be a part of Cristina’s achievements. She and her family sincerely thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Cristina es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo, ellos viven en la localidad de Escobedo en el estado de Nuevo León. Para poder obtener un ingreso extra y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar porque su salario de obrero es muy bajo, Cristina decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos y calzado, su gusto por las ventas y el deseo de darle lo mejor a su familia la han motivado a esforzarse cada día más, ella desea que su hijo pueda tener una educación de calidad para que tenga mejores oportunidades.

Para hacer crecer su negocio, ahora Cristina está solicitando un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía que le permitan poder cubrir los pedidos que tiene de sus clientes, ella quiere ofrecer un servicio de calidad para continuar con su preferencia, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Con tu ayuda podrás mejorar la vida de esta familia, forma parte en los logros de Cristina, ella y su familia te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es:
Señora Micaela belongs to the Ricardo Palma Community Bank in the District of Calleria, Department of Ucayali. She is 69 years old, and is the mother of 6 children. She was widowed 22 years ago, and since then she had be a breadwinner for her children. Señora Micaela and her children had to work together and with an initial loan of 300 Sol (US$94 approx) she decided to dedicate herself to sewing bedcovers and selling them in the settlements where she is placed well and is paid daily (5 Sol on average). With the recent loan granted to her by Manuala Ramos in the sum of 800 Sol. (US$254 approx.) she will buy 20 kilos of plain fabric, 10 kilos of decorative fabric, 3 boxes of thread and oil to maintain her sewing machine. Micaela feels very happy that, in addition to having a means to help her family, she can deliver her product to women who do not have enough money to pay cash, in this way she leaves her product to be paid "a pacos" (by credit). Now, with the help of her children, she takes care of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Micaela pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito D. Calleria, Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 69 años, y es madre D. 6 hijos. Hace 22 años enviudó, desD. entonces tuvo que sacar adelante a sus hijos. La señora Micaela y sus hijos tuvieron que trabajar juntos y con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 (US$ 94.00 aprox.) deciD. dedicarse a coser cubrecamas y venderlas en los asentamientos humanos donD. coloca el bien y le pagan en forma diaria (S/.5.00 nuevos soles promedio). Con el reciente préstamo otorgado por Manuela Ramos D.
