S/. 800.00 (US$ 254.00 aprox.) comprará 20 kilos D. tela, 10 kilos D. tela para adorno, 3 cajas D. hilos y aceite para dar mantenimiento a su maquina D. cocer. Micaela se siente muy contenta, además D. tener un ingreso para alimentar a su familia, pueD. entregar su producto a mujeres que no disponen del dinero suficiente para pagar al contado, es así que deja su producto para ser pagado D. a pocos (crédito). Ahora conjuntamente con sus hijos atienden este negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and oils. Maintenance of machinery.

loans.name: Salamatou

texts.fr:
Salamatou T. (née Y.) was born in 1964 in Atakpamé. She is married and has five people to look after. Overburdened with household expenses, which she alone bears, she would like to acquire on credit some supplies (flour, oil, charcoal, etc.) for her business selling beignets (a kind of doughnut). Since she does not have the operating capital, she cannot pay her debts at day's end nor replenish her supplies for production the next day. A courageous and energetic business woman, she worries that, due to a lack of funds, her children may have to abandon their schooling and become delinquents. To strengthen her production capacity and to avoid buying on credit anymore, she is requesting financial support in the amount of $700, which would enable her to improve her income, her family's living conditions, and the means for her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1964 à Atakpamé, madame Salamatou Y. épse T. est mariée et a à sa charge cinq (05) personnes. Se trouvant écrasée par les charges de son ménage, qu’elle supporte seule ; se procure à crédit des intrants pour son activité de vente de beignets (farine de blé, huile, charbon de bois et autres) puisqu’elle ne dispose pas assez d’un fonds de roulement et enfin de journée paie ses dettes et reprend en retour d’autres intrants pour le lendemain. Courageuse et dynamique dans ces activités, elle craint que ses enfants abandonnent l’école faute de moyens et devenir des délinquants. Pour renforcer sa capacité et ne plus acheter à crédit, madame Salamatou Y. épse T. sollicite un appui financier de $700. Cela lui permettrait d’améliorer son revenu, les conditions de vie de toute la famille et surtout assurer l’éducation des enfants.

loans.use: To buy flour and oil for making beignets

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Mrs. Sopheap P. (age 45) and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Sopheap and her husband (age 50), married for twenty-one years, have three sons. Their youngest attends primary school in the village. The older two dropped out in secondary school because of the cost. (Even though school is ostensibly free in Cambodia, students are asked to pay direct “fees” which can be prohibitive for poor families.)

Sopheap is requesting this, her first loan with Maxima, to buy thread for weaving and to pay to set up her loom (see photo – unprepared loom). Sopheap has been weaving, a skill she learned from an older sister, for six years. Her husband cuts hair in a small wooden hut next to the sole road that passes through their village. He’s been doing this for thirty years. Sopheap hopes to continue to grow her business so she can support her children’s studies. She expressed enthusiasm that they could perhaps get their oldest son to re-enter school because they believe he has much potential.

loans.use: To purchase thread and pay to set up loom for weaving

loans.name: Muhbira

texts.en: Muhbira, one of the active clients of Microinvest, became our client in 2006 and has proven herself as an accurate client and responsible person. She is a good seller and has enough experience as she has been in trade for over 7 years. She is divorced and is raising her one daughter, and her mother is helping her. Her business is located in the central market in Panjshanbe, Khujand. She buys her assortment from China from her dear friend Matluba, who helped her to open her trade place and told her about Microinvest. When she heard about the KIVA program, she wished to receive a loan for business expansion. Today Muhbira does all her best to create a good standard of living for her lovely daughter. She hopes to provide her daughter with an education and try to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy modern children's clothes

loans.name: Catalina Ramona

texts.es:
Mrs. Catalina T. dedicates herself to the business of selling all types of home decor and personal items, such as invitations for birthdays and other activities. Her business began twelve years ago with her traveling to sell her items, but after rebuilding her house, she established her business in the location its current locale.

She is a single mother taking care of her one son who fights to bring him education and a dignified roof over his head. The need Mrs. Catalina is going through is that, due to her economic situation, she has requested credits from CEPRODEL to improve her business. She currently has a total of 7 credits that she has used for the purchase of more products so that she can support her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Catalina T. es una dama que se dedica al negocio de la venta de todo tipo de productos decorativos de casa y personales como tarjetas para invitaciones de cumpleaños y otras actividades. Su negocio nace desde hace 12 años ambulantemente pero al reconstruir su casa de habitación establece su negocio en este local donde se encuentra actualmente.

Es madre soltera y con un hijo a su cargo quien lucha por brindarle educaron y un techo digno. Una necesidad que atraviesa la señora Catalina es que debido a su situación económica ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para mejorar su negocio. Actualmente tiene un total de 7 créditos que los ha utilizado par la compra de los productos y así mantener a su pequeño hijo.

loans.use:
Compra de sus productos personales decorativos
Purchase of personal and decorative products

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria has three children, of which one is unfortunately sick with leukemia. In order to help her husband who works as an interior decorator, Gloria has been selling home cooked meals to her customers and neighbors for 8 years. This work has helped very much, as her husband's salary alone is insufficient to cover their son's medications and daily family expenses.

Gloria is requesting a loan of $475 which she will repay within 6 months. With the money Gloria will buy more merchandise so that she is able to sell her food to more people. With your help Gloria will be able to move her business forward so that she can pay for her son's medications.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Gloria tiene tres hijos, de los cuales uno desafortunadamente se encuentra enfermo de Leucemia. Para poder ayudarle a su esposo quien trabaja como instalador de interiores, y lo que gana no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de los medicamentos y de la casa fue por lo que Gloria comenzó a vender comidas en su casa a sus clientes y vecinos desde hace 8 años.

Actualmente Gloria está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Gloria podrá comprar más mercancía para así tener para vender a más personas. Con tu ayuda Gloria logrará sacar su negocio adelante para poder pagarle los medicamentos a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice, age 38, is such an outgoing businesswoman. She is married with 3 school-going kids, and her husband is a driver. She sub-rents a shop on Ben Kiwanuka Street, where she has been selling cloth (textiles) for 4 years to her customers. She needs a loan to help buy more textiles for her stock to increase her savings. Her dream is to see herself rent a bigger shop space and have enough textiles to fill it.

loans.use: Alice needs a loan to help her buy more textiles for her stock to increase her savings.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a single woman. Elizabeth owns a small cafe, which she started in 2001. Everyday, she works from 7am to 9pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her cafe.

loans.use: To buy more items for her cafe.

loans.name: Karen Maritza

texts.es:
Karen Martiza lives in the "Arlen Siu" neighborhood in the city of Managua. She is married and has two dependent children. Her husband owns a taxi cab, where he works every day. She is 23 years old, and has three years of experience working in a supermarket. She will continue to work hard there so she can keep her job and improve their home. With this loan, she intends to buy construction materials to build a front wall for their house. Through hard work, she and her husband hope to be able to send their two children to school so that they can be well off in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Karen Maritza habita en el barrio Arlen Siu de la ciudad de Managua, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo es dueño de una unidad de taxi, y en él trabaja todos los días. Karen Maritza tiene 23 años de edad y tiene 3 años de estar trabajando en un supermercado. Seguirá trabajando duro para conservar su empleo, y así mejorar su vivienda. Con este préstamo pretende comprar materiales de construcción para hacer el muro delantero de su casa de habitación. Con su esfuerzo y el de su marido espera poder darle estudios a sus 2 hijos para que sean personas de bien en un futuro

loans.use: Build a wall in the entrance of their residence

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase groundnuts, beans, and corn

loans.name: Hanuni

texts.en:
Hanuni is 40 years old. She is a married woman with 7 children, ages between 1 and 20. She became a seller of charcoal and firewood in 2000. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Hanuni now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Saom

texts.en:
Mrs. Saom S. is 52 years old and she is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie Village in Kandal Province. She gives massages in the local village, and her husband, Mr. Choem Sam, is house construction worker who can generate a small income to support his family. In Mr. Choem Sam's business, he faces a small problem because he does not have enough homebuilding equipment. Thus, his wife, Mrs. Saom S., decided to ask for a loan to buy equipment for her husband. 

They have three children, one owns a small grocery store in the local market while another one is working in Thailand as a laborer. The youngest one is 18 years and is a waiter in a Chinese noodle restaurant. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy homebuilding equipment.

loans.name: Flores De Loreto Group

texts.es:
La pollera es la vestimenta típica de las muchas mujeres (Cholitas) en algunas regiones del país, esta va acompañada de mantillas y otros accesorios característicos según la región. Esta pollera es el elemento principal de negocio dentro la asociación “F. de Loreto” ellas se dedican a la venta de polleras y  mantillas usadas, otras de ellas se dedican a la confección de centros (falda interior a la pollera) y de las polleras mismas, también realizan tejidos de mantillas, trabajo que lo realizan con la ayuda de sus familias, 
La asociación F. de Loreto pertenece al centro focal Los Andes ubicado en la zona de Villa Tunari de la ciudad de el Alto. Trabajan con la ilusión de poder ahorrar para obtener casas propias ya que actualmente viven en alquiler y quieren ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Ahora ellas necesitan  contratar ayudantes para aumentar su producción, de este modo aumentar las ventas y obtener mayores ganancias con el objetivo de ahorrar para el bienestar de sus familias.
texts.en:
The "pollera" is the typical skirt of many women (Cholitas) in some regions of the country, this is accompanied by shawls and other characteristic accessories depending on the region. This skirt is the main element of business within the association "F. de Loreto". Most of the women in this group sell used skirts and shawls, while others work at setting up the businesses themselves. And others actually knit the shawls, with the help of some family members. The "F. de Loreto" group belongs to the central region of Los Andes, located in the area of Villa Tunari in the city of Alto. These women work with the hope of being able to save money in order to buy their own homes (since many are renting), and in turn, bring more conveniences to their children. With this loan they will hire assistants to help them increase their production, which will increase their sales and reap greater profits with the goal of saving for the welfare of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital so they can hire helpers and increase their production

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Mrs. Hun S. lives in Trapeang Krasang Village in Takeo Province. She is 47 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the remaining three attend the local school.She rears pigs for a living. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it, so she is requesting a loan to buy six more piglets for breeding. She will use the rest of the money to buy more pig food. Her husband, Mr. Ven Ping (on the right in the photo), owns a small piece of land on which he can cultivate rice.

loans.use: To buy six more piglets and more pig food

loans.name: Jose Lenin

texts.es:
El señor José Lenin V. R. tiene la edad de 53 años, su estado civil es soltero, tiene 22 hijos de los cuales 8 hijos todavía dependen de el pero cada uno trabaja por cuenta propia, en sus propósitos esta el mantener su negocio para que los ingresos de estos le puedan ayudar para el día de mañana ya que todavía tiene algunos hijos que están muy pequeños y necesita encaminarlos para la vida para que de esta forma no pasen necesidad para el día de mañana por lo que también quiero ayudarlos para que tengan un futuro de estudios.



El tiempo que tiene de tener este negocio es de 30 años, la actividad económica a la que Don José Lenin se dedica es la venta y elaboración de ataúdes, el empieza este negocio por la necesidad de tener un trabajo que le ayudara a salir adelante con todos sus hijos por lo que decide aprender este oficio en un taller por cuenta propia y mas tarde que el decide instalar su propio negocio para sufragar los gastos de sus familia, el nos dice que fue difícil aprender esta profesión pero se convirtió en medio por el cual el pudiera salir adelante  es por eso el motivo del financiamiento destinado hacia el capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que comprar diferentes productos para la elaboración de los ataúdes como lo es: madera, pega, clavos, lija, pintura y un material llamado formica que es necesario para el toque final de sus productos por lo que tiene que viajar algunas veces para la compra de este material agradece la mano amiga que le brindo Fundación y otras organizaciones  en estos momentos debido a la difícil situación por la que el país pasa actualmente.
texts.en:
Mr. José Lenin V. R. is 53 years old, single, and has 22 children, 8 of which are still dependents, but the children all have jobs. He wants to keep running his business so his income can help in the future, as he still has some children who are very young and he needs to point them in the right direction in life so they do not fall on hard times. He also wants to help them have future education. He has run his business for 30 years. Mr. José Lenin makes and sells coffins, and began the business when he needed a job to help him get ahead with all his children. For this reason he decided to learn this trade in a workshop on his own. Later on, he decided to start his own business to help pay for his family’s expenses. He says that it was difficult to learn this profession but it has turned into a way for him to be able to get ahead. He is taking out this loan to have working capital to buy different products from which to build the coffins, such as wood, glue, nails, sandpaper, and formica laminated material which he needs for the final touches on his products. Sometimes he has to travel to buy these materials, and he thanks the Foundation’s helping hand and other organizations at these times when the country is passing through a difficult period, as it is currently.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wood, glue, nails, sandpaper, and formica laminated material

loans.name: Baligema Lending Group

texts.en: Joan N.  is married with children, the eldest being 16 years old while the baby is 3. For the past six years, she has been selling goods from her retail shop in Jinja town. She buys her stock from the wholesale shops in Jinja and Iganga at a discount and then sells at a retail price. She is among the many people that have benefited from getting loans and her loan uses range from owning a plot of land of her own, paying school fees for her children with almost nothing as a contribution from their father, plus many others. Joan seeks another loan to be able to buy more shop goods like sugar, maize flour, and many others.

loans.use: buying more sugar, maize flour, and many other items for her shop

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thị L. năm nay 32 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000.  Chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại huyện Ý Yên tỉnh Nam Định. Hiện tại công việc đem lại  nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị là từ  chăn nuôi lợn gà và tiền công đi làm thuê của chồng với tổng thu nhập 4.500.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị L. mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư sửa sang chuồng trại mua thêm con giống, mở rộng chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Ngô Thị L. is 32 years old, a TYM fund member since 2000. She lives in Ý Yên district, Nam Định province with her husband and their 2 children. She raises pigs & chickens, her husband works as a laborer. Thair monthly income is 4.500.000 VND. She is requesting a L. of 9.000.000 VND to renovate the pig pen, buy breeding pigs and to expand the business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: renovate the pig pen, buy pigs

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Greetings from Jacqueline U. in Gatsata Sector, Gasabo District, Kigali (capital of Rwanda)! Jacqueline is 44 and the mother of 4 kids. She has no orphans to raise.

She started her business eight months ago. Jacqueline has a spare parts business. She sells different types of car spare parts with capital of 1,100,000 RWF at Gatsata Sector where she has many customers.

This Entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf which will help her to expand her business. She also wants to increase her working capital. This loan will be repaid over eight months.

loans.use: Expand her Business

loans.name: Amosi

texts.en:
Mr. M., Amosi raises cattle and owns over 60 cows. With 20 years of experience in this business, he plans on purchasing more cows for his farm in Lyantonde to increase milk production and sales.

Amosi is a father of 5 school age children. The income from his business has enabled him to pay the fees for his children's education.

loans.use: Purchase more cows to increase milk production

loans.name: Lafia (Aisance) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Lafia (composé de 6 femmes mariées et d’une veuve) avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants  vivent dans des  familles polygames à Kamalen Sirakoro un des villages de la commune de Sikasso  3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali. .
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tasses, de tissus, d’arachide, de charbon de bois, de la pomme de terre, de tomates et des condiments alimentaires.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur dixième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 50 paniers de tomates, 8 douzaines de tasses en plastiques et aluminiums , 5 sacs de 100 kg de pomme de terre, 3 colis de condiments, 10 rouleaux de tissus et 50 sacs de 100 kg de charbon de bois. Elles s’approvisionnent dans les voisinages du village de kamalen Sirakoro, au marché de Médine et au grand marché de Sikasso . 
Les marchandises sont vendues  au comptant en détail et à crédit  au marché de Kamalen Sirakoro, dans les concessions de (façon ambulante) et dans  les villages environnants à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 14.250FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Lafia ambitionnent être des grossistes.
texts.en:
The members of the Lafia group (composed of six married women and one widow) have an average age of 46 and four children, and live in polygamous families in Kamalen Sirakoro, one of the villages in the district of Sikasso, the Republic of Mali’s third administrative region. They run various businesses including the sale of cups, cloth, peanuts, charcoal, potatoes, tomatoes and spices. They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their clientele and are on their 10th solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were fully repaid. With this new loan, they plan to buy 50 baskets of tomatoes, eight dozen plastic and aluminum cups, five 100-kg bags of potatoes, three boxes of spices, 10 bolts of fabric and 50 100-kg bags of charcoal. They obtain their supplies from Kamalen Sirakoro's surrounding area, the market at Médine and the main market in Sikasso. They retail their products for cash or credit at the market in Kamalen Sirakoro, by walking around stalls, and in local villages to a clientele consisting of both men and women. Each member expects to make a monthly profit of CFA 14,250, half of which will be used for the family’s needs and the other half invested in the business. The women of the Lafia group eventually want to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products

loans.name: Hassane

texts.en:
Hassane has owned a garage for twenty years and works as a car repair man. He is 35 years old and lives in Nabatieh, Southern Lebanon with his wife and their child.

Hassane decided on this business because he wanted to improve his financial situation as well as to work independently. He is especially skilled at his job. His clients are people from his region. When he first started this business, he had to face the competition.

Hassane is now requesting a loan of $2000 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools. This is his fourth cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his work as well as his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for a garage.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора - молодая женщина 33 лет. Замужем и имеет 3-х детей. У нее высшее педагогическое образование. Но она не работает по своей специальности, потому что у учителей очень маленькая зар.плата. Чтобы хорошо обеспечить своих детей и обучать их в хорошей школе Гулнора старается работать и зарабатывать больше денег. Она занимается продажей женской обуви в торговом центре "Бадри Мунир" города Худжанда, а по пятницам выходит на рынок "Джума-базар". Гулнора закупает товар из города Бишкек Республики Киргизия. Гулнора кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. За это время она расширила свой ассортимент. За новый займ Гулнора хочет закупить новую партию летнего товара.
texts.en:
Gulnora is a young, 33-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. She has a higher teacher education. However, she does not work in her profession because teachers receive very little pay. In order to better provide for her children and educate them at a good school, Gulnora tries to work more and make more money. She is involved in women’s shoe sales at the “Badri Munir” shopping center in the city of Khujand and at the “Djuma-bazar” market on Fridays. Gulnora buys her goods in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyz Republic. Gulnora has been a borrower at our organization for 1 year. During this time, she expanded her goods assortment. Gulnora wants to use the new loan to purchase summer assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase summer goods assortment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: raising and selling livestock

loans.name: Kosar Parveen Muhammad Ramzan Group

texts.en:
My name is Kosar Parveen and I have owned a two-room brick house in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. My husband, M. Ramza, runs a motorbike-rental business. Currently, he has two motorbikes. I also run a cloth-selling business to pay the utilities and to share the financial burden with my husband. My husband is very happy with me. I am applying for a loan to buy another motorbike for my husband’s business.

I’m the group leader of four other women from my area. Najma Parveen baji wants a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Munawar Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell. Fakhira baji wants a loan to buy goat for her animal-selling business. Khursheed Begum baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike for rental-bike business

loans.name: Arif

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Ариф  Гайбуллоев,  как и большинство его односельчан занимается животноводством. Эта сфера деятельности считается более прибыльным в сельских местностях.
К примеру, взять корову. Корова дает нам мясо, молоко, теленка если родит. Из молока мы производим молочные продукты. И это делают у нас  в домашних условиях. Даже рога коровы наши мастера используют для изготовления рукоятки ножей. И получается очень красиво. 
Вот и Ариф имеет дома коров и овец и получает хорошую прибыль от откорма этих домашних животных. В откорме скота и переработке молока ему помогает жена Мавлуда. Они вместе ежедневно подготавливают корм для коров и овец, поят их водой,  доят коров.  У них 5 детей: 2 дочери и 3 сына.
Ариф запрашивает сумму в размере 1200 сомони для закупа корма для  скота.
texts.en:
Just like many of his neighbors, Arif G. is involved in animal husbandry. This field is considered to be more profitable in agricultural locales. Take a cow, for example. It gives us meat, milk and possibly a calf. We make dairy products out of milk at home. Even cow horns are used for making knife handles by our master craftsmen. And it comes out very nice. So Arif has cows and sheep at home and makes a good profit from feeding these domestic animals. His wife, Mavluda, helps him with feeding livestock and processing milk. They prepare feed for the cows and sheep every day, give them water and milk the cows. Arif and Mavluda have 5 children: 2 daughters and 3 sons. Arif is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni in order to buy feed for the livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock feed

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia P. is a native of Cardona, Rizal, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, 43 years old, who is a tricycle (somewhat like a rickshaw) driver. They have two children, both boys and both are in school.

In 2008, Virginia joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with a bagful of hope to overcome and get out from the spiral of poverty. Life was not easy to her considering that the source of income for the family was only from her husband’s work as a driver.

When she joined ASHI, she ventured her first loan in the direct selling of ready-to-wear goods from Natasha and MSE products. This business is very popular among Filipino women. Now, on her 2nd loan, she is requesting 10,000 pesos as additional capital for her direct-selling business.

She is hopeful that with the proceeds from her business, she can sustain the educational needs of her children and be able to let them graduate from college and find jobs. She also dreams of having a jeepney (a small bus) someday.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Olusanya

texts.en: Olusanya is 43 years old and married with four children. He owns a machine that produces palm kernel oil and he also sells the chaff to livestock owners for feed. He is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more palm kernels for making oil. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm kernels for making oil

loans.name: Raksmey

texts.en:
Mrs. Raksmey K., 22, and her husband, Mr. Thang Thong, 26, were married in 2006 and have a young daughter. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Raksmey has been a silk weaver since she was 12 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a horse cart driver for 2 years. He is also a fisherman. Raksmey is requesting her first loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy a boat and fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy a boat and fishing nets for her husband’s fishing business.

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es: Rolando Antonio L. S. tiene 43 años vive con su esposa y su único hijo que depende de él. El es dueño de un comedor, en donde ofrece deliciosos platillos, a pesar de los diferentes desafíos que Rolando enfrento fue la poca afluencia de clientes que obtuvo al inicio, esto no fue fácil, ya que tenía mantener a su familia. Pero con el tiempo logro salir adelante. Inicialmente empezó a ofrecer pocos platillos, pero con la ayuda de su esposa han logrado aumentar la cantidad de platillos. El financiamiento es para la capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos carnes y otros productos que son necesarios para el comedor. Su deseo es acondicionar su local con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
Rolando Antonio L. S. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and their only child. He owns a diner where he offers delicious dishes. Of all the various challenges he faced, the most difficult obstacle for Rolando to overcome was the low influx of customers at the start of his business. It wasn’t easy, but with the support of his family, he eventually succeeded.

He offered a few dishes at first, but his wife helped him with expanding their menu. The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to buy basic grains, meats, and other products used for preparing his dishes. Rolando hopes to renovate his establishment in order to provide more suitable conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells provisions on a retail basis to customers within her community in Lagos state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. Grace is 54 years old and married with four children. She hopes for the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn D. is from the village of Canibunga Proper,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Marlyn is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Marlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling charcoal products in the local community. Marlyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Marlyn is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Marlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 61 years old and married to Quirino, a farmer. They have eight children, five of whom are already married. They live happily with their grandchildren at San Pablo, Alicia, Isabela.

Felomina has managed a poultry business for almost nine years and her net monthly income is 3,000 PHP. She now wants to borrow 12,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to purchase some chickens and additional cages. She believes that "From hard work comes a bountiful gift".

loans.use: To purchase chickens and cages

loans.name: Solange

texts.en:
Solange Utamuliza is 26 years old, married with two children aged five and three, and she lives in Musanze District, the northern province of Rwanda, approximately 3 hours' drive from the capital city, Kigali. Her village called Rwaza, is where she has had her business selling various kinds of products like rice, sugar, salt, cooking oil, cosmetic products, etc., for seven years.

Although Solange has been in business since 2002, her profit is too low to expand meaningfully and she believes that a small amount of additional capital would change that for her. For that reason, Solange is requesting her fourth loan from Vision Finance Company to purchase more merchandise which will make her more efficient and effective and thus more successful. She thanks VFC and Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en: Mrs. Sokhorn K. is a villager in Prey Sbat village in Takeo province. She is a grocer in the local village. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more grocery products to resell to earn more income. She hopes to improve her business and provide a better life for her children. Her husband, Mr. K. Chan, is a farmer. Mrs. Sokhorn K. has one child who is working as a laborer in Thailand. Her husband is presented on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Viota

texts.en:
Viota is 33 years old and married with two children. She has a business supplying sausages, bacon, beef brawn (cured, cooked, smoked and ready-to-eat beef) and Famer's Choice meat products as well as clothing. She's been in business for three years and is now requesting a loan for Kes. 30,000 to purchase stock of clothes, handbags and more Farmer's Choice products.

She describes herself as reliable and focused and says that since she joined Faulu she has been more independent. In the future, she would like to improve her standard of living by expanding her business and putting up her own stall in the central business district of Nairobi.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 42 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a contractor and he also supports the home. She sells foodstuffs like rice, beans and cooking oil. Helen is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is requesting a loan for the amount of NGN 60,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Khitam

texts.en:
Khitam G., runs a ladies’ and kids’ clothing store. Due to its success, Khitam is applying for a loan from FATEN in order to open another store in another location in Jaba’ village, Jineen district, and to buy more clothes. This will increase the number of her customers by having a variety of products that meets all tastes.

Khitam has a strong, independent and ambitious character and has had good experience in the field of selling clothes for more than 5 years.

Khitam is a wife and the mother of five children: two girls and three boys who are school students. Her husband works in a restaurant in Israel.

Khitam appears at her store in the photo.

loans.use: To open another store and to buy goods

loans.name: Ismary Abigail

texts.es:
La Señora  Ismary Abigail B. N., Labora como  Analista de Recursos Laborales en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y  este  se encuentra en edad escolar, esta casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de  materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines para terminar de cambiar el techo de su casa.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Ismary    dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel ha venido mejorando su vivienda
texts.en:
Ismary Abigail B. N. works as a labor resource analyst at the Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez in Managua. She takes care of her son, who attends school. She is married and has worked with loans from CEPRODEL for a year. During this time, she has invested a loan in improving her home, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL. She will invest the loan she's requesting in the purchase of construction materials, such as zinc and beams, in order to finish replacing the roof on her house. Her goal is to provide greater security and a better quality of life for her children. Ismary said that because of the loans granted by CEPRODEL, she has been able to improve her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House improvements and expansion

loans.name: Zakia Group

texts.en:
This is the Zakia group. It has two female members. Wahida is the group leader. She is 40 and married with four children. She wants to take this loan for her husband who has a photo shop. There he takes all kinds of photos, both black and white and colored ones. With the loan, he wants to purchase more cameras.
The other member is Aziza who wants to take a loan for her husband’s retail shop. With the loan, he plans to purchase more inventory for his shop. 
The both have requested a group loan of 20,000 Afghani. 
They would like to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase cameras

loans.name: Rom

texts.en:
Mrs. Rom C. is a 46-year-old married woman who lives in Damnak village, Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 1-hectare field where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Nao Run, is a key-smith who can unlock a key for profit. 

Mrs. Rom C. wants to take a loan of 2000000 KHR to buy a motorbike for transportation.

The couple has 7 children -- two are seamstresses, one is a laborer in gas station, one is a monk, and two are students in school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: God Gift Provision Business Center Group

texts.en:
Varney M. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God Gift Provision Business Center. He is 40 years old, married, and has four children who range from five to eight years old. He was only able to attend school through sixth grade due to poverty. For 15 years, Varney has been selling dry goods such as candles, soap, and body cream in the Moulton Corner Market in Monrovia, Liberia.  He sells dry goods in a friendly manner, which keeps customers returning.  Varney plans to use his 10,000 Liberian dollar loan to buy more dry goods, such as candles, soap and body cream. His goal is to own a store and to continue to support his family.  He also wants to give his children a good education so that they can have a better future. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Varney is the one holding the sign. Makai S. is inset at the lower right.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more dry goods, such as candles, soap and body cream.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane E. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Mary Jane is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as sugar, candies, biscuits, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Mary Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase yams to sell

loans.name: Remylin

texts.en:
The rice farming business of Remylin is improving with the financial help offered by microfinance institutions.  She is 36 years old and a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., an MFI.  She is able to finance her business with a small interest charge.

Now she has requested a loan of 6,000 Php to continue to support her rice field.  She is glad that her daily needs are met by the income she receives.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Roman

texts.en:
Roman R. is from the village of Yeban Norte. He is 55 years old, married and has 2 adult-aged children. Roman owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. Roman has been involved in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 12,0000 PHP per harvest season.

In 2008, Roman joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roman has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Roman is requesting a new loan, his 5th, of 28,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Khuyen

texts.en: Khuyen T. N. was born in 1980. She is married and has two children (a daughter and a son). She sews gloves and sells groceries. Her husband is a contractor who works near their home. Her family has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She depends on regular loans to help her business, and she likes to make weekly repayments because it enables her to save money. She has has Been involved with SEDA since 2009, and has repaid loans punctually. She needs 5,014,000 VND to expand her store, through which she hopes to build a better life.

loans.use: to expand her store

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima works very hard with her husband and mother–in-law to bear the financial burden of her family. She lives in Vehari, Pakistan, and has five children: two sons and three daughters. Three of them are of school-going age but only one of them goes to school.

Saima bibi has applied for a loan to expand her business of sewing clothes. She will buy an electric sewing machine which will help her business to move forward as she has a plan to hire a worker in the near future.

Saima bibi has a great desire to educate her children and she is hopeful that investment in her business will enable her to increase her business to a position where she will be able to help her children finish their education.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Durga Devi

texts.en: Mrs. Durga Kumari K. is a farmer who lives the village of Chappagaun. She makes a living growing seasonal green vegetables, which she sells in the local market every morning and evening. She uses her income to pay for her children's education, and is applying for a loan for Rs 15,000 loans to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm. Mrs. Durga Kumari K. lives with her husband and their two sons. Her husband works in a local hospital, and both of her sons are studying in university.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her vegetable farm

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Leng S., 41, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is employed as a garment factory worker for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a farmer who grows morning glories, earning an income of USD 4 per day.

Leng S. is requesting a loan of USD 1100 to purchase a mechanical plow to help improve her family's farming. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. Leng S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy a mechanical plow.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene C. is from the village of Pangalalan. She is 32 years old and married with two school-aged children. Arlene runs a general store selling a variety of different products. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arlene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
Jariatu sells plastic and rubber utensils and set-pans in the Silvanus market. The market is located in the Gbaneh section of the city of Makeni. Jariatu works hard. She opens her business at 7 a.m. and closes up shop at 6 p.m. 

Jariatu is married to an active trader and they have four dependents. She has seven years of experience in her business. 

She needs a loan of 4,000,000 in order to buy more stock from Conakry. She wishes to use the proceeds buy a piece of land and to pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy more plastic and rubber utensils to sell in her market stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy a tailoring table, cloth, and other materials

loans.name: Lucia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lucila del Socorro Ramírez es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la producción de queques y la venta de cosméticos Avon y Romanel desde hace 4 años. Ella tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo uno depende de ella.

R. ha sido beneficiada tanto por los créditos con por las capacitaciones que según expreso le han ayudado a desarrollarse  y a mejorar su negocio, la atención etc.
texts.en:
Lucila del Socorro Ramírez is a hard-working woman who makes cakes and has sold Avon and Romanel cosmetics for four years. She has three children, one of whom is still dependent on her. Ms. Ramírez has been helped equally by the loans she has received and by the skills she has learned, to help her develop herself and improve her business, customer service, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make cakes and sell cosmetics

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel tiene la edad de 55 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos de 24,18, 16, y 15 de edad. Él crédito lo quiere para comprar insumos y limpieza de los cultivos de mora. Su finca ya tiene 5 manzanas de terreno sembradas, el cual tiene que asistirlas para su próxima cosecha. Desea aumentar la capacidad para producir mayor cantidad de fruta y tenerla en buen estado de limpieza. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Él espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Abel is 55 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and their children aged 24,18, 16 and 15. He is requesting the loan to buy supplies and to clear his berry fields. He has already sowed five large parcels of land in his farm, which he has to tend to prior to the next crop. He wants to increase his capacity to produce larger quantities of fruit and to keep the fields in good, clear condition. He has been working on his farm for a number of years and would like to see it grow. 

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very pleased with the help received. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and a better financial stability, and to continue to develop as a person and as a producer.

loans.use: Berry farming.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo M. is from the city of Gango Ozamiz City. She is 43 years old. Leonardo is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonardo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Leonardo has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leonardo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonardo is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Leonardo from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of herfamily. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Badamgarav

texts.en:
Badamgarav D. is a 26-year-old, optimistic and hardworking man, who lives with wife and 3-year-old child in Hovd province, Western Mongolia. He graduated from the Agriculture College as a carpenter in 2002. During 2006-2007 he worked in Kazakstan and in 2007-2009 in Ulaanbaatar as a carpenter, where he learnt much and gained much experience. 

Now, he operates his own carpentry workshop in his hometown and produces wooden furniture for local customers. His wife runs a clothing business at the local market and helps to provide for the family. 

Badamgarav is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to purchase raw materials for his carpentry business and more goods for his wife's clothing business. His future plan is to expand his workspace.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina T. is from the village of Brgy.Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Marina is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Marina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Marina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Marina is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

location.town: Brgy. Mangayang, Dupax del Sur, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Isaka

texts.en:
Isaka is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and electricity bills. 

Isaka operates a fish selling business, selling from door to door to his neighbors and passersby. Isaka faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. During the hot summer season fish become scarce in the ocean and Isaka does not make a lot of sales. 

With the loan of Kshs 40,000 Isaka wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale. He hopes to operate a big fish selling shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Yezeh

texts.en:
Yezeh J. is a 48-year-old married woman blessed with two children. She shares three rooms with her two children in Ndamukong, a quarter in Bamenda, in the northwest region of Cameroon.

J. has faced many difficulties in her life, ranging from the inability to meet her daily needs to the increasing demands of her children. Among other challenges, she has also had difficulties with inadequate capital to expand her business. With this loan, she plans to invest in her poultry farm and to buy firewood. She thinks her business will succeed because her business site is accessible and she is friendly, thus successful in her business. She has minimized risk by diversifying her business. Her activity will help her community in reducing the cost of transportation to buy fowls, and their cordial relationship will allow for negotiations to pay later.

J. will use a fraction of her profit to assist her husband provide for the children’s school needs, to meet her personal needs, and to feed her family. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow-up and moral support given her by the GHAPE office, and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase day-old chicks and feed

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un K., 51, weaves Cambodian traditional silk, earning an income of USD 2 per day. K. is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband is a traditional musician, earning an income of USD 3 per day. The family has to spend USD 40 on food, USD 10 on electricity supply, and USD 45 on other necessary expenses every month.

K. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to buy more supplements to produce rice wine. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more supplements to produce rice wine.

loans.name: Eliazar

texts.es: Eliazar, de 25 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Rina (19) y sus dos pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.La actividad a la que se dedica es el cultivo de café y plátano, las plantaciones que posee, lo han convertido en un gran productor. Sus productos los vende en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde ya tiene compradores fijos, ya que sus productos son de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar el café y lo hace con mucho empeño, ya lleva 3 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas que pueden afectarlas. En el futuro, desea comprar un carro nuevo, en el cual podrá  transportar sus productos sin dificultad.Este es el segundo préstamo de Eliazar con MFP, está dispuesto a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y para eso ya está empezando a ahorrar. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre esta muy al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en sus reuniones.Con los ochocientos  soles solicitados, contratará peones para que lo ayuden en el cultivo de sus tierras, de esta manera espera continuar sin problemas.
texts.en:
Eliazar is 25 years old.  He is a very simple and hard-working young man who lives in his own home together with his wife Rina (19) and his two young children for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Eliazar grows coffee and bananas.  He owns some plantations and has become a big producer.  He sells his produce in the town of Pichanaki where he has regular buyers since his products are good quality.  What he most likes about his work is sowing his coffee and he does this with a lot of dedication.  He has been in this business for 3 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be protecting his plantations from the pests that can affect them.  In the future, Eliazar would like to buy a new car which he could use to transport his produce without difficulty.

This is Eliazar's second loan with MFP and he is prepared to make his repayments punctually and he is already beginning to save so that he can do this.  Eliazar is a very happy member of his community bank and he is always very much up to date with all the agreements that are reached during the meetings.  Eliazar will use the 800 Peruvian soles he has requested to hire laborers to help him with his crops.  In this way, he hopes to continue working without problems.

loans.use: To pay the wages of laborers who will help with his crops

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”YANAPAKUY”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosalía; ella tiene 46 años de edad, separada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y niños la socia confecciona esta ropa para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le hacen pedido ,ella trabaja desde su casa ya hace un par de años atrás ya que la socia tiene otra ocupación ella es docente del nivel inicial ella trabaja en un jardín particular, ahora la socia puede trabajar más tiempo confeccionando ropa ya que está de vacaciones en su trabajo, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio como telas, hilos, agujas entre otros más. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the communal bank named "Yanapakuy". It is located in the district of Cusco and it belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. 

Her name is Rosalia. She is 46 years old, separated, and the mother of one son. She sells ladies' and children's clothing that she makes to sell to her clients who have placed orders. She works from home and it has already been two years since she started her business. She also has another job, working as a private kindergarten teacher. She is able to dedicate more time to making clothing because she is on holidays at her other job. She is a very happy person with a great wish to get ahead.

She requests a loan to purchase materials for her business including fabrics, threads, needles, and other merchandise. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments for her loan.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, threads, needles etc.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura O. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Tashkomur, a small mining town in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 22 and is married to a taxi driver. 

This young family earns money to cover their personal expenses by reselling coal. They started this activity two years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms and now they earn 12000 soms per month. 

With the money received from the loan, Ainura wants to increase the turnover of her business and purchase more coal for sale. In the future, she wants to save money to purchase a big house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To buy coal to resell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna S. is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old. Edna is separated from her spouse and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Edna buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing, sandals and shoe products from NATASHA & MSE in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like t-shirts and blouses. This loan will be Edna's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase clothes, such as t-shirts and blouses

loans.name: Epaphrodite

texts.en: Epaphrodite is 32 years old and has 3 children who are between the ages of 6 and 10 years old. Her husband is a carpenter, and Epaphrodite has sold food stuffs, such as rice and beans, for 12 years. Epaphrodite requests a loan in order to purchase more food stuffs and make more profits. With the profits she plans to feed her family.

loans.use: To buy additional food inventory

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
María, tiene  58 años edad, nacida en la Trinidad municipio de Estelí, se vino  a vivir al centro de esta ciudad cuando tenia 3 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos todos mayores de edad, se dedica al comercio de venta de ropa ,cosmético, zapatos y joyas de plata lleva 30 años en este oficio. Inicio comprando bolsas plásticas que se utilizaban para  vender hielo, helados antes de dedicarse a este negocio laboraba como  trabajadora social en el hospital de Estelí ahí duro 10 años donde. Luego decidió viajar a Guatemala a comprar mercadería tales como perfumes ,joyas de plata, para vender a sus compañeros de trabajo  estos viajes lo realizo durante 15 años así logro mantener a sus hijos ella sola. Hoy en día viaja a Panamá donde compra productos como cosmético, ropa , zapatos ,bolsos y joyas de plata que vende al por mayor y al detalle, tiene 8 vendedores y además recibe ayuda de un hijo que le manda remesas de Costa Rica.
Solicito el crédito para comprar mercadería nueva como celulares pues antes no vendía y ahora ve que es una herramienta necesaria y de uso cotidiano entre la población. Con este crédito espera poder aumentar su clientela, prosperar su negocio, mantenerlo surtido con productos nuevos ,generar empleo Tiene como planes futuros construir locales que pueda rentar y vivir de ello cuando envejezca. Su meta próxima es terminar de construir su casa para poner una tienda de ropa y zapatos dentro de la misma.
texts.en:
María, 58, is from La Trinidad in the Nicaraguan province of Esteli.  She moved to the town of Esteli when she was 3 years old.  She's a single mother with 4 children, all now grown.  Maria has been a merchant for 30 years.  At first, she sold ice, buying plastic bags that she packed with ice and sold on.  Now she sells clothing, cosmetics, shoes, silver jewelry, etc.  Before starting the business, she was a social worker at the hospital in Esteli for 10 years.  In those days, she used to go to Guatemala and bring back perfumes, silver jewelry, etc. that she then sold to her co-workers.  The money that she earned allowed her to better support her children.  Now she goes to Panama where she buys products such as cosmetics, clothing, shoes, purses and jewelry.  She sells on both the wholesale and retail markets.  She also gets t-shirts from a son in Costa Rica.
Maria is applying for a loan so that she can buy other products such as cell phones.  She's never sold cell phones before but she can see that they're an everday product now, something that everyone needs.  She hopes the loan will help her attract new customers and expand her business.  Keeping her business stocked with merchandise will help her create jobs for others, too.  In the future, she wants to build a shop that she can rent out and ultimately could provide her a place to live as she gets older.  Her next goal, though, is finish building an addition to her house for her clothing and shoes business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for retail business

loans.name: Chhiv

texts.en: From the province of Kompong Cham, Chhiv L. is 44 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school.   Her husband, Chea Sary, is 46 and works as a policeman in his village. Chhiv L. is a farmer who inherited the farmland  from her grandmother.  She and her husband grow different kinds of crops. Chhiv L. currently plants a potato crop, which she will harvest when it is mature. Chhiv L. is requesting a loan which she will use to start her potato crop.

loans.use: To grow potatoes

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marcelina; ella tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite entre otros productos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 54, is married and has five children. She is a member of the communal bank “LOS ANGELES”; the bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Marcelina divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, cooking oil, and others. Marcelina would like to expand her grocery store and is seeking a loan in order to purchase store supplies from a wholesaler. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase grocery store supplies wholesale

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Revendeuse  ambulante  de friperie  à Lomé depuis 11 ans, Akouvi est mariée à un transitaire  et mère de 01 enfant. Elle a 38 ans et à l’approche de la quarantaine elle veut améliorer sa méthode de vente et économiser de l’énergie. Elle s’approvisionne sur place.
texts.en: Akouvi is married to a forwarding-agent and the mother of one child. She is 38 and has been selling second-hand clothing on foot in Lomé for 11 years. Before turning 40, she would like to improve her sales method and use less energy. She buys her merchandise locally.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Chanda

texts.en:
Chanda, 22 years old, is married and resides with her child in Takeo Province, Cambodia.  She is employed at a local garment factory, earning $3 per day that helps cover her family's expenses.  Her husband, a construction worker, also helps support the family with an income of $3.50 per day. The family's standard of living has improved since Chanda and her husband have commenced their work. 

Chanda requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike, which will help her husband operate his business more efficiently. This is her second loan from Kiva partner CREDIT.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for husband to operate his business more efficiently.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata, de 31 años, está casada con Nilo, de 44 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Noralei, de 16 y Jair de 10 años. Los tres viven como una gran familia en su casa propia, ubicada en el Barrio Santa Rosa de la localidad de Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). Desde que era joven, se dedicó a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos son café y cítricos. Pero hace 10 años que pudo adquirir su propio inmueble y esto es gracias a la labor ardua que realizó en los cultivos de café. Ya con el tiempo, juntó el capital necesario para abrir un negocio de venta de comestibles, dulces y bebidas. De eso hace tan solo 4 años, tiempo suficiente para poder brindar a los pobladores de la localidad una buena atención y sobre todo un buen precio. Esto la llevó a adquirir cada día más ganancias, Ahora Fortunata, vende su producción de frutas a la capital, pero sin descuidar su negocio. Ella considera muy inestable la venta de café, pues últimamente el precio de éste grano se está incrementando o como en otro momento esta en muy bajo el precio, por esa razón desea mejorar e invertir en su negocio que es la venta de comestibles. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde agradece su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Fortunata, invertirá el crédito solicitado en surtir su tienda de comestibles y bebidas. Asimismo en la compra de canastas para la cosecha de que café pronto realizará.
texts.en:
Fortunata, age 31, is married to 44 year old Nilo.  They have two children.   Noralei is 16, and Jair is 10.  They live like a great family in their own house, which is in the Santa Rosa neighborhood in Puente Paucartambo (central Peruvian forest).

Ever since she was young she has worked in agriculture.  Her main crops are coffee and citrus fruits.  However, ten years ago she was able to get her own property.  This was due to the hard work she did with her coffee crops.  Over time she got together the capital she needed to open a business selling groceries, sweets, and drinks.  She has been doing this for only four years.  This was enough time to be able to offer the local residents good service, and, above all, a good price.  This led her to earning more income every day.

Now Fortunata sells her fruit production in the capital, but she does this without neglecting her business.  She considers coffee sales to be very unstable.  Lately the price of coffee beans has been increasing, and at other times the price has been very low.  That is the reason why she wants to invest in her business of selling groceries.

She belongs to the “Luz del Futuro” (Light of the Future) Communal Bank.  This is her ninth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the partnership so that she is able to carry out her plans.  She pledges once again to make her payments as she did with the previous loans that she has had.  Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.  Fortunata will use the requested loan to stock her store with groceries and drinks.  She will also buy baskets for the coffee harvest, which will soon begin.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her store, and to buy baskets for the coffee harvest.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is 56 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Melita requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production and vending business.

Melita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients for her food production and vending business

loans.name: Valerio
