texts.es: Valerio nació en la ciudad de Yanaoca (Cusco, Perú) y tiene 28 años de edad. Actualmente, Valerio vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con sus dos hijos. Valerio tiene una pequeña agencia de viajes “AATPERU” pero el local donde funciona es alquilado.  Ya son dos años y medio que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más materiales de trabajo como por ejemplo papeles, propaganda y otras cosas mas. El socio es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Inti Quilla” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en: Valerio was born in the city of Yanaoca (Cusco, Peru) and is 28 years old. He currently lives with his two children in the city of Cusco. Valerio has a small travel agency called "AATPERU," though he rents his place of business. He has already been running his business for two and a half years and it is going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. At this time, he needs a loan to buy more work materials such as papers, advertising, and other things. Valerio is a responsible and hard-working person. Because of these qualities he was invited to participate in the "Inti Quilla" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his travel agency

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Carmelita has requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials for her tailoring business.
Carmelita has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.en: Jose lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras, where he sells plastic goods at an open-air market. Jose has run this small business for the past eight years and has developed a solid customer base. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase plastic containers, bowls, coat hangers, buckets, trash cans, and strainers.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en: The picture above belongs to Matilda. She sell groceries in Kwaprow near Abura. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a welder.  Matilda's grocery shop is about 6 years old. She assists her husband in taking care of the home. Her loan will be used to obtain additional groceries for resale. Her future plans for her business is to establish another shop in a different locality.

loans.use: buy more groceries to resell

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is a 51-year-old lady. She is married to Musa, who is 56 years old. They have six children: Fony, 26, and Yane, 24, and also Nini, 22 and Jemris, 20, who are both are studying at a local University. Remi, 18, graduated from Senior High School, and Risat, 16, is studying in Senior High School. Hilaria also adopted a young girl, namely Imel, who is 4 years old. 

Hilaria lives with her family in a simple house. She is responsible for providing for her family, since her husband had a stroke almost a year ago. In order to earn more income Hilaria is running a brick business. She has been involved in the business for two years. It is located at her house. From the business she also assists the youth in her village by employing 4 laborers so they can earn money for themselves. She started this business by using her own capital. 

Hilaria plans to expand this business by purchasing the basic materials such as sand, cement and soil. Unfortunately, she doesn’t have adequate capital to do so. Fortunately, she met TLM’s loan officer who introduced her to TLM’s Individual Lending Program. She is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000. She hopes that TLM will approve her loan application.

loans.use: to purchase the basic materials such as sand, cement and soil.

loans.name: Las Fundadoras De Miguel Grau Group

texts.es: L. señora Ruth tiene 51 años, pertenece a L. alcancía “Fundadoras D. Miguel Grau”, el nombre le pusieron por que ellas eran las primeras personas en poblar L. zona en L. que actualmente están viviendo, L. clienta tiene 3 hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, para poder seguir apoyando a sus hijas confecciona pulseras artesanales que son tejidos a mano, empezó ayudando a otras personas, pero ahora L. señora contacta a los compradores y elL. realiza L. negociación pudiendo así tener mas ingresos y dando trabajo a personas que como elL. en algún momento solo otorgaban servicios D. tejido. L. clienta desea el crédito para capital D. trabajo ya que tiene un pedido granD.. Las socias agradecen a Edaprospo.
texts.en:
Señora Ruth is 51 years old.  She belongs to the communal bank “Fundadoras D. Miguel Grau” ("The Founders of Miguel Grau"); they gave it this name because these were the first people to populate the area where the members currently live.

The client has three school-age children.  In order to continue supporting her children, she makes hand-woven crafted bracelets.  She began by helping other people, but now the señora contacts the buyers and does the negotiation herself, so she can earn more income and proviD. work to people who, like herself at this moment, are only providing weaving services.

The client is requesting the loan for working capital, as she has a large order to fill.

The members are grateful to Edaprospo.

loans.use: to grow her business making hand-crafted bracelets and buy materials.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa was born in Ilagan Province of Isabela. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children.

At present, Luisa lives in the same community where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities. She buys pigs and resells them later. Luisa needs a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy piglets to raise.

Luisa is a very hardworking mother. In the future, she plans to establish a new business for additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets for her business

loans.name: Octaviano

texts.es:
El Señor Octaviano tiene 52 años y está casado con la Señora Hermogena que tiene 43 años, ellos tienen 2 hijas de 26 y 16 años.
El Señor Octaviano se dedicaba a la venta de frutilla ambulante, un día decidió comprar dos cajas de media y vender juntamente con la frutilla, las dos cajas de media las vendió en medio día, como le fue muy bien con las medias decidió seguir con esto. El Señor Octaviano en la actualidad ademas de tener su pequeño puesto de ventas donde vende todo tipo de cosas, como ser billetera, lentes de sol, pilas, cintos de cueros, remeras. Mas adelante quiere seguir ampliando su stock de los productos que vende.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de billeteras, lentes de sol, pilas, cintos de cueros, y demás para la venta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Octaviano is 52 years old and is married to Hermogena who is 43 years old. They have two daughters who are 26 and 16 years old. 

Octaviano made his living as a street vendor selling strawberries. One day he decided to buy two boxes of stockings and sold them along with strawberries. He sold the two boxes of stockings in half of a day. Since it went very well with the stockings, he decided to continue with this. Currently Octaviano, in addition to having his small stand where he sells all types of things such as wallets, sunglasses, batteries, leather belts, and t-shirts, would like to expand his stock of products sold.

He is requesting a loan to buy wallets, sunglasses, batteries, leather belts, and other things to sell at his business.

loans.use: to purchase wallets, sunglasses, batteries, leather belts, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La señora Beatriz es una clienta que se dedica a la venta D. condimentos y especias, estas ventas las realiza en las distintas provincias que cuenta la cuidad D. La Paz, su labor empieza D. horas 5:00 am hasta las 14: 00 pm aproximadamente. La  señora Beatriz es viuda hace ya tres años, nos cuenta que fue difícil soportar  la perdida D. su esposo y que con el trabajo que realiza y el apoyo D. su familia,  pudo superar esta perdida, no cuenta con hijos en edad escolar, pero si con  nietos a quienes cuida y entrega su amor por las tardes. La señora Beatriz vive en la ciudad D. el Alto-La Paz, Bolivia Su mayor sueño es que algún día llegar a ser una empresaria en la venta D. especias y exportar a otros países estos productos y estos condimenten sus alimentos con los deliciosos condimentos Bolivianos, con el dinero del crédito comprara condimentos (ají, comino, especias en general), es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a client who sells condiments and spices. These sales are carried out in the different provinces of La Paz department. Her work begins at 5:00am. and ends at approximately 2:00pm. 

Beatriz has been a widow for three years now. She tells us that it was difficult to bear the loss of her husband. With the work she does, and the support of her family, she managed to overcome this loss. She doesn't have school age children, but she does look after her grandchildren in the afternoon, and gives them her love.  

Beatriz lives in the city of El Alto-La Paz, Bolivia. Her greatest dream is that some day she will become an entrepreneur in the sale of spices, and export these products to other countries, so that people in those countries can season their food with delicious Bolivian spices.

She will use the loan to buy condiments (chili pepper, cumin, and spices in general). She is a very hard-working person, and grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: To buy condiments (chili pepper, cumin, spices in general).

loans.name: Samia

texts.en:
Samia is a 50-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of eight children. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase an incubator for her chickens. 

Samia is looking to improve her business and expand her project space.

loans.use: to purchase an incubator.

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
Santusa pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Santusa tiene  50 años de edad y es viuda pero tiene cinco hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Apurímac y desde hace 50 años vive en la ciudad de Salvación y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de golosinas como por ejemplo galletas, chicles y tortas. Ya son vaR. años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Santusa requiere el préstamo para comprar más golosinas y su sueño de ella es la abrir una tienda de abarrotes. 

Santusa agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Santusa belongs to the “Tesoritos del Manu” communal bank.  The bank’s meetings take place monthly in the city of Salvación in Manu Province, Madre de Dios Department.

Santusa is 50 years old and a widow; she has five children.  She was born in the city of Apurímac but has lived in the city of Salvación for 50 years where she carries out her economic activities.  Her main economic activity is the sale of snacks like for example: cookies, chewing gum and cakes.  She’s been in this business for several years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion Santusa needs the loan to buy more snacks; her dream is to open a grocery store.  Santusa is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy more snacks.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Dania Mercedes

texts.es: De Ocotal municipio de Nueva Segovia , es originaria Dania, de 33 años de edad, casada, madre de  1 hijo , ella emigro a la ciudad de Estelí en busca de un futuro mejor , ella empezó vendiendo joyas de plata en su  pueblo pero le recomendaron que se fuer a la ciudad de Estelí donde el comercio de ropa generaba ganancias y se fue probar suerte con lo que tenia ahorrado lo invirtió en comprar ropa nueva para vender. Ahora lleva 5 años dedicándose al comercio, tiene una pequeña tienda frente a uno colegio primaria mas populares de la ciudad de Estelí donde los gritos, risas y juegos son parte de las vivencias del día a día en su tienda. Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar mercadería de blusas, colonias, zapatos, pantalones, camisetas, gorras, calcetines para niños y niñas. Esta inversión le ayudara a mantener surtida de ropa nueva para vender durante estos mese en que las ventas aumenta y necesita vende mercadería nueva para poder sacar adelante su negocio y mejorar cada día su tienda, cambiar su nivel de vida, vivir honradamente.
texts.en:
Dania is originally from Ocotal, in Nueva Segovia.  She is 33 years old, married, and has one child.  She emigrated to the city of Estelí in search of a better future.  She started out selling silver jewelry in her village but they recommended that she go to the city of Estelí where selling clothes makes  profits and so she decided to try her luck.  She invested her savings in buying new clothes to sell.  Dania has now been in her business for 5 years.  She has a small store opposite one of the most popular primary schools in the city of Estelí where shouts, laughs and games are part of everyday life in her store.

Dania requested this loan to buy merchandise (blouses, shoes, pants, t-shirts, caps and socks for boys and girls).  This investment will help her to keep her business stocked with new clothes so that she can sell during these months when sales increase.  She needs to sell new merchandise in order to be able to make progress in her business, continue to improve her store, change her standard of living and live decently.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (blouses, shoes, pants, t-shirts, caps and socks)

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 52 years old, married, and has five children. He was raised by his parents in the farming business. With his farming business, Alberto is be able to send three of his children to school, while the other two have their own families. 

Alberto is requesting a loan for 15,000 PHP, which he will use  to purchase corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers and pay for labor costs needed in planting. He wants to improve his business.

Alberto hopes his children complete their education until they earn degrees. He said that he will be the happiest father if they find a better job someday.

loans.use: to purchase corn seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers and pay for labor needed in planting.

loans.name: Juntos Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Karin Consuelo tiene 32 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos aún menores de edad. Ella forma parte del grupo "Juntos al Progreso" formado por 9 integarntes, caracterizados por la lucha constante mediante el trabajo para poder salir adelante y progresar, asimismo es la tesorera del grupo.
Hace cuatro años inició su negocio de venta de ropa, comprando al por mayor y ofreciendo a sus amistades y familiares, poco a poco fué aumentando su mercadería y su clientela, le ha ido bien pero aun considera que podría lograr un poco más teniendo mas capital para invertir.
Le gustaría poner un puesto de bazar en un mercado cerca a su domicilio donde se ve bastante consurrencia de público.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de ropa, ya que se acerca la fiesta de navidad y la celebración de año nuevo aprovechará para colocar sus prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Karin Consuelo is 32 years old and has two dependent children.  She is a member of the 'Juntos al Progreso' group which has 9 members.  The group's members work hard in order to get ahead and make progress in life.  Karin is also the group's treasurer.  

Karin started her clothes selling business four years ago, buying her products wholesale and offering them to her friends and family members.  She gradually increased her merchandise and her customer base.  Her business has done well but she still believes that she could achieve more by having more capital to invest.

Karin would like to set up a stall in the market near her home where there are a lot of customers.

Karin will invest her loan in buying clothes as the Christmas season and New Year's celebrations are approaching and she will make the most of this in order to sell her clothing.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothes for the Christmas season

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Proyecto 2003 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

La señora Jacqueline es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy cumplidas y ordenadas, ella estaba en otro banco hasta que con otras socias crearon este banco ya que está más cerca de su casa. Tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 5 hijos, tres mayores y dos de 12 y 9 años de edad, tres viven en su casa y estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa, allí  vende todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes y legumbres, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su negocio cuando están desocupados. Tiene más de 13 años con su negocio y  gracias a su tienda a salido adelante y con esto ha ayudado a sus hijos en sus obligaciones, ella empezó su negocio con un crédito que recibió del banco.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, legumbres y otros víveres.

Su meta es ver que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Proyecto 2003 Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Jaramijo (Manta) canton, a place known for its pretty beaches that bathe the coastline of this beautiful place.  Here the majority of the residents are very hardworking and work in maritime jobs.

Jacqueline is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is the president of the same, and she likes it because her companions are polite and organized.  She was in another bank until she and other members started this one because it is closer to her house.  She is 43 years old and married, and from this relationship she has five children, three older ones and two 12 and 9 years old; three live at home and study in high school and elementary school.  Her husband is a driver. 

She has a grocery store in her house.  There she sells all types of household necessities such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, and vegetables.  She works every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes later.  Her children help her in her business when they are not busy.  She has had this business for more than 13 years, and thanks to her store she has gotten ahead and so has helped her children in their duties.  She started her business with a loan she received from the bank.

She is going to use this loan to stock her store more.  She will buy rice, sugar, detergent, vegetables, and other provisions.

Her goal is to see that her children are good professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergent, vegetables, and other provisions.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is a married woman who has four children. Marieta is 45 years old and resides at Mobod, Oroquieta City, Philippines. 

Marieta owns and operates a charcoal business to earn a living and she's been in this business for nine years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase wood & wood-related products needed in charcoal making.

In 2010, Marieta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to purchase wood & wood-related products needed in charcoal making

loans.name: Esthela Del Pilar

texts.es:
Esthela es una mujer de 27 años, muy responsable, trabajadora y le gusta lo que hace. Esthela es soltera y vive con su hijo de tres años en Pelileo que está ubicado a 20 minutos de Ambato en la provincia de Tungurahua.

Esthela trabaja sola en la confección de jeans para niños y adultos, este negocio es el único sustento económico que tiene para mantener a su familia es por eso que lo realiza con mucha responsabilidad. Es el quinto año consecutivo que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito actual es para la compra de una máquina overlook, maquina que ayudará a Esthela a optimizar sus recursos, mejorando la calidad y por ende sus ventas futuras e ingresos futuros. Estos ingresos ayudarán a solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Esthela tiene el sueño de comprarse un terreno para poder ingresar en el negocio de crianza y venta de animales como cerdos.
texts.en:
Esthela is a 27 year old, responsible, hard-working woman who likes what she does. Esthela is single and lives with her three year old son in Pelileo which is located 20 minutes from Ambato in the province of Tungurahua.

Esthela works alone making jeans for children and adults. This business is the only economic support that she has to maintain her family so she does it with much responsibility. This is the fifth consecutive year that she has worked with Fodemi. The current loan is to purchase an "overlook" machine. The machine will help Esthela to opimize her resources, improving the quality and hence future sales and future income. This income will help her pay her bills.

Esthela has a dream to buy land to be able to invest in the business of raising and selling animals, like pigs.

loans.use: to buy an "overlook" machine since this will optimize resources and improve the quality of her product.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 42 years old and lives in Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Felicidad has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Felicidad has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Felicidad hopes to have a fishing boat to earn money.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tessito De Bantagnel 02 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe tessito a été créé le 24 Août 2011 lors de l’inauguration leur Banc villageois. Jouissant d’une ambiance parfaite pour un bon travail, ce groupe est composé de 19 membres qui  vivent dans un même quartier. Leur  activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Diénabou (assise à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans, est  mariée et  mère de quatre enfants. Elle est vendeuse de tissus au comptant ou par placement à crédit pendant deux mois. Elle est très dynamique et pratique cette activité pendant plus de quatorze mois. Au par avant elle vendait des rafraichissements. 

Son nouveau crédit va lui permettra d’acheter des tissus destinés à la revente.

Les retombées de cette activité lui permettront d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge scolaire et alimentaire des membres de la famille.

loans.use: lui permettra d’acheter des tissus destinés à la revente.

loans.name: Soda's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Village qui abrite ce groupe a été crée le 21 décembre 2009. Les membres s'activent dans le petit commerce, la couture et la teinture.
Maguette, âgée de 47 ans, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est mariée et mère 03 enfants dont les plus âgé a 22 ans, le cadet 10 ans et le plus petit 03 mois. 
Avec le prêt, elle compte acheter des tissus qu'elle va revendre au marché et dès fois même les clients la trouvent chez elle. Elle achète pour 09 kg de tissus à 5000 F le kg. Elle a une très bonne expérience dans ce domaine car cela fait maintenant plus de deux ans qu'elle s'active dans ce secteur.
Les bénéfices lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille et aussi de meubler sa chambre.
texts.en:
The 'banc villageois' that houses this group was created on December 12, 2009. The members are active in small-scale commerce, sewing, and dyeing cloth.

Maguette, 47 years old, is standing at the right with her hand raised. She is married and the mother of three children. The oldest child is 22 years old, and the others are 10 years old and 3 months old. 

With this loan, Maguette intends to purchase some cloth that she is going to resell at the market and sometimes to customers who find her at home. She purchases 9 kg of cloth at 5,000 francs per kilo. She has very good experience in this domain for having been active in it now for over two years. 

The profits will enable her to support her family and also to furnish her bedroom.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to sell

loans.name: Veronca

texts.en:
The propritor of VMENS LINX is accredited by the Local Authority in her area for the immense contribtion to the district for providing quality but cheap and affordable clothing to inhabitants of communities in the district she operates. Using the TEACH Lending model techniques, she has taught her staff to adhere strictly to the 7 principles of basic hygiene. They have applied these basic principles which have enabled the firm to increase their sales turnover within the last 6 months.

Mrs M. is requesting $1050 KIVA loan. If provided this sh would purchase a second washing and drying machine to support thr expansion of her operations

loans.use: WASHING & DRYING EQUIPMENT

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is married with four children. She lives in the Vituka area of Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. Her two sons are in secondary school. Anna is self-employed and owns a shop near her residence. The shop sells different consumable items, mainly food, which have high demand. Anna is an opportunistic type of person, and she cannot let the opportunity go. She opened this shop six years ago after learning that people in her area had to travel a long way to market for food items. The shop provides her with an income to raise her children, as her husband's income alone cannot meet all family requirements. She would like to expand her business so that she can meet the costs of educating her children. The shop employs her and her sister. To expand her business Anna needs USD 550.

loans.use: Add stock of goods.

loans.name: Metrine

texts.en: Metrine is married with two children who are both in primary school. She is a trained hair dresser. She started her business in 2004 in order to supplement her earnings. Through her business, she has been able to support her family financially. Her husband is not employed. She is an active member of the community’s HIV/AIDS education group. With the loan of $150 from PEMCI, Metrine wishes to increase her stock of cereals and groceries to enable her to earn higher profits. Through her business, she has been able to provide for her family and also the community as a whole through her contributions in the HIV group.

loans.use: Boost Cereals trading and Grocery Business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 25 years old and has a bakery in the Kikruk market. His brothers work with him and he is responsible for supporting a big family. He is applying for a loan of $1200 from Al-Aman to purchase new oven for his shop. He is hoping for a good future, and to develop himself and improve his family's living standard.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase  new oven

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Simona is married and has three daughters, two of whom are are still single. Her husband is retired; the pension that he receives is very small and it was difficult to be able to cover the basic necessities of their family. For this reason Simona started her own business with the sale of natural products and food supplements four years ago. She is a very hard working woman and her liking for sales has permitted her to increase her number of customers quickly.

To be able to cover the demand and increase her sales Simona now is asking for a loan of $650 that she pledges to repay in six months. You can help this family, contributing to the growth of their business. They are very grateful for your confidence and support.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Simona es casada y tiene tres hijas, dos de ella aún solteras, su esposo está jubilado, la pensión que recibe es muy baja y difícilmente podía cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, por esta razón Simona inició su propio negocio con la venta de productos naturales y suplementos alimenticios hace cuatro años, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y su gusto por las ventas le ha permitido incrementar su número de clientes rápidamente.

Para poder cubrir la demanda e incrementar sus ventas ahora Simona está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Tú puedes ayudar a esta familia contribuyendo al crecimiento de su negocio, ellos agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: Purchase of Merchandise - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Mrs. Ngozi O. is 29 years old, married with three children, and lives in the town of Asaba in Delta State. She needs a loan of $800 to buy drinks, meat for cooking, and a refrigerator for cooling her drinks for sale. She started this business 1996 and has been with LAPO for 7 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks, meat, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Taing

texts.en:
Mrs. B. Taing, 44, has been married for 22 years. Her husband is a fisherman. He fishes in the river around his village, for their own food and also for sale. They have four sons and one daughter, three of whom are attending the local school. Taing learned to weave in 2004 from a neighbor. After training for a year, her skill level was good enough to start weaving independently. Now she has been weaving on her own for three years.

Taing is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA, in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials, sewing thread and pay for the preparation of her loom.

loans.use: Buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 57 year-old Elizabeth M.. She is married with five children, aged 6, 7, 12, 14, and 18. In 2000 Elizabeth established a small shop selling general items, and now requests a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional supplies. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies

loans.name: Sheyla

texts.es:
Three years ago, Ms. Sheyla F. started selling juice and soft drinks in the city of Chinandega in order to support her son and her elderly father.

It is important to note that this type of business is very competitive because there are many other similar entrepreneurs in the area.

Ceprodel has provided Ms. F. with support for a year now, offering her a total of 6 loans that she has utilized to make repairs on her business space and push her business forward because it so urgently needs it.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace tres años, en la ciudad de Chinandega, para poder mantener a su hijo y a su anciano padre, la señora Sheyla F. inicia un negocio de venta de gaseosas y jugos con su poco capital que tenía.

Es necesario destacar que este tipo de negocio es muy competitivo por el hecho de que la señora Sheyla se expone primeramente a la fuerte competencia que hay a sus alrededores.

Desde hace un año, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora Sheyla con la realización de 6 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para darle mantenimiento a su localidad y seguir esforzándose por sacar adelante su negocio que tanto lo necesita

loans.use: Purchase of juice and soft drinks

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu sells food items in the market of Makeni town of Sierra Leone. With the help of several small loans from SMT, she has diversified her business and can now rent a stall in the market.

Kadiatu is an honest and loyal client of SMT who meets her repayments on time. She is currently requesting a larger loan of US$ 350 to expand her business further. SMT recommends her with pleasure to Kiva for the loan.

Kadiatu is 25 years old and married with 3 children. Her business is the main source of income for the family. Kadiatu was successful in the recent expansion of her business and would benefit greatly from additional capital to continue the pattern of growth.

loans.use: to further expand her little market stall

loans.name: Afaf

texts.en: Afaf is 52 years old and lives and works in the town of Nabatieh in south Lebanon. She produces pickles and jams for a living, and sells her products to her neighbors. This is the first time Afaf has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She will use the money to buy the provisions she needs to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy provisions for her business

loans.name: Forba John

texts.en:
John N. is married with five children. He has been a man who struggled with poverty from childhood. Facing the costs of educating of his kids, he decided to work hard to give his family a higher standard of living.

With this new loan, he plans to invest in motorbike transport and pig farming. He knows his motorbike transport business will succeed because the service is sorely needed in his community. He has been farming pigs since 1998 and knows how to succeed in this business as well.

He plans to repay the loan in 24 months. The first installment is due on the fourth month from the date the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of motorbike and piglets

loans.name: Orzigul

texts.en: H. Orzigul is 47 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Ahror, her son, age 24, just received his bachelor’s degree in Journalism and her daughter Zebo, age 15 is in school. She started her business because she needed extra income to be able to pay for household and personal expenses. Six years ago she began selling kids clothing. She is requesting a loan of 200 $ US Dollars, which she will repay over 3 months, to purchase more clothing and have a greater inventory.  Orzigul would like to express her gratitude to everyone supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell to expand the business

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah A. lives in Imude, Lagos State, Nigeria where she sells provisions and kerosene. She is 40-years-old, married and has four children.

Deborah has owned this business for the past six years. She has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past two years and is now requesting a loan buy more kerosene, provisions and food stuffs to improve her business inventory and increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: To purchase more food, provisions and kerosene for resale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E. is 43 years old and married with 4 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She sells provisions and drinks. She learned this business herself. She started this business in 2005. She is a LAPO client. She needs a loan in the amount of US$ 450 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. With this she hopes to satisfy her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Камалова Мавджуда жительница города Турсунзаде. Возраст 34 года , замужем, имеет 2 детей.Образование среднее .Клиентка занимается куплей продажей  детской одежды. Она имеет небольшую торговую точку на рынке « Саховат» . Торговля помогает тей содержать семью. В данный момент Мавжуда хочет увеличить ассортимент тороговй точки. Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavjuda K. lives in Tursunzoda. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children. She completed high school. Mavjuda sells children's clothing from her small stall at the Sakhovat Market. Her business helps support her family. Now Mavjuda wants to increase the inventory at her stall. She will pay back the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand market stall inventory

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: El domicilio de la sreñora Maria Luisa P. A., se encuentra ubicado en la Zona de Alto San Pedro, una de las zonas más tradicionales de la ciudad de La Paz. La señora, se dedica a la producción de ropa en tela de vicuña, y al tejido de chales y carteras en macrame, el material que utiliza es la cola de rata; esta mercadería es exportada a Europa, además de venderla en el mercado interno; actividad que viene realizando desde hace 20 años. La Señora vive con sus dos hijas, es viuda desde hace varios años; el crédito en esta oportunidad será invertido en la compra de materia prima, ya que tiene bastantes trabajo por fin de año, la sra. trabaja con emprender hace 3 años.
texts.en:
The home of Señora Maria Luisa P. A. is located in the zone of Alto San Pedro, one of the most traditional zones in the city of La Paz. The Señora makes clothing from vicuña fabric (a llama-like animal of the central Andes that yields a soft wool) and shawls and handbags made of macrame, the material that they use is ribbon. This merchandise is exported to Europe and also sold in the internal market, something that has been going on for twenty years. The Señora lives with her two daughters. She has been a widow for many years. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw material now that she has enough work for the end of the year. The Señora started this undertaking three years ago.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Material

loans.name: Uon

texts.en:
Uon K. is 27 years old and lives in the Siem Reap Province with her husband and one child. She has been working as a tailor since 2005, and works out of her home earning on average $5 per day. Her husband Lim Doeun is 29 years old, and works as a tuk-tuk driver (a tuk-tuk is motorbike pulled seated cart used as transportation/taxi by people in Cambodia) earning on average $5 per day. Their child is too young to go to school. Their household expenses are about $170 per month.
Uon K. is requesting a loan through Kiva’s field partner CREDIT – Micro Finance Institution. CREDIT-MFI has a repayment rate of 99.8% with a portfolio at risk 30+ at 0.33% (taken from their 2007 Annual report). CREDIT – MFI structures their non-agriculture Kiva loans with a declining balance interest rate.  Agriculture loans are structured as balloon repayments with monthly interest rate payments and principle repayments at the end of the loan.

loans.use: Uon Khin is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a sewing machine to expand her business by increasing her inventory.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 53 años  y es madre de un hijo mayor que tiene familia, es casada y junto a su esposo se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales para engorde, ella inicio con este negocio cuando tenia 22 años de edad y al mismo tiempo puso su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles inicio su negocio y compro chanchos y ovejas al que actualmente se dedica.

Con el préstamo  que recibirá de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas comprara 01 par de ovejas de raza.

Su deseo es continuar con la crianza de animales y mejorar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria is a member of the Communal Bank 'Espíritu Santo' of the Centro Poblado de Chimbo, district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 53 years old and is a mother of one grown up son who has a family of his own. She is married and together with her husband, they own a business where they raise and fatten livestock. She started this business when she was 22 years old; at the same time she established a store where she sold groceries. With her first loan of 300 Soles, she started her business and bought pigs and sheep- this is her livelihood today. With the loan she will receive of 500 Soles, which will be paid in 4 installments, she will purchase a pair of pedigree sheep. Her dream is to continue raising livestock and to better her income.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep

loans.name: Jeannette Akagbe

texts.fr: Née en 1960 à Accra, madame J. A. est mariée à un mécanicien auto et mère de six (06) enfants. Elle aide son mari à travers son petit commerce de préparation et de vente de la bouillie « zogbon » à base de maïs. Elle fait souvent face à des ruptures de stock en produit de base et sollicite un financement pour constituer un stock suffisant de maïs.   Ce commerce lui permet beaucoup d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille et dans la scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en:
Born in 1960 in Accra, Ms. J. A. is married to an auto mechanic and is the mother of six. She assists her husband with her small business making and selling "zogobon" cornmeal porridge. She often faces inventory shortages of essential ingredients and is requesting financing to build a substantial inventory of corn. This business very much enables her to help her husband address the needs of the family and the children's schooling.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock corn for making and selling porridge

loans.name: Voeung

texts.en: Voeung C. is 57 years old and lives on an island in the Mekong River not far from Phnom Penh.  She lives with her four sons, three daughters, and husband, who she married in 1978.  While her husband and sons work as house builders, Voeung has been a silk weaver for almost two decades.  Having learned the trade from her mother, she is now teaching silk weaving to her daughters.  After producing the fine cloth, Voeung sells the product to a merchant who resells it in the markets of Phnom Penh.  In order to diversify their family's employment, however, Voeung is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase pigs and materials for her son's business.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for domestic use.

loans.name: Yolanda Felicita

texts.es:
Yolanda vive en una zona de Comas desde los inicios de este distrito y cuando nadie quería vivir allí. Vio los alrededores desarrollarse, y desde hace ocho años tiene un restaurante conocido y muy apreciado por la zona: ‘La Esquina del Sabor’.

No siempre ha estado dedicándose a este negocio, antes tenía un salon de belleza, pero tuvo que dejarlo por que cayó enferma. Una vez que volvió a trabajar lo hizo a través de la venta de comida. Eligió este tipo de trabajo para no dejar solas sus hijas que en ese tiempo tenían siete y ocho años. Empezó vendiendo papas rellenas y tamales los días domingos al vecindario. A medida que se pasaba la voz de la buena sazón de su comida, su negocio fue creciendo.

A sus cincuenta años Yolanda es separada. No obstante tiene un buen restaurante y dos hijas ya mayores, una de ellas ahora trabaja de profesora. 

Yolanda recibe préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace casi dos años, y las ganancias de su negocio las invierte en la mejora de la cocina del restaurante y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Yolanda lives in an area of Comas, where she has lived since the beginning of the district, when nobody wanted to live there. She saw the outskirts develop, and has had a restaurant, well known and appreciated by the district, for eight years. The restaurant is called La Esquina del Sabor. She has not always owned her restaurant. Before she opened her restaurant she had a beauty salon, but had to leave because she fell sick. Once she returned to work she began selling food. She chose this type of work because she couldn't leave her seven and eight year old daughters alone. She began selling filled potatoes and tamales to the neighborhood on Sundays. Because of the good seasoning of her food, her business has grown. At her age of fifty, Yolanda is now separated from her husband. Nevertheless, she now has a good restaurant and two daughters, who are now older, one of which is working as a teacher. Yolanda has received loans from EDAPROSPO since almost two years ago, and the profits of her business are invested in the improvement of the kitchen of her restaurant and her home.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operación de su hija menor y techado de su casa

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is married to Henaro L. and they are gifted with four children: Gina - 28 years old, working as a domestic helper abroad; Jimmy L. - 26 years old, high school undergraduate; Romelo - 22 years old and Natalia - 17 years old, a first year college student. They are living a simple life in the village of Marabulig 1 in Cauayan City. 

Anita sells RTW’s including doormats for almost a year.  In a week, she was able to earn at least PHP1,000.  She wants to expand her business for it to become progressive, thus, she wanted to borrow a loan of PHP25,000 so she can buy stocks of RTW that she can sell in their community. Her business right now is their major source of income than their farming activity.  This has been a great help in providing the needs of their family and education of their children.  

Anita believes that every person she meets contributes for her personal transformation.  This is the reason why she enjoys dealing to different type of people with her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of RTW

loans.name: Adiara

texts.fr:
Madame  Adiara Berthé a 54 ans et réside avec son époux et leurs 6 enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, Adiara s’est initiée dans l’activité de teinture et vente de bazins qu’elle a apprise  auprès d’une camarade il y a plus de vingt ans. Après avoir teint les bazins, elle coût quelques pièces en chemise masculine qu’elle  revend. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement de voyageurs et de routiers) pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis plus de six  ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 9ème prêt individuel,  tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 10 pièces de bazins blancs, 10 boîtes de teintures de couleurs différentes, 10 paquets de soudes caustiques et quelques pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale du Mali)  et effectue sa vente  dans sa boutique située au cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, rembourser les intérêts du prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Adiara Berthé, age 54, resides with her husband and their six children in Sanoubougou I, one of the working class districts of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having lacked the chance to continue in school due to societal reasons, she got introduced to the dyeing and selling of damask fabrics. This is something she learned from a friend over twenty years ago. After dyeing the damask, she sews a few pieces into men's shirts that she then sells. She is in high demand by her customers (composed essentially of travelers and bus drivers) for the quality of her products.

Concerned with satisfy her growing number of customers better, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso over six years ago. After several solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her area, she is now on her ninth individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. She intends to use this loan to buy ten bolts of white damask, ten boxes of dyes of different colors, ten packets of caustic soda, and a few bolts of Wax pagnes (colorful West Africa cloth). Supplies are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali), and sales are made in her shop located in the heart of the Sikasso bus station.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 300,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment her working capital, to help cover family expenses, to pay the loan interest, and to invest the rest her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy damask fabric, caustic soda, dyes, etc.

loans.name: Houda

texts.en:
Houda has been working as a seamstress for twenty two years. Her clients are her friends and neighbors as well as shops. Houda is 54 years old and lives in Saida, Southern Lebanon with her husband and their child.

Houda decided on doing this business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. Her business has done well right from the beginning. She has been a microcredit client for 8 years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loan helped her improve her work. She is requesting a loan of $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new sewing machine. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

loans.use: To  purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn T. is 50 years old and she lives in Speu village in Takeo province. She is a widow with nine children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while two others are cow middlemen and the remaining are attending the local school.

Mrs. Morn T. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She is applying for a loan to buy more cows to expand her children’s business in order to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more cows for breeding

loans.name: Hold Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
This is Esther B., Zainab B., Isatu G., and Kadiatu K.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka. They called their group Hold Sorbeh. This group has received several loans from SMT/Kiva. These loans have made massive contributions towards the well-being and development of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of SLL 3,600,000 to further strengthen their businesses. 
Esther B. (second from right) is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age forty and married to a businessman. The two of them have four children. Two of her children are in primary school and two are in secondary school. Esther has been a businesswoman since childhood. She sells dried fish. She will invest the entire loan in her dried fish business. A basket full of dried fish usually costs SLL 500,000.

loans.use: Invest in her dried fish business

loans.name: Leynie

texts.en:
Leynie lives in the village of Cabaruan, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 22 years old and married to Edgar A. who is 23 years old and employed as a restaurant cook. The couple is already blessed with one child, baby Shayna who is 2 months old.

Leynie has seen her neighbor’s success with a Kiva loan and thinks that she too can use one to her advantage. She is requesting to borrow PHP 5,000. She believes that through the loan she can add things to her store that will help her expand her business.

She started her store two years ago because she wanted to be able to have a higher income for their child and future children. She also wanted her business to expand into other services such retailing cell phone minutes. At the moment, Leynie’s family lives with her parents since they don’t yet have enough savings to build their own house.

loans.use: To add things to her store and expand her business

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en: Mavlyuda is married and has five children. A college graduate, she runs a small business selling men’s clothing in the central city market in Dushanbe. She believes that one of the biggest advantages of her work is a flexible schedule that gives her the opportunity to take good care of her children. Mavlyuda has been in business for five years. She has promptly repaid a total of two loans from IMON International. Her attentiveness and creativity have helped her develop a good understanding of what her clients need and want. They always feel complimented when she goes out of her way to help them with their selections. This has naturally boosted Mavlyuda’s sales and led to growth in her business. Mavlyuda is requesting a loan of $3000 to enable her to significantly expand her business by purchasing a new vending facility. She is hoping to reinvest the generated income into further expansion of her business. She believes that consistent growth will help her provide a stable source of income and continue to secure her family’s well-being. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new vending facility

loans.name: Soklun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soklun B., 43, and her husband, Mr. Chanra Pao, 43, were married in 1989 and have one daughter who is in grade 11. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Soklun has been selling finished silk fabric for fifteen years. She buys it from silk weavers in her village for resale in Phnom Penh market. Her husband works at a government office concerning fisheries. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 to purchase more finished silk fabrics for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more finished silk fabrics for resale

loans.name: Sayeda Group

texts.en: Sayeda wants a loan for a bakery. Rowna wants a loan for a tailoring business. Sayeda is the leader of the two member Sayeda group. Each member wants to take a loan for expanding their business and they have requested a group loan of 14,000 afghani. They are thankful to AFS and Kiva lenders that are supporting poor people.

loans.use: To expand a bakery

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 23 and single. He owns a bakery store in Nabatiyeh (South Lebanon). He requests $700 in order to buy basic ingredients that allow him to continue working. Ali sells traditional Lebanese pastries such as Mankeesh and Lahmbaajeen and also some not-so-traditional dishes, such as pizza. This is Ali's second loan cycle with Al Majmoua.  Ali's future plan is to expand the store.

loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Johanna Patricia

texts.es: Johana patricia G. tiene 36 años de edad. Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y ambos estudian. Johana es una excelente cliente en Fundación León 2000 ya que se preocupa por mantener su buen record crediticio. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles ya que tenia pequeños a sus hijos y no tenía suficiente dinero para pagarle a una persona para que se los cuidara, por lo que tenía que salir a vender sus productos por la tarde a ofrecer sus productos, algunos veces viajaba con ellos, pero logro salir adelante a pesar de estas dificultades. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cremas, colonias, tratamientos, perfumes entre otras cosas. Su deseo es obtener un lugar propio para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Johana Patricia G. is 36. She is a single mother with two children who go to school. Johana is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000. She is conscientious about keeping her good credit record. She buys and sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for over 17 years. In the beginning it was very difficult. Her children were small, and she did not have enough money to pay someone to take care of them. She had to leave to sell her products in the afternoons. Some times she took her children with her. She was able to get ahead in spite of these difficulties. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy clothes, creams, colognes, treatments, and perfumes, among other things. Her wish is to get a place of her own to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: John Alikula

texts.en:
John Alikula is 47 years old and is married to Pasiliza Muhonja. John burns and sells charcoal. He has had this business for a while. His business is located in Eldoret.

John was introduced to KADET by a group member. He has applied for a loan to expand his charcoal business. With the extra profit, he plans to diversify into selling poultry and potatoes. John also has a garden. He plans to use part of the loan to prepare his garden for the next planting season. In the future, he wants to expand his farming business.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buying trees to burn into charcoal

loans.name: Rosamelina

texts.en:
Rosamelina B. is from the village of Salimpuno. She is 54 years old. Rosamelina is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosamelina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting  a cassava for sale. Rosamelina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Rosamelina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosamelina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Rosamelina is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to invest in their cassava plantation. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosamelina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest for cassava plantation project

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a 35 years old widow with two children aged 15 and 17 years.  All of her children go to school. She resides and rents a two roomed house where she is staying with four people. Besides her children, Rehema does not take care of additional family members. She is a tailor in Mengo, sewing dresses and school uniforms.  She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for three years, servicing her sixth loan.  She doesn’t pay rent for her business premises because she works from her home. Rehema sells to all categories of people in both retail and whole sale volumes. She buys her supplies of clothing material from the Kampala city shops and most pay transport costs to and from shopping. Her challenges include transportation and the rainy season, as she works from an open place. Rehema wants to use this loan to buy more clothing material.She aspires to see her business grow stronger and of owning a fashion and designing shop.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of clothing materials

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 44 years old, and she is married with 7 children. She sells rubber shoes, umbrellas, and utensils like cooking pots in her stall. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes to be a major distributor of utensils in her community in the future. She is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more utensils to sell. She hopes to attract more customers to her stall. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils to sell

loans.name: Mia

texts.en:
Mia L. is from the town of Mahinog, Camiguin. She is 29 years old. Mia is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Mia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Mia has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Mia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business activities. Mia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Mr. Jaime E. works hard for his family. He is married and has four children. His oldest child is only 9 years old.

He started farming in 2006. He cultivates his land for rice crops. Aside from farming, he also raises pigs to have another source of income. Jaime has been a member of CEVI, a Kiva field partner, for three years now. He said that its program has really helped him a lot in his business. He is now requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP.

He will use this loan to buy crude oil for his tractor, farm supplies, and also to pay the laborers who help at his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay laborers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. She is married with 2 children and she is 45 years old. Her husband is a photographer and he also supports the home. She owns a grocery store where she sells groceries like biscuits, milk, soap, drinks and canned foods. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Naome

texts.en:
Naome P. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and beans and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and groundnuts to make paste to sell.  Naome is 26 years old and is married to a husband who is a policeman. She has 2 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a beauty salon.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy stock bags of rice and groundnuts to make paste to sell.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
El    Señor José del Carmen Loa isiga A., Labora como Secretario en el Departamento de Capacitación en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, ella tiene dos  hijos a su cargo, y  esto se encuentra en edad escolar, esta casada, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un  año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.  

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines por lo que va a cambiar el techo de su cuarto ya que este se encuentra en mal estado.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

 José dijo que gracias a los préstamos  otorgados por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. José del Carmen L. A. works as a secretary for the training department of the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. He is married and has two dependent children attending school. He has worked with CEPRODEL for the past year. During this time, he received a loan that was used to make improvements to his home.

The loan he is requesting now will be used to buy construction materials, such as zinc and crossbeams, to replace the ceiling of a room since the existing one is in bad condition. His objective is to provide greater security and better living conditions for his children. José thanks CEPRODEL for providing the loans that make it possible for him to make improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace a ceiling

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza G. is from the village of Punta Liloy. She is 35 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Riza owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Riza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Riza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Bendiya Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe  Bendiya ont en moyenne  30 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à Wela  dans la sous-préfecture de Konobougou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font l’achat et la vente d’articles divers tels les condiments alimentaires, les habillements,  les savons traditionnels,  les céréales  et  la restauration.
Après avoir correctement remboursés les  3 prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe Bendiya sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, une grande quantité de condiments alimentaires, des sacs de  céréales  et des ingrédients pour la restauration. 
Elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et  à Konobougou. Elles effectuent leurs ventes, à Wela, au marché de Konobougou ville et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of Bendiya Group, on average, are 30 years old and have two children. All of them live in extended traditional families in Wela in the subprefecture of Konobougou, fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They have known each other through family ties and are active in buying and selling various articles, such as food condiments, clothes, traditional soaps and cereals, and running a restaurant. After having repaid their previous three loans on schedule, the women of Bendiya Group apply for their fourth solidarity loan which they will use to buy large quantities of food condiments, bags of cereals and cooking ingredients for the restaurant. They get their supplies in Bamako, the capital of Mali, and in Konobougou. They sell their goods in Wela, at the market of Konobougou and at the surrounding trade fairs, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men. They expect to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs each. They will spend part of their profit on healthcare, food and school fees and reinvest part of it in their businesses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food products

loans.name: Adriana Del Socorro

texts.es: Adriana Del Socorro tiene 57 años, ella es muy buena persona pues tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, siempre se ha preocupado por pagar en tiempo y forma sus cuotas. Su actividad que es la venta de tortillas y además la elaboración y venta de comida demuestran lo emprendedora que es Adriana pues siempre mantuvo a sus 6 hijos, de una forma digna y responsable. Ella se levanta a las 5 de la mañana pues una persona tiene que ir al moler el maíz para tener lista la masa, después ella se encarga de la elaboración de sus tortillas, es una persona muy reconocida en su cuadra por sus vecinos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de cal, maíz, leña, bolsas plásticas entre otras cosas. Ella desea proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y tener una persona que le ayude a la elaboración de las tortillas.
texts.en:
Adriana Del Socorro, 57, is a very good person who has collaborated with Fundación León 2000 for a long time. She has always striven to make her payments in a timely fashion. She makes and sells tortillas and prepared meals. She has proven herself to be an enterprising woman for she has supported her 6 children in a dignified and responsible way. She rises at 5am because she has to go grind the corn to have the dough ready, then she makes the tortillas; she is very well-known on her block by her neighbors. She will use the funds to buy corn, firewood, lime powder and plastic bags, among other items. She wants to do some home improvements and to employ someone to help her make the tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lime powder, firewood, plastic bags, etc.

loans.name: Mareta

texts.en:
Mareta S. is 65 and married with 8 children (ages 28 - 42).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Mareta has 2 years of experience in this business.  Mareta needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

You can view pictures of a typical plantation in Samoa, taken by a Kiva Fellow, at:   http://picasaweb.google.com/agnes.p.chu/SamoanPlantation

In 2010, Mareta joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Mareta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Mareta S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.3 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy notebooks, perfumes and stuffed animals

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en: Gansuh is 28 and the married father of a seven year-old son. He and his family live in a ger (a Mongolian nomadic tent ) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Since 2008, Gansuh has operated a trading business and has been steadily expanding his business. Today, his working capital is 1,500,000 tugrugs (~ 1070 USD). His working capital has doubled since he opened his business.  Gansuh would like to expand his product line with new goods from China to provide a wider selection for his customers. He has started to build a house for his family, and successfully operating his business will allow him to finish building the house. He has a great business mind and is focused on  the future. Gansuh would like to open his own shop in the future. He is requesting a 600,000 tugrug (~ 450 USD) loan to purchase additional inventory in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase inventory.

loans.name: Felicitas' Group

texts.en:
Felicitas S. is from the village of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. She is the leader of a nine-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Felicitas is 35 years old, married, and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food and drink in the local community. Felicitas has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Felicitas joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
