Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: Eldaniz Z. is a 35 year-old man who, for the last two years, has breed cattle. He is married and has an adorable daughter. Eldaniz sells cattle to the local butchers and once in a month he goes to the livestock bazaar to sell his calves for a more profitable price. He is asking for 800 AZN to purchase three baby calves.

loans.use: To purchase three calves.

loans.name: Las

texts.en:
Las V., 23, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products.

V. raises pigs at home for an income of USD 2.30 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of about USD 3.20 per day. V. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more pig feed for her pigs.

In the future, V. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her fourth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more pig feed

loans.name: Mamusu Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the Mamusu group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. Fatmata K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. This 35-year-old is married to a businessman and they have two children. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for many years now. She bakes and sells breads. Fatmata will be using this loan to buy bags of flour, yeast, sugar, etc. In this way, Fatmata will be able to bake a good number of breads for sale. 

The members of this group are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of 1,200,000 leones each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, yeast, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phally C. is 36 years old and is the group leader of the loan having been selected by its four members which located in Svay Ta Ok village, Kandal province. With the loans, the members of this group will use it to purchase supplies, equipments and other items to support their different purpose. 
Mrs. Phally C. is farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate vegetable for a living. Her husband, Mr. Lok Khoem, is a police officer where he can receive a small salary to support his family living. Mrs. Phally C. now is requesting for a loan from AMK to buy tiles for her house floor. This couple has three children, two are students while the youngest one is 4 years old.

loans.use: To buy tiles for her house floor

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy P., from the barangay of Baybay Sta. Cruz, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, is 33 years of age, married, and blessed with four children. To make a living, she has operated a sari-sari store for 4 years, earning approximately Php 5,000.00 a month . She is also receiving support from her husband.

In 2010, Nancy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC under the Regular Loan Program, she is now requesting a loan of 15,000 Php to be used as additional capital for her store. Nancy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family by meeting their basic needs, save for future use, and finance the children’s education, loan repayments, insurance and possible business expansion.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store business

location.town: Ozamiz - Baybay Sta. Cruz, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is married with four children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members.

Harriet owns a beauty salon in Busega, in Lubaga Division, Kampala district, and works upon all types of hair, like relaxing, plaiting, hot combing and weaving. Harriet wants to use this loan to buy more boxes of hair relaxers, cosmetics and weaves. She receives an average of 10 customers a day. She buys boxes of cosmetics from Kampala city shops, and uses public transport to and from shopping. Besides this salon business, she has started selling second hand clothes at her salon to get additional income. She works seven days a week.

Her business challenges includes transportation of boxes of cosmetics, relaxers, and weaves from Kikuubo to her salon in Busega. She aspires to going directly to manufactures for cosmetics. She decided to join MCDT because she wanted to acquire additional capital for her business. Harriet resides in, and rents, a two roomed house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics, weaves, and hair relaxers.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djiguiya, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, sous préfecture de la région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce, de condiments alimentaires, du bois de chauffe et des gâteaux (friandises).
Ces femmes du groupe Djiguiya sont à leur neuvième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les huit précédents. 
RAMATA F. du groupe Djiguiya compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des paquets de condiments alimentaires.
Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises le plus généralement à Bamako et effectue sa vente sur place, au marché de Fana et dans les foires environnantes, au comptant, en détail et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités de commerce.
texts.en:
The women of the Djiguiya group, all married, are on the average 46 years old, with 4 children. They all live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana, the sub-prefecture of Koulikoro, the second administrative region of the republic of Mali. These women know each other as relatives and friends; their line of business is selling food condiments, heating wood and cookies (sweet treats). They are now on their ninth solidarity loan, having duly repaid eight previous loans. Ramata F., one of the group members, plans to use her loan to purchase packs of food condiments. She generally stocks up in Bamako and sells from home, at the Fana market and the local markets, retail, for cash and on credit, to a client base composed of both women and men. She plans to achieve a monthly income of 60,000 West African Francs, which will be used towards everyday family expenses, with the rest reinvested in her business.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing food condiments

loans.name: Karina Ysabel

texts.es:
Karina es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Karina tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos y accesorios de carros, actividad que inicio hace 4 años.
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas y solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de fajas.
Karina sueña con construir su casa porque vive en la casa de sus suegros y ampliar su negocio con la implementación de un taller.
texts.en:
Karina lives with her common-law husband and has two children who are in school. Karina rents a store where she sells spare parts and car accessories. She started doing this four years ago. Karina is a member of the "Las Golondrinas" ["The Swallows"] communal bank and she is requesting a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy timing belts. Karina dreams of building her own house, because she currently lives in her in-laws' house. She also dreams of expanding her business by opening a workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy timing belts

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Labora para UPONIC como conductor soltero  no tiene personas a su cargo solicita para compra de cin parra cambiar parte del techo ya q ue se encuentra en mal estado y en invierno es problema por lo que este primer crédito que me otorgan será de mucho beneficio .
texts.en:
He works for UPONIC (Nicaragua Popular University) as a driver.  He’s single and doesn’t support anyone else.

He needs to buy zinc metal sheeting to repair his roof which is in poor condition and problematic in winter.

“This is the first loan I’ve been granted and it will be very beneficial.”

loans.use: To buy zinc metal sheeting for roof repair.

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Maria S., from the village of Old San Mariano, is the 55-year-old group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Maria S..

Maria, who is married and has five children, runs a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting her sixth loan for 5000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. Maria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 34 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano, Isabela

loans.name: Javzanpagma

texts.en: Javzanpagma B. is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her two children, ages 12 and 15, both attend a local secondary school, while her husband is a carpenter and produces a variety of wood products in their home. Javzanpagma has been operating a household goods trading business at the local market in her town since 2010. For the future, Javzanpagma hopes to expand her business and have her own shop. She is a very hardworking and friendly woman. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase more products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more products

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr: Monsieur Souleymane D. est un jeune qui travaille comme vendeur dans une quincaillerie.Il exerce parallèlement un métier d'électricien. Ainsi, Monsieur D. sollicite ce prêt pour l'acquisition et le renforcement de nouveaux produits ce qui lui permettra de pouvoir répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle
texts.en: Mr. Souleymane D. is a young man who works as a salesman in a hardware shop. He has a parallel business as an electrician. Mr. D. is requesting this loan to acquire and strengthen his stock of new products, which will enable him to better respond to his customers' demands.

loans.use: Purchasing stock for his hardware business

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Mwanaisha operates a restaurant business, cooking rice and beans, chapati (flat bread) for sale. Her potential customers are laborers from a nearby business. She  faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business.  

With a loan of Kshs 20,000 Mwanaisha wants to purchase sacks of maize, rice, wheat flour and cooking oil. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of maize, rice, wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zumrathan's Group

texts.en:
Zumrathan A., 43, is the leader of this group.   She is a widow and is raising two daughters and a son.  Both the children are in school. 

In order to earn money to cover family expenditures, Zumrathan sells convenience goods and earns 5000 soms per month. This profit made it possible for her to make house repairs.  She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase more goods to sell in order to increase the turnover of her business.  In the future Zumrathan wants to expand her business, and provide her children a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl M. is from the town of Talibon. She is 28 years old and married. She owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells various kinds of products. She hopes for her store to grow. Her husband operates a motorcycle-transport service. Cheryl and her husband work hard to build their businesses and have a stable income.

Cheryl joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cheryl is requesting a new loan of 6,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Cheryl from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: Gregorio, de 49 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Fidelia (50) y su joven hijo, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Cuando era niño, los padres de Gregorio le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha café y plátanos, y luego las comercializa en el mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia; y ya lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil consiste en cuidar sus productos de las plagas, es por esta razón que labora con mucha dedicación. Desea con muchas ganas, comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda transportar sus productos.Este es el sétimo préstamo de Gregorio con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y promete serlo en esta ocasión. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras.Gregorio tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados en la compra de mayor cantidad de  abono que necesita para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Gregorio, age 49 años, is a very humble and hard-working man who lives in his own home with his wife Fidelia (50) and his young child, to whom he wants to offer a better quality of life. When he was a child, Gregorio's parents taught him everything he needed to know about farming. Bit by bit, with the passing of time, he has taken over his parents' land.

He now has vast farmlands, in which he cultivates coffee and bananas. He later sells them in the Pichanaki city market. He most enjoys working his lands, as this is the work that provides his family with food. He has been doing this work for 12 years, and he finds that his greatest challenge is keeping his crops safe from plagues. For this reason, he works with a great deal of dedication.

He really wants to buy a car with which to transport his products. This is his seventh loan from MFP, and he has always been very punctual in the payments of his quotas. He promises to be so again with this loan. In his community bank, he is very united with the rest of the members. Gregorio plans to invest the requested 500 soles in the purchase of a larger quantity of fertilizer, which he needs to improve his crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer to improve his crops

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio vive en casa de sus Padres cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, zona Huayna Potosi. El tiene una tienda comercial a la vez vende celulares en la ciudad de El Alto, su esposa tiene la mima actividad comercial. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene dos hijos. 
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de calaminas, clavos y vigas para reparar los techos de la casa, lo cual le permitirá mejorar su habitat.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro.
texts.en:
Julio lives in his parents’ house, which is located in the city of El Alto in the Huayna Potosi zone.  He has a commercial store, and he also sells cell phones in the city of El Alto.  His wife has the same commercial activity.  It is the main source of income that provides financial support.  He has two children.

The loan is to buy corrugated roofing, nails, and beams to repair the roof of the house.  This will allow him to improve his dwelling.

This is his first loan with Impro.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair the roof of his parents' house

loans.name: Kennedy Ole

texts.en:
Kennedy Ole T. is 35 years old, married to Naimodu T. and the father of four children. Kennedy is a farmer and he works on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last four years.

He learned about KADET LTD from a campaign done by the KADET staff. This will be his second loan and he is planning to buy farm supplies. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climate conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land where he can plant more wheat for commercial use and to buy his own farm machinery. He is a hardworking man who is focused to his set goals.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 43-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a candle making business and a general store.  She lives in Danao City, Cebu. Martina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2010 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Martina has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,600 uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her third loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 to use as additional capital for candle-making so that she can continue to save up for future education and expansion of her business. Martina is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: Additional working capital for candle making

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a forty nine year old married man with seven children living in his own house with a dream of educating his children to attain a degree as minimum qualification. For thirty years he has been working in the agricultural sector and the proceeds have enabled him to pay school fees for his children. He has challenges of price fluctuations and in future he wants to be a specialized commercial farmer. Francis needs the loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: Buying maize for planting.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Feria Libre, vive por el barrio San Martín en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de su centro histórico, su belleza natural, su variedad en la gastronomía la que cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños y por su gente que es muy amable y cordial.

Doña María tiene 69 años, está separada y tiene 11 hijos de los cuales  8 son casados e  independientes, sus 3 hijos solteros trabajan y ayudan  económicamente. Con su trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña María se dedica a la venta de papas con cuero (plato típico), vende este producto en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca y labora de lunes a sábados. Para la preparación de este plato se levanta a las 4 de la mañana y trabaja  hasta que termine de vender su producto.  En su casa cría cuyes y gallinas a los cuales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica. En el tiempo que pasa en casa también se dedica a la atención de una pequeña tienda, la misma que tiene hace un año y medio.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 12 años y los créditos le han beneficiado mucho en sus negocios, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un quintal de arroz, papas, cuero de chancho y más productos que necesita para la elaboración de sus platos.
 
Su sueño es hacer una casa pequeña en un terreno que tiene y allí poner su tienda y ampliarla.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Feria Libre” (Open Fair). She lives in the San Martín neighborhood in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for the richness of its historical center, its natural beauty, and the variety of cuisines that captivate the palates of locals and foreigners alike. The people are extremely friendly and cordial.

Doña Maria is 69 years old, separated from her spouse, and has eleven children. Eight of them are married and independent, while the other three are single, working, and helping her financially. Through work and sacrifice, Maria was able to build her own home.

Doña Maria sells a traditional dish called “papas con cuero” (potatoes with pork skins). She works Monday through Saturday selling her product in central Cuenca. In order to prepare this dish, she wakes up at 4am and continues to work until she finishes selling her product. At home, she raises guinea pigs and chickens to sell whenever there is a financial need. While she is at home, Maria also manages a small store that she opened a year and a half ago.

Maria has been with the Communal Bank for twelve years and the loans have been a great benefit to her businesses. This new loan will be invested in the purchase of a quintal of rice (1 quintal = 46kg), potatoes, pork skins, and other products that are needed to prepare her dishes.

Her dream is to have a small structure on her property where she can move her store and expand it.

loans.use: To purchase rice, potatoes, pork skins, and other supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Moeurn was born in 1984. She is a mother of two children who are too young to work or study. She and her husband, Mr. Dy, are both farmers.  Mr. Dy is also a fisherman. They own a small piece of land where they grow rice, some of which they sell, and some of which they use to support their family. The couple have some problems because their field is not producing as it should in this dry season. So to improve rice production, Mrs. Moeurn is seeking a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: to buy rice seed, fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
La señora María Leticia es una mujer muy trabajadora; desde hace 5 años instalo a las afueras de la casa su propio negocio que es de pulga, que solo pone los fines de semana y para tener un ingreso más vende conos de nieve ya que en esta temporada en esta ciudad son muy altas lastemperaturasg y son muy buscados este producto.
Para que su negocio crezca y sea prosperado necesita comprar mayor mercancía como lo es ropa, zapatos  de segunda mano al igual comprar la nieve y conos. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y ofrecer a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Leticia is a very hard-working women. For the past five years she has been setting up her own outdoor store in a flea market. She sells only on weekends only and to increase her income she also sells snow cones because during this time of year it can be very hot in the city and they are a very sought after product. 

In order to increase her business and to be successful, María Leticia need to buy more merchandise such as second hand clothing and shoes as well as ice and cones. By doing so she will have an increased income to be able to help her husband with the household expenses and to offer her three children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa es un cliente de 38 años de edad, vive con su madre y hermana  en el distrito de Jayanca – Lambayeque. La actividad principal de esta comunidad es la agricultura y crianza de animales. También existen restaurantes campestres conocidos, por su buena sazón, alrededor de la ciudad. Sin embargo, la actividad a la que se dedica Rosa es la venta de ropa.

Desde hace 1 año Rosa se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir en los distintos sectores de la ciudad de Jayanca. Éste negocio le ha traído nuevas  satisfacciones, ya que es un negocio adicional al trabajo que ella desempeña para una empresa. 

Rosa ya cuenta con clientela fija en su zona y es por ello que desea ampliar su negocio. Rosa solicita un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de prendas de vestir y calzado, que sus clientes están esperando. Este será  uno de los primeros pasos que Rosa dará para expandir su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 38 year old woman who lives with her mother and sister in the district of Jayanca, Lambayeque. The principal activity in this community is agriculture and livestock farming. There are also country restaurants around the city that are well-known for their delicious recipes.
But Rosa's business is clothing sales.

For the past year Rosa has been buying and selling articles of clothing in the different sectors of the city of Jayanca. This business has brought her new satisfaction, especially because it is an additional business to her employment in a company. 

Rosa has a stable client base in the region and for this reason she wants to expand her business. Rosa requests a loan of 1500 neuvos soles to invest in the purchase of clothing and shoes, items which are being requested by her clients. This will be one of the first steps Rosa will take to expand her business and to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina es una madre soltera D. 29 años D. edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que lucha día a día para darles las comodidades necesarias a sus 2 hijos. Esta familia vive en una comunidad rural del distrito D. Olmos en Lambayeque.

La actividad  a la que Carolina se dedica es la venta D. prendas D. vestir. Esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 4 años en su domicilio y recorriendo los alrededores D. su comunidad. Cuenta con clientes fijos que le hacen constantes pedidos y están contentos con el servicio que ella brinda.

Carolina solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que utilizará para la compra D. prendas D. vestir que le permitirán renovar su mercadería y  cumplir con los pedidos D. su clientela.

Carolina desea realizar mejoras en su hogar y el crédito solicitado le permitirá aumentar sus ventas para realizarlos. Ella es un cliente antiguo para nuestra entidad  y sus créditos los ha cancelado puntualmente.
texts.en:
Carolina, aged 29, is a single mother. She is an enterprising woman who struggles every day to proviD. her two children with all they need. The family lives in a rural community in the district of Olmos in the province of Lambayeque.

Carolina sells clothes. She has carried out this activity for four years so far, both at home and walking from door to door in her neighborhood. She has regular customers with constant demands and they are pleased with the provided service.

Carolina applies for a loan of 1500 new soles from the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to buy clothes and renew her inventory in order to satisfy the demand of her customers.

Carolina wants to make improvements in her house. The requested loan will enable her to increase her sales and earn the necessary means. She is a long-standing client of Edpyme Alternativa and has repaid her previous loans on schedule.

loans.use: to buy clothes to renew her inventory.

loans.name: Digna Esperanza

texts.es: Digna Esperanza se dedica a la venta de comida, la ubicación de su negocio es cerca del mercado. Ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy humilde pues tener este medio de vida, ha sido muy importante para mantener a su familia. Uno de los mayores desafíos que enfrenta es la compra de de los alimentos pues tiene que salir a los departamentos a buscar estos productos de manera más favorable. Este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, verduras, bolsas, platos desechables, cubiertos y otros productos.
texts.en: Digna Esperanza works selling food. Her business is located near the local market. She has shown herself to be a very humble person. Having this business has helped her to take care of her family. One of the biggest challenges is buying food and supplies for her business.  She has to go to other regions to find the products she needs at better prices. This loan is for the purchase of basic grains, vegetables, bags, disposable plates, silverware and other products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, bags, disposable plates, silverware and other products.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is  a farmer, aged 30, in the Litein area of South Rift Kenya. His farm produces maize and milk, which he sells to the local market.

Peter has made a loan request amounting to  50,000 KES to help him purchase a motorcycle, which will enable him to venture into the transport business. He says the business will enable him to earn more income and to purchase more dairy cows of quality breeds. He adds that this will, in the end, improve his living standard.

Peter is glad that Juhudi Kilimo provides agricultural loans, but notes that animal diseases remain the worst challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: to pay for a motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa Noelia

texts.es: Rosa Noelia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Es una persona muy trabajadora, dedicada a su familia y muy orgullosa de sus raíces. Tiene su familia, por lo que siempre esta preocupándose por brindarle lo necesario. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de bolsos, calzado, cosméticos, tratamientos, sabanas, toallas y ropa en general.  Desea poder seguir adelante con su medio de vida que es lo más importante.
texts.en: Rosa Noelia sells general merchandise.  She’s been in business for over four years.  She is a very hard working person who is devoted to her family and very proud of her roots.  She has her family so she is always focused on providing what they need.  The financing she’s requesting is to buy purses, footwear, cosmetics, treatments, sheets, towels and clothing in general.  She wants to be able to continue moving forward with her means of support which is what’s most important.

loans.use: to buy purses, footwear, cosmetics, treatments, sheets, towels and clothing.
